translated: the path of meditation that is with-outflows and the path of seeing that is without-outflows.

original: gang gi phyir bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa lnga'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa lnga'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The path of meditation is taught in terms of five aspects.

original: rmi lam gyi rnam pas rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam pas rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seeing of dreams in the aspect of dreams is not apprehended.

original: sgra brnyan gyi rnam pas sgra brnyan brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra brnyan gyi rnam pas sgra brnyan brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the expression of echoes in the aspect of echoes is not apprehended.

original: mig yor gyi rnam pas gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig yor gyi rnam pas gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reflection in the aspect of a reflection is not apprehended.

original: smig rgyu'i rnam pas chu 'bab pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i rnam pas chu 'bab pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the flowing water in the aspect of a mirage is not apprehended.

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pas mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pas mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Because the sign in the aspect of an illusion is not apprehended.

original: de ltar go rims bzhin du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gag pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs lnga po 'di dag rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang tshul bstun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar go rims bzhin du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gag pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs lnga po 'di dag rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang tshul bstun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in order, all phenomena are said to be “without an intrinsic nature,” “unproduced,” “unextinguished,” “primordially peaceful,” and “naturally extinguished.” These five stages of the contaminated path of meditation are compared to the examples of dreams and so on.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i mthong ba'i lam ni rnam par rtog pa drug spong bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i mthong ba'i lam ni rnam par rtog pa drug spong bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The path of seeing, which is the antidote to the obscurations to omniscience, is distinguished by the abandonment of six misconceptions.

original: rnam pa drug gang zhe na ;
analyzed: rnam pa drug gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the six aspects?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam pas /
translated: The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of defilement is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-defilement,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because non-defilement is not apprehended.🔽The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of purification is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-purification, because there are no sentient beings who are defiled.

original: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni rnam par byang ba med pa'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni rnam par byang ba med pa'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of the instinct for verbal expression is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-verbal expression, because there is no apprehension of the three.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of the instinct for verbal expression is explained by the statement:

original: gos pa med pa'i rnam pas nam mkha' dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //🔽gzugs @121a * //
analyzed: gos pa med pa'i rnam pas nam mkha' dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //🔽gzugs @121a * //
translated: By the aspect of non-verbal expression, because there is no apprehension of the three.🔽The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of the instinct for verbal expression is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-verbal expression, because there is no apprehension of the three.🔽The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of the instinct for verbal expression is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-verbal expression, because there is no apprehension of the three.🔽The statement that it is distinguished by the abandonment of the misconception of the instinct for verbal expression is explained by the statement:🔽By the aspect of non-verbal expression, because there is no apprehension of the three.

original: la sogs pa'i 'du shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa yongs su spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /🔽spros pa med pa'i rnam pas spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i 'du shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi spros pa yongs su spong bas gang gsungs pa ni / spros pa med pa'i rnam pas spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is stated by the complete abandonment of the discrimination of conceptual thought, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is by the aspect of non-conceptualization, because all conceptual thoughts are thoroughly crushed.

original: rang gi rtogs pa la ro myong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rlom pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa la ro myong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rlom pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: That which is stated by the complete abandonment of the conceit of the experience of one's own realization,

original: rlom sems med pa'i rnam pas rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i rnam pas rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is by the aspect of non-conceit, because all conceits are thoroughly crushed.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bas gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: That which is stated by the complete abandonment of the discrimination of falling away,

original: mi g-yo ba'i rnam pas rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rnam pas rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is by the aspect of non-wavering, because the dharma-element is just stable.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa bshad zin to /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all modes have been explained.

original: // / lam shes pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / lam shes pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of paths should be stated.

original: de la bden pa rnams kyi go rims ni don ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams kyi go rims ni don ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The order of the truths should be understood just as it is in terms of their meaning.

original: don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is their meaning?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the side of affliction and purification,

original: kun 'byung dang lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: kun 'byung dang lam gyi bden pa dag ni rgyu yin la /
translated: the truths of origin and path are causes,

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa dag ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: and the truths of suffering and cessation are results.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: This is because:

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin ;
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin ;
translated: The cause, path, suffering, and cessation🔽are respectively

original: / de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: / de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: five, and sixteen.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni dkyus ma yin no //
translated: The term “aspects” is the standard.

original: de la rgyu ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa sred pa yang 'byung ba can yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa sred pa yang 'byung ba can yin te /
translated: Among them, the cause is craving, which is accompanied by aspiration, attachment, and delight.

original: gang gi phyir 'dun pa'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dun pa'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: Because the antidote to aspiration is taught as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pas 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pas 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: because attachment is not observed in the aspect of freedom from attachment.

original: byed 'dod pa'i dngos po'i bsam pa ni bsam pa yin pas na /
analyzed: byed 'dod pa'i dngos po'i bsam pa ni bsam pa yin pas na /
translated: The intention of the thing that is desired is the intention.

original: 'dun pa'i skabs su 'dod chags gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de med na cig shos kyang med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i skabs su 'dod chags gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de med na cig shos kyang med par bstan to //
translated: Since desire is primary in the context of desire, it is shown that when one does not exist, the other does not exist.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: What is taught as the antidote to attachment

original: gnas med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: is because all phenomena are nonconceptual in the aspect of nonabiding.

original: chos rnams la chags pa med pa nyid la dgongs nas 'dod chags kyi skabs @121b su dngos su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'dun pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de med na cig shos kyang med par bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams la chags pa med pa nyid la dgongs nas 'dod chags kyi skabs @121b su dngos su 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas 'dun pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de med na cig shos kyang med par bstan to //
translated: Considering the absence of attachment to phenomena, since desire is primary in the context of attachment, it is shown that when one does not exist, the other does not exist.

original: 'di dag ni dngos po phan tshun rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dngos po phan tshun rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: These are things that mutually follow each other,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are concomitant.

original: sred pa'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sred pa'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: The antidote to craving is stated as follows:

original: zhi ba'i rnam pas chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pas chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the aspect of peace, because all dharmas are thus fully enlightened without distortion.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is stated.

original: sred pa ni gtsor nye bar zhi ba yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: sred pa ni gtsor nye bar zhi ba yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Because craving is primarily the pacification of the object.

original: kun 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kun 'byung ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kun 'byung ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The origin is threefold by the division of the origin of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: de'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: The antidote to that is stated as follows:

original: 'dod chags med pa'i rnam pas 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i rnam pas 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the aspect of non-desire, because desire is not observed.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i rnam pas zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i rnam pas zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the aspect of non-hatred, because hatred does not exist.

original: gti mug med pa'i rnam pas mi shes pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gti mug med pa'i rnam pas mi shes pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By the aspect of non-delusion, because all darkness of ignorance is dispelled.

original: rab tu skye ba ni kun tu rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni kun tu rtog pa yin te /
translated: Origination is imagination.

original: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because desire, etc. arise from that.

original: de'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni /🔽nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam pas yongs su rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gang gsungs pa ni / nyon mongs pa med pa'i rnam pas yongs su rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The antidote to that is stated:

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because of the absence of conceptualization through the aspect of the absence of defilement.

original: rkyen ni sems can du mngon par zhen pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ni sems can du mngon par zhen pa 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin te /
translated: The condition is the belief in the reality of things, i.e. the belief in the self of personality,

original: don med pa thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the condition for all misfortune.

original: gnyen por gsungs pa ni sems can med pa'i rnam pas sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyen por gsungs pa ni sems can med pa'i rnam pas sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The antidote to that is stated: because of the non-apprehension of sentient beings through the aspect of the absence of sentient beings.

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the aspect of the absence of desire,

original: sems can med pa'i rnam pa'i bar ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang yin pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang / kun 'byung gang yin pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rab tu skye ba gang yin pa kun du rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa'i rnam pa'i bar ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gang yin pa 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dang / dga' ba dang / kun 'byung gang yin pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rab tu skye ba gang yin pa kun du rtogs pa dang /
translated: up to the aspect of the absence of sentient beings, the cause is the will, desire, joy and origination which are desire, hatred, delusion and conceptualization respectively.

original: rkyen gang yin pa sems can du mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gang yin pa sems can du mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: The condition is the belief in sentient beings.

original: gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
analyzed: gsum dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
translated: Three, three, one, and one.

original: rnam pa brgyad ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la brten par bshad pa yin no //🔽lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bdun gyi @122a * //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la brten par bshad pa yin no // lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bdun gyi @122a * //
translated: These eight aspects are explained as being based on the truth of origination.

original: dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The following is stated with reference to the seven aspects of the truth of the path:🔽The aspect of the path is stated as follows:

original: tshad med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: “All phenomena are devoid of the process of origination because of the infinite aspects.”

original: de ni ldog pa'i phyogs thob par byed pa yin pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de ni ldog pa'i phyogs thob par byed pa yin pa nyid kyis na /
translated: This is because the path is the very means of attaining the side of cessation.

original: sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the very means of opening up the opportunity for infinite sentient beings.

original: go skabs 'byed pa de ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: go skabs 'byed pa de ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis yod pa yin pas /
translated: This opening up of the opportunity is the means of attaining the two extremes of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: mtha' gnyis dang 'brel ba'i rnam pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang 'brel ba'i rnam pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ...because the two extremes of cyclic life and of final nirvāṇa are not objectified by the aspect of connection with the two extremes, is the explanation.

original: rigs ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ...because all things are not different by the aspect of undifferentiated lineage, is the explanation.

original: tha dad pa med pa ni yang mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni yang mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The statement, ...because it transcends the levels of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha by the aspect of non-differentiation, which is the absence of grasping at the extreme of differentiation, is the explanation.

original: bzlog na ni /
analyzed: bzlog na ni /
translated: If it were the opposite of that,

original: phyogs gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur bas ma lus par gtogs pa'i rigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur bas ma lus par gtogs pa'i rigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be differentiated because it would be one-sided, and therefore it would not be the reasoning that is included in its entirety.

original: sgrub pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ...because all conceptual thoughts are not objectified by the aspect of non-conceptuality, is the explanation.

original: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the absence of the conceptual thought of action,

original: rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa'i yul rtog par byed pas na sgrub pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba rtogs pa'i yul rtog par byed pas na sgrub pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is a practice because it is the object of realization that causes the realization of what is to be realized.

original: yang ji ltar na de la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de la bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is there no conceptualization of action in that?

original: gzhal du med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad kyi tshad ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad kyi tshad ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, “Because the measure of all phenomena is not apprehended by immeasurable aspects.”

original: thob pa yongs su yang ba dang ma thob pa la dman pa dang mchog tu gyur pa rnam par rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nges par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: thob pa yongs su yang ba dang ma thob pa la dman pa dang mchog tu gyur pa rnam par rtog pa med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nges par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The nonconceptualization that precedes the attainment of the purification of what has been attained and the inferiority and superiority of what has not been attained is:

original: chags pa med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is said, “Because all phenomena have the nature of space through the aspect of nonattachment.”

original: rtogs pa de dang de la nam mkha' ltar ma chags pa'i chos nyid nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa de dang de la nam mkha' ltar ma chags pa'i chos nyid nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas yin no //
translated: That realization is the definitive emergence that takes as its domain the nature of nonattachment to all phenomena, like space.

original: des na tshad med pa'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: des na tshad med pa'i rnam pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, beginning with the immeasurable aspect,

original: chags pa med pa'i bar 'di rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed par byed pa'i lam gang yin pa dang / @122b ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed par byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i bar 'di rnams ni go rims bzhin du sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed par byed pa'i lam gang yin pa dang / @122b ji ltar sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed par byed pa dang / rigs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: These seven aspects of the truth of the path are, respectively, the path that opens up opportunities for all sentient beings, how it opens up opportunities for all sentient beings, the logic,

original: ji ltar rigs pa yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa yin pa dang / sgrub pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa yin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: how it is logical, the practice, how it is practiced, and the definite emergence.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gnyis dang / gnyis dang ; gnyis dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gnyis dang / gnyis dang ; gnyis dang / gcig dang / gcig ste /
translated: These are the two natures, two, two, one, and one.

original: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa bstan pa rnam pa bdun du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi bden pa bstan pa rnam pa bdun du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the truth of the path is explained in seven aspects.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lnga'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lnga'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin /
translated: The five aspects of the truth of suffering are stated in terms of the five aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Because of the aspect of impermanence, all phenomena are not endowed with destruction.

original: 'dus byas rnams ni 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ldan pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ldan pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because compounded things are by nature perishable, and so there is no point in being attached to them.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas chos thams cad lhag par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas chos thams cad lhag par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because all things are devoid of attachment due to the aspect of suffering.

original: de rnams la mi be bar phyin ci log pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la mi be bar phyin ci log pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no sign of the error of attachment to them.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten par byed pa'i bdag dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dri tsam yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten par byed pa'i bdag dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dri tsam yang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because all things are devoid of attachment due to the aspect of emptiness, i.e., because there is not even the mere trace of a self that is the support and that is connected with them.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de rnams ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de rnams ni rang nyid bdag ma yin pas so //
translated: because all things are devoid of attachment due to the aspect of nonself, i.e., because they are not themselves a self.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bdag med pa de nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa de nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That selflessness is the absence of characteristics, because all phenomena are signless.

original: de rnams ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid bdun du byas pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa rnam pa bzhi dang de rnams kyang gang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid bdun du byas pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa rnam pa bzhi dang de rnams kyang gang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
translated: Since these are taken as the seven characteristics of cessation, they are the four aspects such as impermanence and the nature of those.

original: de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la brten pa'i rnam pa lnga brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la brten pa'i rnam pa lnga brjod pa yin no //
translated: These are said to be the five aspects based on the truth of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bcu drug brjod par bya'o //🔽de la 'gog pa lnga las gang gi phyir nang gi bdag nyid can la sogs pa'i dngos po'i dbye bas /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bcu drug brjod par bya'o // de la 'gog pa lnga las gang gi phyir nang gi bdag nyid can la sogs pa'i dngos po'i dbye bas /
translated: The sixteen aspects of the truth of cessation should be explained.

original: dngos po 'gog pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po 'gog pa rnam pa gsum gsungs pa ni /
translated: Among them, from the five cessations, the three types of cessation of things are stated due to the classification of internal nature and so on.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas nang gi chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas nang gi chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is stated from the aspect of internal emptiness because all internal phenomena are unobservable.

original: phyi stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas phyi'i chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam @123a * //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas phyi'i chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro // phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi rnam @123a * //
translated: Because of the aspect of external emptiness, external phenomena are not apprehended.

original: pas phyi nang gi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pas phyi nang gi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of the aspect of internal and external emptiness, internal and external phenomena are not apprehended.

original: mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen por btags pa 'gog pa ni rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen por btags pa 'gog pa ni rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The eight kinds of cessation that are imputations are antidotes to the eight kinds of clinging.

original: de la stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation that is an antidote to clinging to emptiness is as follows.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin ta /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin ta /
translated: Because of the aspect of the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness is not apprehended.

original: lta ba'i gnyen por ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnyen por ni stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because emptiness is the antidote to views.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation that is an antidote to clinging to the shape of the physical cosmos is as follows.

original: chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chen po stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chen po stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because of the aspect of the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of the great is not apprehended.

original: 'di'i dbyibs su bkod pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dbyibs su bkod pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the shape of that is not a real entity.

original: don dam pa la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation of attachment to the ultimate is

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas don dam pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas don dam pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: because the emptiness of the ultimate is not apprehended by way of the aspect of the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: don dam par ni gnyen po yongs su grub pa med pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: don dam par ni gnyen po yongs su grub pa med pa'i don gyis so //
translated: In the ultimate, the antidote is not established, because it does not exist.

original: 'dus byas la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation of attachment to the conditioned is

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: because the emptiness of the conditioned is not apprehended by way of the aspect of the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas ni bzlog zla ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni bzlog zla ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conditioned is the opposite of that, it is dependent.

original: 'dus ma byas la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation of attachment to the unconditioned is

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: because the emptiness of the unconditioned is not apprehended by way of the aspect of the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas la bzlog zla la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la bzlog zla la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: because the unconditioned has a counter-correlate that is dependent.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of adherence to the extreme of eternalism and nihilism is stated in the passage that begins, “Due to the emptiness of the transcendence of the extremes, the transcendence of the extremes is not apprehended,”

original: chos nyid ro gcig pa nyid kyis na mtha' gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽thog ma dang tha ma dang 'dra bar 'khor bar mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid ro gcig pa nyid kyis na mtha' gnyis kyi rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro // thog ma dang tha ma dang 'dra bar 'khor bar mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: because the two extremes are not the basis for differentiation due to the single taste of reality.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of adherence to the beginning and end of cyclic existence is stated in the passage that begins, “Due to the emptiness of beginningless and endless cyclic existence, beginningless and endless cyclic existence is not apprehended,”🔽because cyclic existence is not the basis for differentiation due to the single taste of reality.

original: @123b thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang 'dra bar dbus kyang chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @123b thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang 'dra bar dbus kyang chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as there is no beginning or end, so too the middle is born in accord with the nature of reality.

original: rtogs pa la mang du byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can dor ba med par mngon par zhen pa de 'gog pa yang dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyi rnam pas /
analyzed: rtogs pa la mang du byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can dor ba med par mngon par zhen pa de 'gog pa yang dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyi rnam pas /
translated: The non-abandonment of the factors of enlightenment that are cultivated in realization is characterized by non-abandonment. The negation of that is the emptiness of non-abandonment.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the emptiness of non-abandonment is not observed.

original: de rnams ni gzings dang 'dra ba nyid kyis spangs bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni gzings dang 'dra ba nyid kyis spangs bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are like a raft, they are to be abandoned.

original: byed pa po'i 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa po'i 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation of the agent

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas /
translated: is by means of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the emptiness of intrinsic nature is not observed because compounded and uncompounded phenomena are not observed.

original: rang bzhin ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature is that it is not created by any noble being.

original: yul du 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni rnam pa gsum las btags par 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yul du 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni rnam pa gsum las btags par 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of the error of objects is from among the three types of error. The refutation of the error of imputation is stated in the line “because phenomena are not observed due to the aspect of the emptiness of all phenomena.”

original: chos thams cad 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all phenomena are mere errors.

original: mtshan nyid 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas rang gi mtshan nyid dben pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'khrul pa 'gog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas rang gi mtshan nyid dben pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of the error of characteristics is stated in the line “because the intrinsic identity is isolated due to the aspect of the emptiness of intrinsic identity.”

original: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dben pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dben pa yin te /
translated: Form is isolated by the characteristic of being suitable as form.

original: de ni 'dus pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dus pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a composite phenomenon.

original: dus su 'khrul pa 'gog pa yang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas dus gsum la dus gsum po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: dus su 'khrul pa 'gog pa yang mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas dus gsum la dus gsum po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te //
translated: The refutation of the error of time is stated in the line “because the three times are not observed due to the aspect of the emptiness of nonobservation.”

original: dus zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dus byas kyi tshig bla dags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dus byas kyi tshig bla dags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this so-called time is a synonym for the conditioned.

original: lnga pa rang gi ngo bo nyid 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: lnga pa rang gi ngo bo nyid 'gog pa ni /
translated: The fifth is the refutation of intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pas rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pas rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is stated: “Subhūti, because the intrinsic reality of non-things cannot be observed.”

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang rang gi ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po rnams shin tu ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang rang gi ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po rnams shin tu ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things, non-things, intrinsic reality, and extrinsic reality are not established at all.

original: 'di dag ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: These are from the perspective of the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: 'gog pa gang yin pa @124a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa gang yin pa @124a * //
translated: What is cessation?

original: nang la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / ji ltar zhi ba yin pa mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad dang bral bas dang / ji ltar gya nom pa yin par bzhin gyis dang / ji ltar nges par 'byung ba 'khrul pa rnam pa gsum bsal bas dang /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / ji ltar zhi ba yin pa mngon par zhen pa rnam pa brgyad dang bral bas dang / ji ltar gya nom pa yin par bzhin gyis dang / ji ltar nges par 'byung ba 'khrul pa rnam pa gsum bsal bas dang /
translated: It is sublime, free from the three errors.

original: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is the transcendence of suffering, the nature of non-entityness.

original: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gsum dang gcig ste /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsum dang / brgyad dang / gcig dang / gsum dang gcig ste /
translated: Thus, in this order, there are three, eight, one, three, and one.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i rnam pa bcu drug bshad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i rnam pa bcu drug bshad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: These are the sixteen aspects explained in relation to the truth of cessation.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the aspects of the knowledge of the path.

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects will be explained.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas thams cad mkhyen pa rnams pa gsum gyis rnam pa bsdus par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas thams cad mkhyen pa rnams pa gsum gyis rnam pa bsdus par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, from the perspective of all noble individuals, the knowledge of all aspects is subsumed within the three types of knowledge.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gi ;
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gi ;
translated: The three knowledges are divided

original: / lam gyi bden pa dang mthun pa //
analyzed: / lam gyi bden pa dang mthun pa //
translated: into the particular paths,

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas gzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas gzung ste //
translated: commencing with the applications of mindfulness,

original: tha ma sangs rgyas rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas rnam pa'i bar //
translated: ending with the Buddha natures.🔽The disciples, the Bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
translated: and the Buddhas have, respectively,🔽thirty-seven, thirty-four,

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //🔽sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi // sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
translated: and thirty-eight.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.🔽How is it?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The three knowledges are divided🔽into the particular paths,🔽commencing with the applications of mindfulness,

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
translated: ending with the Buddha natures.🔽The disciples, the Bodhisattvas,🔽and the Buddhas have, respectively,🔽thirty-seven, thirty-four,🔽and thirty-eight.🔽This is what is said.🔽How is it?🔽The three knowledges are divided🔽into the particular paths,🔽commencing with the applications of mindfulness,

original: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
translated: ending with the Buddha natures.🔽The disciples, the Bodhisattvas,🔽and the Buddhas have, respectively,🔽thirty-seven, thirty-four,🔽and thirty-eight.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de la lam gyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so // de la lam gyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is what is said.🔽Therein, the path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation that was previously explained.🔽The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning that was previously explained.

original: lam ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lam ni gsum ste /
translated: The path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation that was previously explained.🔽The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning that was previously explained.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation that was previously explained.🔽The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning that was previously explained.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation that was previously explained.🔽The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning that was previously explained.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation that was previously explained.🔽The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning that was previously explained.🔽The path of seeing is the path of seeing that was previously explained.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / lam shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam dang / de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa bdun las dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / lam shes pa nyid kyi lam dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam dang / de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa bdun las dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
translated: the path of the knowledge of all things, the path of the knowledge of path, and the path of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pas /
translated: Therein, the path of the knowledge of all things is sevenfold. The path of the thorough examination of things is the applications of mindfulness,

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: because of the non-apprehension of form, feeling, conception, volition, and consciousness as a basis.

original: des lus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lus la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it thoroughly examines the four things beginning with the body.

original: rtsol ba'i lam yang dag par spong pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: rtsol ba'i lam yang dag par spong pa bzhi ni /
translated: The path of striving is the four right efforts,

original: yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pas dge ba dang / mi dge @124b ba'i chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i rnam pas dge ba dang / mi dge @124b ba'i chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: because of the non-apprehension of virtue and non-virtue as a basis.

original: de ltar dngos po yongs su brtags nas des brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yongs su brtags nas des brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, having thoroughly examined things in that way, one strives with vigor.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni /
translated: The path of complete training in concentration is the bases of psychic power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'i rnam pas 'dun pa yang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba'i rnam pas 'dun pa yang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the bases of psychic power are not apprehended in terms of the aspects of the bases of psychic power, because aspiration, effort, mind and investigation are not apprehended.

original: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pa ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas des sems las su rung ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pa ni 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas des sems las su rung ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, complete training in the hindrances is the perfection of mental flexibility through aspiration and so on.

original: mngon par rtogs par sbyor bar byed pa'i lam dbang po rnams ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par sbyor bar byed pa'i lam dbang po rnams ni /
translated: The path of application to realization is the faculties.

original: dbang po'i rnam pas dad pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam pas dad pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that faith and so on are not apprehended in terms of the aspects of the faculties.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa na des 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa la bdag por gyur pa dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa na des 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa la bdag por gyur pa dro bar gyur ba dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, when concentration is completely trained, it is the dominant condition for the establishment of the noble path, because it applies heat and peak.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'brel ba'i lam stobs rnams ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'brel ba'i lam stobs rnams ni /
translated: The path of realization and the path of connection are the five powers.

original: stobs kyi rnam pas stobs lnga dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: stobs kyi rnam pas stobs lnga dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The five powers are not objects of observation of the five powers because they are aspects of power.

original: de ltar dbang thob pa ni des de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbang thob pa ni des de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one who has attained power is one who is engaged in the supreme mundane state and forbearance because he or she suppresses the discordant class of nonfaith and so on in order to realize the truths immediately after that.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
translated: The path of realization is the limbs of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The seven limbs of enlightenment are not objects of observation of the seven limbs of enlightenment because they are aspects of the limbs of enlightenment.

original: des dang por de kho na so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dang por de kho na so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he or she initially discerns thatness.

original: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
translated: The eightfold noble path is the pure path.

original: lam gyi rnam pas rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /🔽de'i gong du des bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pas rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te / de'i gong du des bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams kyi go rims ni 'di yin no //
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the path of no-more-learning, because it is the path of no-more-learning of the truths.

original: de de ltar byas na dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba'i lam dang / @125a * //
analyzed: de de ltar byas na dngos po yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba'i lam dang / @125a * //
translated: The path of preparation is the path of preparation, because it is the path that prepares for the path of seeing.🔽The path of distinctive progress is the path of distinctive progress, because it is the path of distinctive progress to the fruit of arhatship.🔽The path of distinctive practice is the path of distinctive practice, because it is the path of distinctive practice of the perfections.🔽The path of distinctive realization is the path of distinctive realization, because it is the path of distinctive realization of the factors of enlightenment.🔽The path of distinctive purification is the path of distinctive purification, because it is the path of distinctive purification of the Buddha lineage.🔽The path of distinctive activity is the path of distinctive activity, because it is the path of distinctive activity of the ten activities.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang brel ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang brel ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: The path of distinctive attainment is the path of distinctive attainment, because it is the path of distinctive attainment of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-learning is the path of distinctive non-learning, because it is the path of distinctive non-learning of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-practice is the path of distinctive non-practice, because it is the path of distinctive non-practice of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-realization is the path of distinctive non-realization, because it is the path of distinctive non-realization of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-purification is the path of distinctive non-purification, because it is the path of distinctive non-purification of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-attainment is the path of distinctive non-attainment, because it is the path of distinctive non-attainment of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-activity is the path of distinctive non-activity, because it is the path of distinctive non-activity of the ten masteries.🔽The path of distinctive non-realization is the path of distinctive non-realization, because it is the path of distinctive non-realization of the ten masteries.🔽The path of

original: bzhi dang bzhi dang lnga dang lnga dang bdun dang brgyad de /
analyzed: bzhi dang bzhi dang lnga dang lnga dang bdun dang brgyad de /
translated: four, four, five, five, seven, and eight.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that there are thirty-seven aspects based on the knowledge of paths.

original: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa drug las gnyen po'i lam rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lam shes pa nyid kyi lam rnam pa drug las gnyen po'i lam rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among the six aspects of the path of the knowledge of paths, there are three aspects of the path of antidotes:

original: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'i stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'i stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness that is the antidote to the view is

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas lta bas byas pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas lta bas byas pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because of the aspect of emptiness, the view is not apprehended.

original: lta ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po mtshan ma med pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po mtshan ma med pa ni /
translated: The signlessness that is the antidote to the conception of the sign of the view is

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas rtog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas rtog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because of the aspect of signlessness, conception is not apprehended.🔽The wishlessness that is the antidote to the wish for the three realms is

original: khams gsum pa la smon pa'i gnyen po smon pa med pa ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pas bsgom la dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la smon pa'i gnyen po smon pa med pa ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pas bsgom la dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because of the aspect of wishlessness, meditation is not apprehended.

original: de la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation is by way of the two aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa gnyis dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi po rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa gnyis dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi po rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The wishless gate of liberation is by way of the two aspects of impermanence and suffering and the four aspects of the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi rnam pa rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi rnam pa rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin te /
translated: The signless gate of liberation is by way of the aspects of cessation and path.

original: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa 'gog pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa gang gis bsal ba ni lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa 'gog pa dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa gang gis bsal ba ni lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cessation is signless and the path is that which eliminates the conceptualization of signs.

original: mtshan med zhi ba'i rnam pa yis //
analyzed: mtshan med zhi ba'i rnam pa yis //
translated: By way of the aspect of peace that is signless.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is stated

original: dngos po'i mtshan ma dang rjes su 'brel ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan ma dang rjes su 'brel ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: because it is from the perspective of the śrāvaka path that is related to the signs of things. Therefore there is no contradiction between this and the above.

original: sprul ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis las gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa ni bdag nyid so sor bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sprul ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis las gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par ma bshig pa ni bdag nyid so sor bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten nas /
translated: From among the two types of emanation, the emanation that does not destroy the perception of form is as follows.🔽

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste /🔽gang gis @125b gzugs can gzugs kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste / gang gis @125b gzugs can gzugs kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The path of emanation is of two types. The first is the path of emanation in which the ideation of form is not destroyed. This is when one manifests the ideation of form by oneself, based on the meditative concentrations or formless absorptions.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa ni bdag nyid so sor de bzhin du phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa ni bdag nyid so sor de bzhin du phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: The second is the path of emanation in which the ideation of form is destroyed. This is when one manifests the ideation of form externally by oneself in the same way.

original: gang gi snang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi snang gzugs med par 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la blta'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is explained in the line, “One who has the ideation of formlessness sees external forms.”

original: 'di dag ni sprul pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i rnam par thar pa gnyis yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sprul pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i rnam par thar pa gnyis yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the two liberations that are antidotes to emanation.

original: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of afflictions in regard to emanation.

original: sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la 'bad pa dang ; mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la 'bad pa dang ; mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The effort to emanate a beautiful form is incompatible with the effort to emanate an ugly form.

original: de'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The antidote to that is the statement, “Having actualized the liberation of beauty with the body, he remains having fulfilled it.”

original: bdag nyis so sor sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang phan tshun 'brel pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas ji ltar 'dod par gzugs la lhag par mos pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyis so sor sdug pa'i gzugs rnams la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang phan tshun 'brel pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob pas ji ltar 'dod par gzugs la lhag par mos pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained the perception of a single taste with regard to beautiful forms, in dependence on the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual connection, he obtains mastery over the supernormal knowledge of manifesting forms at will, because he has attained the perception of a single taste with regard to beautiful forms, in dependence on the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual connection.🔽The path of abiding in comfort with regard to the visible is twofold: the path of abiding in conformity with liberation and the path of abiding in peace.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis las thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis las thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The path of abiding in conformity with liberation is the four formless meditative attainments.

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam ni 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of abiding in peace is called the cessation of ideation and feeling.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsum dang / gzhan gyi don gyi ched du bya ba can rang gi don mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas lnga ste brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi nges par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas gsum dang / gzhan gyi don gyi ched du bya ba can rang gi don mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas lnga ste brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: And five in terms of the benefit of others, in terms of the basis of the happiness of the present life.

original: des na 'di rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rnam pas rnam par thar pa brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rnam pas rnam par thar pa brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the eight liberations are the object of the eight liberations, because they are non-apprehensible.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i rnam pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i rnam pas /
translated: The nine serial absorptions that are supramundane paths are the object of the nine serial absorptions,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /🔽'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni 'jig rten las @126a * //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni 'jig rten las @126a * //
translated: because the nine serial absorptions are non-apprehensible.

original: 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are obtained through the supramundane path.

original: spong pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam bden pa rnam pa bzhi la brten pa ni bden pa bzhi'i rnam pas /
analyzed: spong pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam bden pa rnam pa bzhi la brten pa ni bden pa bzhi'i rnam pas /
translated: The uninterrupted path of abandonment, which is based on the four noble truths, is the four noble truths.

original: kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because the origin and cessation are not observed.

original: kun 'byung ni 'dir nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni 'dir nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Here, the origin is the origin of the afflictions.

original: 'gog pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Cessation is being free from that.🔽The ten perfections that are the path of the Buddha

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam du gyur pa'i lam pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam du gyur pa'i lam pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni /
translated: are as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom...

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rab 'byor ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rab 'byor ser sna la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: And it is said, Subhūti, because the ten opposing factors of the perfections, such as stinginess, are not observed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas dus phyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas dus phyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun tu spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having completed the perfections, one does not later engage in all the adverse factors.

original: 'di rnams gnyen po'i lam dang / sprul pa'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / spong ba'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du gsum dang gsum dang lnga dang dgu dang bzhi dang bcu ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams gnyen po'i lam dang / sprul pa'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / spong ba'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du gsum dang gsum dang lnga dang dgu dang bzhi dang bcu ste /
translated: These are stated in terms of the path of the antidote, the path of emanation, the path of abiding happily in this life, the supramundane path, the path of elimination, and the path of buddhahood.

original: lam shes pa'i lam la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi gsungs pa ni yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i lam la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi gsungs pa ni yin no //
translated: The thirty-four aspects of the path of knowing the path are stated in terms of the path of knowing the path.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni shin tu phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir gcig bu kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni shin tu phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir gcig bu kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: The path of omniscience is only one, because it is the most excellent.

original: 'on kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam 'di'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pas dbye ba brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam 'di'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pas dbye ba brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: However, it is to be expressed by the uncommon aspects of the characteristics of this path, by the divisions of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: stobs bcu'i rnam pas chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: stobs bcu'i rnam pas chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te ;
translated: Because all phenomena are not observed by the aspects of the ten powers.

original: de'i gnas skabs su chos rnams rnam pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs su chos rnams rnam pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that stage, phenomena attain the reality that is devoid of aspects.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes zhum pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam dang mngon par shes pa thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes zhum pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam dang mngon par shes pa thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the aspects of fearlessness, the gnosis of the knowledge of the aspects of the path is not discouraged, because all paths and higher perceptions are attained.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i rnam pas @126b thams cad la ye shes chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad rnams dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rtogs pa'i ro myong bar mi byed pas na chags pa med pa'i phyir dang shes bya'i sgrab pa spangs pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i rnam pas @126b thams cad la ye shes chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yul gyi skad rnams dang / chos rab tu dbye ba'i yul la go rims bzhin du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rtogs pa'i ro myong bar mi byed pas na chags pa med pa'i phyir dang shes bya'i sgrab pa spangs pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rnam pas /
translated: The Distinctive Qualities of the Powers

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba chos ma 'dres pa de dang de mi mthun pa'i chos gang dang gang yin pa de dang de las yang dag par 'da' ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba chos ma 'dres pa de dang de mi mthun pa'i chos gang dang gang yin pa de dang de las yang dag par 'da' ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin
translated: This is the meaning of transcending all dharmas that are not in accord with the unshared qualities.

original: te / mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: te / mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the sutra:

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na /🔽res 'ga' glang po che gtum po'am rta mi srun pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa grong du bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na / res 'ga' glang po che gtum po'am rta mi srun pa'am /
translated: When a bhikṣu arhat who has exhausted the defilements goes to the village for alms,🔽sometimes he will go together with a wild elephant, a wild horse,

original: ba lang mi srun pa dang / khyi mi srun pa dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang / tshang tshing dang tsher ma'i 'obs su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: ba lang mi srun pa dang / khyi mi srun pa dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang / tshang tshing dang tsher ma'i 'obs su 'gro ba'am /
translated: a wild ox, or a wild dog, or he will go into a thicket or a pit of thorns,

original: sbrul nag po rkang pa gnyis kyis brdzis pa'am /
analyzed: sbrul nag po rkang pa gnyis kyis brdzis pa'am /
translated: or he will tread on a black snake with both feet,

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gang na bud med kyi tshogs kyis rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pas mgron du bos pas khyim du 'jug pa dang / dgon pa'am yang na lam drang po nas lam gol bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gang na bud med kyi tshogs kyis rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pas mgron du bos pas khyim du 'jug pa dang / dgon pa'am yang na lam drang po nas lam gol bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: Or he may go to a forest or a deserted place, or he may go astray from the right path.

original: rkun po'am chom po pa dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / gzhan gyi chung ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rkun po'am chom po pa dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / gzhan gyi chung ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba ste /
translated: Or he may go with thieves, bandits, lions, tigers, or other men’s wives.
