original: dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any of these faults, or anything similar to them.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa res 'ga' dgon par nags khrod stug por rgyu ba na lam las nyams nas khang pa stong par sgra 'byin cing dbyangs rjes su sgrogs la sgra chen pos 'bod pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa res 'ga' dgon par nags khrod stug por rgyu ba na lam las nyams nas khang pa stong par sgra 'byin cing dbyangs rjes su sgrogs la sgra chen pos 'bod pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, a certain Arhat, when wandering in the forest in the wilderness, may lose his way, cry out in an empty house, or shout in a loud voice.

original: bag chags kyi nyes pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa'i rta gad chen po dgod pa dang / so 'tshigs byed pa'am /
analyzed: bag chags kyi nyes pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa'i rta gad chen po dgod pa dang / so 'tshigs byed pa'am /
translated: On the basis of the fault of latent propensities, they laugh loudly with afflictive laughter, or they make a hissing sound,

original: steg pa'i tshul yang nye bar ston par byed de /
analyzed: steg pa'i tshul yang nye bar ston par byed de /
translated: or they display a manner of dancing.

original: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun par dgra bcom pa'i ca co de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun par dgra bcom pa'i ca co de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any of these characteristics of an arhat.

original: @127a * // de bzhin gshegs pa la ni dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: @127a * // de bzhin gshegs pa la ni dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any loss of recollection.

original: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i thugs kyi mdzad pa dang / gsungs pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i thugs kyi mdzad pa dang / gsungs pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he does not have any mental activity that is not associated with the afflictions and because he recollects what he has said.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la mtha' gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la ni zhi ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la mtha' gcig tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la ni zhi ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, an arhat has the perception that the aggregates are absolutely disagreeable and the perception that nirvāṇa, which is the absence of the aggregates, is peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have the perception of a difference between the aggregates and nirvāṇa.

original: mchog tu btang snyoms pas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu btang snyoms pas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is supremely indifferent.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa na mnyam par bzhag pa yin gyi ldang ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa na mnyam par bzhag pa yin gyi ldang ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, when the arhat enters meditative attainment, he is concentrated, but when he arises from meditative attainment, he is not concentrated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnas skabs thams cad du thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnas skabs thams cad du thugs mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata is never unconcentrated at any time.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don bya ba la btang snyoms su byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don bya ba la btang snyoms su byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the arhat is indifferent to acting for the welfare of sentient beings without careful consideration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata has no such indifference that is not carefully considered.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas 'dun pa las kyang nyams shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas 'dun pa las kyang nyams shing /
translated: Moreover, the arhat, beginning with the purification of the obscurations of the knowable, degenerates from his attainment and from his aspiration due to complete degeneration.

original: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las nyams pa yin gyi /
translated: He is not deficient in vigor, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, or liberation.

original: nyams pa'i rnam pa 'di drug de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i rnam pa 'di drug de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata is not deficient in these six aspects of liberation.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni lan 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni lan 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug la /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat sometimes engages in virtuous physical actions,

original: lan 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la'o //
translated: and sometimes in indeterminate actions.

original: ngag dang yid kyi las la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi las la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of his verbal and mental actions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni las gsum char la yang ye shes sngon du 'gro ba nyid dang ye shes rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i las mi mnga'o //🔽de la ye shes kyi kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni las gsum char la yang ye shes sngon du 'gro ba nyid dang ye shes rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa'i las mi mnga'o // de la ye shes kyi kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o ;
translated: But the Tathagata, because his three actions are preceded by and followed by knowledge, does not have any indeterminate actions.🔽They are preceded by knowledge because they are motivated by knowledge.

original: / ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: / ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: They are followed by knowledge because they are accompanied by knowledge.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni gang gis 'di'i ye shes kyi mthong ba chags pa med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni gang gis 'di'i ye shes kyi mthong ba chags pa med par 'gyur ba /
translated: Furthermore, arhats are those whose wisdom vision is unattached.

original: dus gsum pa'i dngos po btsal ba tsam las rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i dngos po btsal ba tsam las rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, the arhats do not realize the things of the three times by mere investigation, because their knowledge-perception is obstructed.

original: gang gis 'di'i ye shes @127b kyi mthong ba thogs pa med par 'gyur ba thams cad rtogs pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di'i ye shes @127b kyi mthong ba thogs pa med par 'gyur ba thams cad rtogs pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: And they do not realize everything, because their knowledge-perception is not unobstructed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni btsal ba tsam gyis dus gsum pa'i shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni btsal ba tsam gyis dus gsum pa'i shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But the Tathagata realizes all things of the three times by mere investigation,

original: de bas na bco brgyad po 'di dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na bco brgyad po 'di dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: and therefore these eighteen are called the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pas /
translated: In terms of reality,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of all Buddhas is the same, the meaning of the characteristics spoken by all Buddhas is unchanging.

original: rang byung gi rnam pas chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i thugs su chud pa gzhan gyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang byung gi rnam pas chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i thugs su chud pa gzhan gyi rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it controls all dharmas by its own nature.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ni //
translated: The aspects of Buddhahood

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The Lord: This perfection of wisdom, Subhuti, is the Buddha's perfection.

original: rab 'byor thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the full enlightenment of all in every way.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that full enlightenment is Buddhahood.

original: de de ltar byas pas stobs la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam pa rnams ji ltar rab tu dbye ba dang / 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos de rnams la mnga' bsgyur ba gang yin pa rang byung dang /
analyzed: de de ltar byas pas stobs la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam pa rnams ji ltar rab tu dbye ba dang / 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos de rnams la mnga' bsgyur ba gang yin pa rang byung dang /
translated: Thus, by this method, the aspects of the powers, etc., are distinguished, and their nature, their mastery over those dharmas, and their self-originatedness are shown.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gang gi don du ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gang gi don du ste /
translated: The object for which one fully and completely awakens to all aspects of all dharmas.

original: de ltar na go rims bzhin du bcu dang bzhi dang bzhi dang bco brgyad dang gcig dang gcig dang gcig ste /
analyzed: de ltar na go rims bzhin du bcu dang bzhi dang bzhi dang bco brgyad dang gcig dang gcig dang gcig ste /
translated: Thus, in order, there are ten, four, four, eighteen, one, one, and one.

original: rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgur bshad pa ni yin no //
analyzed: rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la brten pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa dgur bshad pa ni yin no //
translated: Thus, the path of omniscience is explained as having thirty-nine aspects.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: When all of those are combined into one, there are seventy-three aspects.

original: bcu drug las gzhan dri med pa'i //
analyzed: bcu drug las gzhan dri med pa'i //
translated: Other than the sixteen, there are no other stainless aspects.

original: rnam pa gzhan med ces gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i rnam pa la dgongs pa yin pas na de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med ces gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam gyi gnyen po'i rnam pa la dgongs pa yin pas na de dang 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: What was said is intended in terms of the aspects that are the antidotes to the afflictive obstructions alone, so there is no contradiction with this.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di chos gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di chos gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this thing called an “aspect”?

original: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
translated: The distinctions of the knowledge of the basis

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: are called “aspects,” which are characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba dang po rtsom pa nyid na mtshan nyid brjod zin ma yin nam /🔽@128a * // dngos por /🔽rnam par gnas pa'i dmigs pa yar //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang po rtsom pa nyid na mtshan nyid brjod zin ma yin nam / @128a * // dngos por / rnam par gnas pa'i dmigs pa yar //
translated: Aren’t the characteristics already stated at the very beginning of the composition?🔽The object of the knowledge of paths

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: is all phenomena,

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //🔽'jig rten pa yi rtog pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod zin pa des na 'dir rnam pa gzhi med par 'gyur ba'i skyon yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye bas zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni rnam grangs kyi zag pa dang bcas pas zag pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin // 'jig rten pa yi rtog pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod zin pa des na 'dir rnam pa gzhi med par 'gyur ba'i skyon yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye bas zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'o // lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni rnam grangs kyi zag pa dang bcas pas zag pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: which are virtuous and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyon mongs pa shin tu yangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyon mongs pa shin tu yangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects and so on are stated in the lines beginning “The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are the aspects of the truths,” and since the aspects of the knowledge of paths are stated in the lines beginning “The aspects of the knowledge of paths are the aspects of the three vehicles,” and since the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects of the knowledge of all aspects and so

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni zag pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni zag pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are uncontaminated alone.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a perfect buddha is one who knows all phenomena in all their aspects.

original: rnam pa rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The aspects have been explained.

original: // / da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sbyor ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the application will be explained.

original: de la re zhig sbyor ba'i rten sbyor ba po brjod nas de'i 'og tu 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig sbyor ba'i rten sbyor ba po brjod nas de'i 'og tu 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: First, having described the application-basis, the one who applies, then this will be described.

original: de la sbyor ba po na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba po na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The one who applies is of four types.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
translated: One who has served the buddhas,

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun /
translated: one who has planted roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
translated: one who has the protection of a spiritual friend,

original: 'di mnyan pa yi sdod yin no //
analyzed: 'di mnyan pa yi sdod yin no //
translated: is a vessel for listening to this.

original: zhes gsungs pa ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang dge ba'i shes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i snod yin no zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang dge ba'i shes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa'i snod yin no zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Those who have served the victors of the past, who have planted roots of virtue with the tathagatas, and who are sustained by spiritual friends are vessels for listening to the perfection of wisdom.

original: len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de la mi dad pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / de la mi dad pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i rten gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: In terms of the basis of application, such as taking up, upholding, reading, mastering, properly paying attention, and not being faithless, and so on, it is said:🔽Relying on the Buddha, asking questions,

original: sangs rgyas brten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas brten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa /
translated: giving, moral discipline, and so on.

original: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa yi //🔽snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
analyzed: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa yi // snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //
translated: Taking up, upholding, and so on

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are said to be the vessels of the sublime.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / yongs su zhu ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa @128b drug gi spyod pa dang ldan pa ni len pa po la sogs pa'i snod nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / yongs su zhu ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa @128b drug gi spyod pa dang ldan pa ni len pa po la sogs pa'i snod nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The one who is a vessel for the appropriator, etc. is the one who has served many Buddhas, who has asked questions, and who is endowed with the practice of the six perfections.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyu las bzlog pa mi mos pa dang yong bar byed pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyu las bzlog pa mi mos pa dang yong bar byed pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause of non-interest and the cause of turning away are the opposite of the stated cause.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab po zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni shin tu zab po zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The statement, “Venerable Śāriputra, this perfection of wisdom is very deep” is the cause of non-interest.

original: de la zab pa ni mos pa tsam med pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid dang / de yong ba ni sems can la log par byed pa'i nyes pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de la zab pa ni mos pa tsam med pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid dang / de yong ba ni sems can la log par byed pa'i nyes pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: There, “deep” means the cause of mere non-interest, and “turning away” means the cause of the fault of turning away from sentient beings. The meaning is that it is to be understood.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis phan tshun nges par skyes pa dang rab tu phye ba dag gis ni thams cad shes pa nyid las 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis phan tshun nges par skyes pa dang rab tu phye ba dag gis ni thams cad shes pa nyid las 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects and the perfection of wisdom are mutually generated and distinguished, and thus the teaching of practice is presented in order to establish the practice of one who wishes to transcend the knowledge of all aspects, who wishes to abide in the knowledge of the path,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du de la sbyor ba sgrub par nye bar bstan pas sbyor ba bstan pa nye bar dgod pa'i don tu yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bskyed par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du de la sbyor ba sgrub par nye bar bstan pas sbyor ba bstan pa nye bar dgod pa'i don tu yin no //
translated: and who wishes to generate the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par skyes pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the knowledge of all aspects is definitely generated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: de las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished from that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is distinguished by the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de las de'i rgyu'i dngos po gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de'i rgyu'i dngos po gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the state of its cause is clarified from that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de dag nges par skyes pa dang rab tu phye bar smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de dag nges par skyes pa dang rab tu phye bar smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be born and distinguished just as they are.

original: nyan pa po'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa dang / shes rab kyi nyes pa dang / 'dun pa zhan pa'i nyes pa bsal ba'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig ces pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa dang / shes rab kyi nyes pa dang / 'dun pa zhan pa'i nyes pa bsal ba'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig ces pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to remove the fault of distraction in the listener, the fault of wisdom, and the fault of weak aspiration, it is said, “Listen well, bear it in mind!”

original: sbyor ba yang rnam pa nyi shu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang rnam pa nyi shu 'gyur te /
translated: The application is also twenty-fold.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
translated: Form and so on are not stable,

original: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because application is negated there,

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //🔽de rnams gting dpag dga' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir // de rnams gting dpag dga' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because their suchness is profound,🔽Because they are difficult to fathom,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are immeasurable, and because they are realized with great difficulty and over a long time.

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nyi dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //🔽chos dang chos min @129a * //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nyi dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir // chos dang chos min @129a * //
translated: because of swift enlightenment, and because of the non-increase and non-decrease of the benefit of others.

original: sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: sogs mi mthong //
translated: One does not see virtue and nonvirtue, etc.

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: One does not see the inconceivability of form, etc.🔽One does not conceptualize the signs of form, etc.,

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
translated: nor their nature. It gives the jewel of the result, and it is the purification with its culmination.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is said. “ Application” is the same as “practice.”

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the application of non-abiding in form, etc., is when one does not abide in form, then one applies oneself to form.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la gnas pa bkag pas de la sbyor bar byed ba rjes su gnas pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la gnas pa bkag pas de la sbyor bar byed ba rjes su gnas pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that form, etc. in which he would stand, or that perfection of giving, etc. in which he would stand.🔽He does not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that knowledge of all modes in which he would stand.

original: gang la gnas par bya ba dang gang la sbyar bar bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba dang gang la sbyar bar bya ba de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He does not stand in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha in which he would stand.🔽He does not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that knowledge of all modes in which he would stand.

original: mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa ni /
analyzed: mi sbyor ba nyid sbyor ba yin pa ni /
translated: He does not stand in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha in which he would stand.

original: yang gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: yang gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: He does not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that knowledge of all modes in which he would stand.🔽He does not stand in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha in which he would stand.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi sbyor ba de'i tshe gzugs la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyid la mi sbyor ba de'i tshe de la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi sbyor ba de'i tshe gzugs la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyid la mi sbyor ba de'i tshe de la sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: He does not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that knowledge of all modes in which he would stand.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He does not stand in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha in which he would stand.🔽He does not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that knowledge of all modes in which he would stand.🔽He does not stand in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha in which he would stand

original: zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa nyid kyi gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rnyog pa med pa'i don gyis lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyis gting dpag dka' ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa nyid kyi gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i don gyis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no // gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rnyog pa med pa'i don gyis lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs kyis gting dpag dka' ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The profound application is the profundity of the perfection of wisdom in the context of the knowledge of all aspects, which is stated as the profundity of the suchness of form and so on, which is the meaning of non-apprehending abiding.🔽The application of being difficult to fathom is the difficulty of fathoming form and so on, which is stated as the difficulty of fathoming in the context of the knowledge of the path, which is the meaning of being unpolluted by nature.

original: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa nyid kyis mtha' dmigs su med pa'i don gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs kyi de tshad med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa nyid kyis mtha' dmigs su med pa'i don gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs kyi de tshad med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application of being immeasurable is the immeasurability of form and so on, which is stated as the immeasurability in the context of the knowledge of all aspects, which is the meaning of the unapprehendability of the limit.

original: de'i 'ang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pos go rims bzhin du sbyor ba rnam pa gsum yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i 'ang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pos go rims bzhin du sbyor ba rnam pa gsum yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The three types of practice are respectively small, middling, and great.

original: gal te gzugs zab po zhes bya ba dang / gzugs gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs @129b tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs zab po zhes bya ba dang / gzugs gting dpag dka'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs @129b tshad med do zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: If one does not practice that form is profound, that form is difficult to fathom, and that form is immeasurable,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: one practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽The three practices beginning with this statement and ending with the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are prohibited, and thus their practice is permitted.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi spyod pa gsum po bkag pas de'i spyod pa rjes su gnang ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi spyod pa gsum po bkag pas de'i spyod pa rjes su gnang ba dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs kyi zab pa nyid gang yin pa dang ; gting dpag dka' ba nyid gang yin pa dang / tshad med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ma yin no zhes bya ba nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi zab pa nyid gang yin pa dang ; gting dpag dka' ba nyid gang yin pa dang / tshad med pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ma yin no zhes bya ba nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas yin no //
translated: The profundity of form, its difficulty to fathom, and its immeasurability are not form, up to and not the buddhadharmas.🔽Moreover, the three applications of profundity, etc. should be understood in terms of the enlightenment of profundity, the enlightenment of the unshared, and the enlightenment of the unsurpassed.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.

original: yang zab mor mngon par byang chub pa dang / thun mong ma yin par byang chub pa dang / bla na med pa mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zab pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang zab mor mngon par byang chub pa dang / thun mong ma yin par byang chub pa dang / bla na med pa mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zab pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.

original: tshogs chen po skyo bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni las dang po pa dag ni zab pa nyid kyis na dang nga bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs chen po skyo bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa ni las dang po pa dag ni zab pa nyid kyis na dang nga bar 'gyur te /
translated: The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the great assembly is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the great assembly.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the weary is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the weary.

original: dang por skrag pa skye bas so //
analyzed: dang por skrag pa skye bas so //
translated: The application to the enlightenment of the beginner is stated in terms of the enlightenment of the beginner.🔽The application to the enlightenment of the

original: gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyis na kun tu skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba nyid kyis na kun tu skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is difficult to fathom, one is frightened,

original: de lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lhag par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is so lofty.

original: tshad med pa nyid kyis na kun tu skrag pas zin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyis na kun tu skrag pas zin par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is immeasurable, one is seized with terror,

original: dar nges par ma rtogs pa'i chos kyi snod ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dar nges par ma rtogs pa'i chos kyi snod ma yin par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not a vessel for the Dharma that is not fully understood.

original: des ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mdun du de brjod par rjes su gnang ba zhes bya bas yin no //
analyzed: des ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mdun du de brjod par rjes su gnang ba zhes bya bas yin no //
translated: This is the permission to speak of it in the presence of the irreversible.🔽The practice of attaining the prediction is that one who is endowed with the practice of faith in it, etc.,

original: lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni de la mi dang ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa rmi lam gyi nang na yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yid la byed ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung
analyzed: lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba ni de la mi dang ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa rmi lam gyi nang na yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yid la byed ba rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung
translated: even in dreams, who is mindful of the six perfections, will receive the prediction from one or two Tathagatas, not exceeding that number.

original: bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni rang nyid byung ba de 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid du zhes gang gsungs pa yan no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni rang nyid byung ba de 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid du zhes gang gsungs pa yan no //
translated: The application of irreversibility is that which is stated in the passage beginning: “One who has arisen in this vehicle is irreversible with regard to the retention of that vehicle and so on.”🔽The application of definite emergence is that which is stated in the passage beginning: “It is like a man who is in a great forest extending for many hundreds of yojanas.”

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni skyes bu 'brog dgon pa dpag tshad brgya phrag mang po zhig na gnas pa'i dpes par chad byed pa'i chos las 'das par bstan pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba ni skyes bu 'brog dgon pa dpag tshad brgya phrag mang po zhig na gnas pa'i dpes par chad byed pa'i chos las 'das par bstan pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application of non-interruption is that which is stated in the passage beginning: “It is like a man who is traveling through a great desert.”

original: par chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni skyes bu rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i dpes nye bar gyur @130a * //🔽na rtag tu mtshan ma'i dngos po yang dag par mthong ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni skyes bu rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i dpes nye bar gyur @130a * //🔽na rtag tu mtshan ma'i dngos po yang dag par mthong ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application of proximity is that which is stated in the passage beginning: “It is like a man who is traveling in a boat on the great ocean.”

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang nye bar sbyor ba ni rtsi shing gi lo ma dang 'dab ma lhags pa'i dpes rten zag pa med pa'i chos gser gyi gzhi'i dngos por bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang nye bar sbyor ba ni rtsi shing gi lo ma dang 'dab ma lhags pa'i dpes rten zag pa med pa'i chos gser gyi gzhi'i dngos por bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application to manifest complete enlightenment is taught by the example of the falling leaves and branches of trees, because it shows the basis, the uncontaminated dharmas, as the substance of the golden ground.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba ni bud med sbrum ma btsar nye ba'i dpes rten pa sgrub pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu chos kyi sku myur du mngon par 'grub par ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba ni bud med sbrum ma btsar nye ba'i dpes rten pa sgrub pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu chos kyi sku myur du mngon par 'grub par ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application to quickly manifest complete enlightenment is taught by the example of a pregnant woman about to give birth, because it shows the swift establishment of the result of the dharmas of practice, the dharmakāya.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni ;
translated: The application for the benefit of others is taught by the example of the king's minister,

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from here: Here, the bodhisattvas are engaged for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings.

original: bdag nyid kyang chos kyi 'khor la bskor la gzhan yang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la yang dag par bskul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos kyi 'khor la bskor la gzhan yang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la yang dag par bskul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One should also turn the wheel of the Dharma, and one should also exhort others to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de rnams ni gnyi ga'i don byed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de rnams ni gnyi ga'i don byed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: These are the two kinds of activities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sgrub pa la legs par yongs su gtad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sgrub pa la legs par yongs su gtad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata has entrusted the practice to you.

original: 'phel pa dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'phel pa dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The application of non-increase and non-decrease is from the question, How does the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom become complete?

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mthong ba bkag pas des bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba rjes su gnang bas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mthong ba bkag pas des bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba rjes su gnang bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the prohibition of seeing increase and decrease in form up to omniscience, and the permission of the completion of cultivation by that.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the non-apprehension of Dharma and non-Dharma is from the question,

original: yang chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dag dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang /
analyzed: yang chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dag dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, it is the same as before, since the seeing of phenomena and non-phenomena, past, future, and present, virtue and non-virtue, and so on, conditioned and unconditioned, the realms of desire and so on,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas /
translated: the perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rjes su mthong ba bkag pas snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rjes su mthong ba bkag pas snga ma bzhin te /
translated: and even omniscience is refuted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid ni nges par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid ni nges par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the characteristics of phenomena are definitely not established.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam @130b pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam @130b pa'i 'du shes 'gog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa nas /
translated: The application of the cessation of the inconceivable discrimination is from form and so on,🔽up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'du shes pa bkag pas snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'du shes pa bkag pas snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The inconceivable finality of omniscience is the cessation of discriminations.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog pa nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de'i mtshan ma dang de'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'i don can dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog pa nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du de'i mtshan ma dang de'i rang bzhin du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'i don can dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The application of non-discrimination is the non-discrimination of form, the sign of form, and the nature of form,🔽up to the non-discrimination of the sign of omniscience and the nature of omniscience.🔽The meaning of non-discrimination is the non-discrimination of the inconceivability of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin par mi rtog par rjes su 'thad par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin par mi rtog par rjes su 'thad par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Why is that? It is because the inconceivability of form, etc. is not discriminated.

original: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the gift of the precious result is

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni rin po che ster bar byed pa nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni rin po che ster bar byed pa nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o //
translated: The stream-enterer up to the supreme enlightenment is the bestowal of a jewel, thus the perfection of wisdom is a heap of jewels.

original: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rin po che'i phung po rnams sgrub par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the heaps of jewels of the Dharma that is spoken of.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of purification:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽sa mtshams kyi sbyor pa ni rin po che chen po dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dag pa'i phung po'i zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // sa mtshams kyi sbyor pa ni rin po che chen po dang 'dra bar /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is a heap of purity because of the purification of form, etc.🔽The application of the boundary:

original: bar chad mang ba nyid yin pas lo'i par gyis bri ba la sogs pa la mngon par brtson pa mi gtang bar bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad mang ba nyid yin pas lo'i par gyis bri ba la sogs pa la mngon par brtson pa mi gtang bar bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Like a great jewel, it is not to be abandoned, even if one is diligent in writing, etc., because of the many obstacles.

original: lo smos pa ni de tsam gyis dus tshigs la sogs pas rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo smos pa ni de tsam gyis dus tshigs la sogs pas rkyen tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of years is because of the collection of conditions by that much time, etc.

original: de ltar byas na mchod sbyin shing shun dang / shed can dang / brjod 'gyur te mang du thos pa rnams kyis lor dpyod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas na mchod sbyin shing shun dang / shed can dang / brjod 'gyur te mang du thos pa rnams kyis lor dpyod par bya ste /
translated: Satyaka, and Vyakarana, should analyze the year.

original: lo las lhag pa'i dus ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo las lhag pa'i dus ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no time beyond the year.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gang gis lo ni mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gis lo ni mthong gyur pa //
translated: One who sees the year

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: And so on.

original: sbyor ba nyi shu po 'di dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyi shu po 'di dag gi go rims 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid yin te /
translated: The order of these twenty applications is the very way of reasoning.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen par gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba ni de dag gi zab pa dang gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen par gnas pa dang / de la mi sbyor ba ni de dag gi zab pa dang gting dpag dka' ba dang tshad med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who abides in non-attachment to all phenomena and does not engage in them will realize their profundity, difficulty of fathoming, and immeasurability.

original: sbyor ba ma yin pa byed pa nyid @131a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ma yin pa byed pa nyid @131a * //
translated: The very non-application

original: kyis ni las dang po pa tshogs chen po pa dang / de las gzhan pa ni bde blag tu lung bstan pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par nye bar 'gyur la dang /
analyzed: kyis ni las dang po pa tshogs chen po pa dang / de las gzhan pa ni bde blag tu lung bstan pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob nas nges par 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par nye bar 'gyur la dang /
translated: The others refer to those who are easily predicted, who will attain the irreversible stage, who will not be separated from the certainty of deliverance, who will approach complete enlightenment,

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and who will quickly attain complete enlightenment.🔽Then, they will perform the benefit of others, without increase or decrease, and will attain the ultimate, supreme purity, by giving the precious fruit of the conceptual thought, free from all notions of Dharma, non-Dharma, and so forth.

original: de nas ni gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa dang / chos sam chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ni sngon nyid du lo'i bar du mngon par brtson pas sems kyi rlung yongs su sbyangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas ni gzhan gyi don byed cing 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa dang / chos sam chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral bas rnam par rtog pa dang / 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pas mchog tu rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa thob pa ni sngon nyid du lo'i bar du mngon par brtson pas sems kyi rlung yongs su sbyangs pa yin no //
translated: This is because they have previously trained the wind of the mind for years with effort.

original: sbyor ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: sbyor ba bshad zin to /
translated: The yoga has been explained.

original: // / de'i phan yon brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / de'i phan yon brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since its benefits should be expressed,🔽it is said:

original: bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pas //
analyzed: bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pas //
translated: By destroying the power of Mara,

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: there are fourteen qualities.🔽Among them, the quality of destroying the power of Mara is that even if one is engaged in creating obstacles for Mara, the Buddhas of the worlds of the ten directions think of and protect one, which is the cause of destroying the power of Mara.

original: de la bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan ni bdud par chad byed pa la zhugs su zin kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing yongs su gzung ba ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i yon tan ni bdud par chad byed pa la zhugs su zin kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing yongs su gzung ba ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: Shariputra, this is the nature of things.

original: zhes de la dgongs pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes de la dgongs pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is stated with the logical reasoning of that intention.

original: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dgongs shing yongs su 'dzin pa mdzad de zhes bya ba nas de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyis gzung bar rig bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos smra ba des
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis dgongs shing mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dgongs shing yongs su 'dzin pa mdzad de zhes bya ba nas de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyis gzung bar rig bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chos smra ba des
translated: The qualities of the buddhas' intention and knowledge are that the buddhas intend and hold those bodhisattvas in mind and so on up to all of them should be known as held by the buddhas.

original: dgongs shing mkhyen pas lhag par mos pa bstan pa skyes pa las dogs pa med par gyur pa'i phyir bdud 'jug pa'i skabs mi rnyed par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs shing mkhyen pas lhag par mos pa bstan pa skyes pa las dogs pa med par gyur pa'i phyir bdud 'jug pa'i skabs mi rnyed par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated by the meaning of the Dharma teacher's knowledge and intention, which is taught by the meaning of understanding that the opportunity to engage Mara does not arise because of the absence of doubt that arises from the generation of superior intention.

original: sangs rgyas kyis mngon du mdzad pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis mngon du mdzad pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The qualities of the buddhas' manifestation are

original: de dag ni ye shes kyis mkhyen zhing de dag ni sha'i spyan gyis gzigs pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni ye shes kyis mkhyen zhing de dag ni sha'i spyan gyis gzigs pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: those are known by gnosis and those are seen with the fleshly eye.

original: yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: yang dag bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The qualities of approaching perfect complete enlightenment are

original: theg @131b ba chen po pa de dag ni 'di ltar bdag cag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: theg @131b ba chen po pa de dag ni 'di ltar bdag cag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are followers of the Mahayana should know that they are approaching unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: don che ba la sogs pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: don che ba la sogs pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The qualities of being of great import and so on are stated in the passage that begins:

original: glegs bam du bris pa 'chang ba tsam yang don che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / rnam par smin pa che bar 'gyur te zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: glegs bam du bris pa 'chang ba tsam yang don che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / rnam par smin pa che bar 'gyur te zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Merely holding the book will be of great import, of great benefit, of great fruit, and of great maturation.

original: sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol bar gyur pa nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su la yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du tshig bzhi yin par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bde 'gror gzhol bar gyur pa nyid dang / yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su la yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du tshig bzhi yin par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The four phrases should be explained in order, from the point of view of engaging in the welfare of others, as follows: being inseparable from the Buddha, being directed toward good destinies, being perfectly enlightened, and being in nirvana.

original: 'dir thag ring bar smin pa yin pas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o yul dpyad pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: 'dir thag ring bar smin pa yin pas na rnam par smin pa zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o yul dpyad pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: Here, since it ripens far away, it should be seen as “maturation.”

original: lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas bar ta ni dang byang phyogs kyi rgyud du spyad par 'gyur ba la sogs pa smos pa yul la sogs pa dpyad pas chos smra ba la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la dogs pa bsal ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi rgyud nas bar ta ni dang byang phyogs kyi rgyud du spyad par 'gyur ba la sogs pa smos pa yul la sogs pa dpyad pas chos smra ba la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la dogs pa bsal ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of analyzing the object are stated in the passage beginning “In the southern region, in the northern region, in the region of Varta” and so on.

original: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni mi dang nga pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni mi dang nga pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa'i dkar po'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no
translated: The qualities of completing all uncontaminated qualities are stated in the passage beginning “Those endowed with shame and modesty” and so on.

original: // smra ba'i skyes bu yon tan ni /
analyzed: // smra ba'i skyes bu yon tan ni /
translated: The qualities of the speaker are stated in the passage beginning “The one who teaches this Dharma” and so on.

original: yang nga dang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod de zhes bya bas sngon du gtam smra ba'i skyes bu nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang nga dang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod de zhes bya bas sngon du gtam smra ba'i skyes bu nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said that “I and all the Buddhas will speak to them about the knowledge of all things,” and this is the statement that they are the person who speaks first.

original: mi phyed pa'i yon tan ni yang bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang byang chub las bzlog par mi nus pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i yon tan ni yang bstan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir na bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis kyang byang chub las bzlog par mi nus pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The quality of being unbreakable is also taught, because it is said that “the demons and the gods of the demon class cannot turn them away from enlightenment.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa skye ba'i yon tan ni yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / rab tu mgu brgya chen po thob pa de ni skye po mang po dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba'i rgyu nyid gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa skye ba'i yon tan ni yang dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / rab tu mgu brgya chen po thob pa de ni skye po mang po dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba'i rgyu nyid gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The quality of the arising of the uncommon root of virtue is also taught, because it is said that “they attain the great joy, faith, and delight,” which is the cause for the arising of the root of virtue in many people.

original: de la dga' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @132a * //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @132a * //
translated: Here, joy is the joy of the supramundane.

original: chos chol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos chol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Faith is the faith in the Dharma.

original: dang ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Faith is that which is based on the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community.

original: mgu ba ni dge ba la sems 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag yin no //
analyzed: mgu ba ni dge ba la sems 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag yin no //
translated: Joy is the engagement of the mind with virtue.

original: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub pa'i yon tan ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyan sngar bdag srog chags brgya phrag mang po byang chub la rab tu bkod par bgyi'o zhes sangs rgyas nas rjes su dgyes pa'i tshig smras pa gang yin pa de
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub pa'i yon tan ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyan sngar bdag srog chags brgya phrag mang po byang chub la rab tu bkod par bgyi'o zhes sangs rgyas nas rjes su dgyes pa'i tshig smras pa gang yin pa de
translated: The quality of accomplishing the meaning of the vow just as it is is that, having become a Buddha, one speaks the words of the Buddha’s delight: “I have established many hundreds of thousands of living beings in enlightenment.”

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed par shes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par byed par shes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated by the knowledge of accomplishing the meaning just as it is.

original: 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan ni de dag mos pa rlabs po che nyid kyis las kyi 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan ni de dag mos pa rlabs po che nyid kyis las kyi 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The quality of embracing the vast result is that, by the greatness of their aspiration, they embrace the vast result of action.

original: sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan ni phyi nang gi de'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad la ster ba'i phyir dang sangs rgyas sngon du gyur pa'i zhing gzhan dag tu lhag par bsten pa'i phyir gong nas gong du sems can gyi don rjes su sgrub par🔽gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan ni phyi nang gi de'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad la ster ba'i phyir dang sangs rgyas sngon du gyur pa'i zhing gzhan dag tu lhag par bsten pa'i phyir gong nas gong du sems can gyi don rjes su sgrub par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of accomplishing the purpose of sentient beings are the higher and higher accomplishment of the purpose of sentient beings because they give the inner and outer results of that to all sentient beings and because they are especially relied on in other buddha fields where buddhas have gone before.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma rnyed pa dang ma tshang ba rnyed pa las bzlog pas tshang rnyed pa'i yon tan ni tshol bar byed pa rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig gis 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa dang mtshang bar thob pas dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma rnyed pa dang ma tshang ba rnyed pa las bzlog pas tshang rnyed pa'i yon tan ni tshol bar byed pa rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig gis 'thob pa dang mi 'thob pa dang mtshang bar thob pas dang /
translated: The qualities of obtaining the perfection of wisdom that is complete are the opposite of not obtaining the perfection of wisdom and obtaining an incomplete one.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is how it is, Śāriputra.

original: zhes bya ba chos nyid kyi rigs pas bar chad med par rab tu sbyor ba rnams kyis ni skye ba rjes su zin kyang gdon mi za bar de rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par
analyzed: zhes bya ba chos nyid kyi rigs pas bar chad med par rab tu sbyor ba rnams kyis ni skye ba rjes su zin kyang gdon mi za bar de rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par
translated: Thus, those who apply themselves uninterruptedly by the reasoning of reality will certainly attain that, even if they are reborn, and so will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: 'tshang rgya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: sbyor ba'i phan yon bshad zin to /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phan yon bshad zin to /
translated: The benefits of application have been explained.

original: // / de'i bar chad brjod par bya ba des na /🔽skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
analyzed: // / de'i bar chad brjod par bya ba des na / skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
translated: Now, the obstacles to that should be stated.🔽The faults are definitely to be understood as four sets of ten,

original: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
translated: and six.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is forty-six.

original: de dag las kyang tshegs chen pos 'thob pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu tshegs chen po dang / yun ring pos spobs pa skyes pas gang @132b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las kyang tshegs chen pos 'thob pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu tshegs chen po dang / yun ring pos spobs pa skyes pas gang @132b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And among those, that which is attained with great difficulty is what is said to be the cause of completing the perfections with great difficulty and over a long time, and is the cause of the arising of eloquence.

original: spobs pa shin tu myur chas pa nyid ni sngon pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas skabs su ha cang myur bar spobs pa skyes pas brjod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa shin tu myur chas pa nyid ni sngon pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i gnas skabs su ha cang myur bar spobs pa skyes pas brjod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement, “The fault of very quick eloquence is that eloquence arises too quickly and becomes an obstacle to expression,” is the fault of eloquence.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi rnam par 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ni yang glal ba dang / rgod pa dang / phan tshun steg cing 'dri na lus rnam par 'gyur ba'i bar chad nyid yin par gang gsungs pa ste /🔽steg pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus sam lus dang 'brel pas gzhan gyi lus la ku re byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi rnam par 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum ni yang glal ba dang / rgod pa dang / phan tshun steg cing 'dri na lus rnam par 'gyur ba'i bar chad nyid yin par gang gsungs pa ste / steg pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus sam lus dang 'brel pas gzhan gyi lus la ku re byed pa'o //
translated: The statement, “The three types of physical dysfunction are yawning, laughing, and mutual scrutiny, which are obstacles to physical transformation,” is the fault of physical dysfunction.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni gsum ste /
translated: The statement, “The fault of mental dysfunction is the three types of mental dysfunction,” is the fault of mental dysfunction.

original: sems g-yeng ba dang phan tshun rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas 'dri zhing nyan pa dang / bdag gis 'di'i ro myang ba ma rnyed do snyam du sems bskyed nas langs te 'gro ba ni sems kyi bar chad byed pa nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems g-yeng ba dang phan tshun rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas 'dri zhing nyan pa dang / bdag gis 'di'i ro myang ba ma rnyed do snyam du sems bskyed nas langs te 'gro ba ni sems kyi bar chad byed pa nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The interruption of the mind is when one is distracted and listens with a mind full of thoughts of others, or when one gets up and leaves, thinking, I have not found the taste of this.

original: phan chun rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni phan tshun la brten nas dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phan chun rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni phan tshun la brten nas dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind full of thoughts of others is the consciousness of things that cause one to delight in dependence on others.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton la sogs pa byed pa ni yang lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de rnams nyid kyis 'chad pa dang yang sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de rnams nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bar du gcod🔽pa nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton la sogs pa byed pa ni yang lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de rnams nyid kyis 'chad pa dang yang sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba de rnams nyid kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni bar du gcod🔽pa nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The interruption of the body is when one recites, etc., in an improper manner, or when one explains with the very same bodily movements with which one received instruction, or when one retains with the very same mental movements with which one heard, etc.🔽The interruption of both is when one recites, etc., with a mind full of thoughts of others.

original: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa nyid ni nges par ma zhugs pa ni lung mi ston par 'thad pas na /🔽bdag 'dir lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa nyid ni nges par ma zhugs pa ni lung mi ston par 'thad pas na / bdag 'dir lung ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that he is not predicted.🔽Thus, he says that he is not predicted, and that he is not predicted because he has not definitely been determined to be predicted, etc.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.

original: zhes bya ba dang / lung ma bstan pa'i mi bstan pa la sogs pas nges par brtag pa med pa'i 'thad pas rang gi ming yongs su ma brjod pa las dang ba ma thob par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / lung ma bstan pa'i mi bstan pa la sogs pas nges par brtag pa med pa'i 'thad pas rang gi ming yongs su ma brjod pa las dang ba ma thob par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.

original: rgyu nyams pa ni rtsa ba bor nas lo 'dab dang yal ga 'dzin pa'i dpes rgyu yongs su nyams pa'i don dang ; de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten pa las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par skyes par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyams pa ni rtsa ba bor nas lo 'dab dang yal ga 'dzin pa'i dpes rgyu yongs su nyams pa'i don dang ; de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten pa las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par skyes par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.🔽The meaning of degeneration of the result is that he has lost the result, as illustrated by the example of the tree whose roots have been cut and whose branches and leaves wither.

original: gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa ni khyi'i dpes gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams @133a * //
analyzed: gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa ni khyi'i dpes gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams @133a * //
translated: The meaning of degeneration of the cause is that he has lost the cause, as illustrated by the example of

original: pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the degeneration of the object.

original: theg pa mchog las nyams pa ni yang glang po che don du gnyer bas de rnyed bzhin du de'i rjes su chol ba'i dpes theg pa chen po yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin ne //🔽ched du bya ba nyams pa ni /🔽yang rgya mtsho chen po dang ba lang gi rjes snyoms pa'i dpes ched du bya ba yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog las nyams pa ni yang glang po che don du gnyer bas de rnyed bzhin du de'i rjes su chol ba'i dpes theg pa chen po yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin ne // ched du bya ba nyams pa ni / yang rgya mtsho chen po dang ba lang gi rjes snyoms pa'i dpes ched du bya ba yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa'o //
