translated: The degeneration of the supreme vehicle is taught by the example of the man who, while seeking an elephant, finds a cow instead, and then searches for the cow instead of the elephant.🔽The degeneration of the aim is taught by the example of the man who, while seeking a great treasure, finds a small treasure instead.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa ni yang phya mkhan nyi ma'i gzhal med khang gi tshad kyis rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzang byad 'dod pa'i dpes rgyu 'bras rjes su mthun pa las phyin ci log tu bstan pa'i phyir de'i go rims nyams pa'i don gyis
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa ni yang phya mkhan nyi ma'i gzhal med khang gi tshad kyis rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzang byad 'dod pa'i dpes rgyu 'bras rjes su mthun pa las phyin ci log tu bstan pa'i phyir de'i go rims nyams pa'i don gyis
translated: The degeneration of the connection between cause and effect is taught by the example of the man who, while seeking a great mansion, builds a small one instead.

original: gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by the degeneration of the order.

original: gong na med pa'i gnas las nyams pa ni yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal phran snyoms pa'i dpes chos kyi sku'i gnas las yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis bar du gcod pa'i bdud kyi las nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa'i gnas las nyams pa ni yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal phran snyoms pa'i dpes chos kyi sku'i gnas las yongs su nyams pa'i don gyis bar du gcod pa'i bdud kyi las nyid yin par gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The degeneration from the unsurpassed state is the demonic activity of interruption, which is the meaning of complete degeneration from the state of the Dharma body, as stated by the example of the wheel-turning king's vassal kings.

original: yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spobs pa 'byung ba ni chos de dang de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med cing mi dmigs pa dang / chos de dang de'i yul can gyi spobs pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spobs pa 'byung ba ni chos de dang de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la med cing mi dmigs pa dang / chos de dang de'i yul can gyi spobs pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The arising of eloquence in conceptualizing objects is the arising of many kinds of eloquence in the object of that Dharma, which is stated as the non-existence and non-apprehension of that Dharma in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yi ge 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par zhen pa dang / 'di la yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: yi ge 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par zhen pa dang / 'di la yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: Attachment to writing, attachment to non-existence, attachment to the perfection of wisdom in written letters, attachment to this as without letters,

original: yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / lam ma yin pas thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba zhes bya ba ste bar chad rnam pa bdun ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pas dngos po med pa bri bar mi nus pa nyid kyis dang /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / lam ma yin pas thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba zhes bya ba ste bar chad rnam pa bdun ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pas dngos po med pa bri bar mi nus pa nyid kyis dang /
translated: The seven obstacles are as follows:🔽Since all phenomena are not essentially existent, they are not existent entities. Since they are not existent entities, they cannot be written.

original: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par mngon par zhen pa dang / de la yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / bris pa'i yi ge la de yin par mngon par zhen pa dang / de la yi ge med par mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang /
translated: Attachment to nonentities, attachment to the written letters as being that, attachment to the absence of letters in that, mental engagement in objects and so on, enjoyment of gain, honor, and praise, and seeking skillful means through a path that is not the means.

original: bkur sti dang / @133b tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor te bdud kyis nye bar gtad pa'i mdo sde rnams las thabs mkhas pa tshol ba ni bdud kyi las nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bkur sti dang / @133b tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bor te bdud kyis nye bar gtad pa'i mdo sde rnams las thabs mkhas pa tshol ba ni bdud kyi las nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement to seek skill in means in the discourses presented by Mara, having rejected the perfection of wisdom, and to savor the taste of honor and verse is a reference to the very deeds of Mara.

original: 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyis bral ba ni yang nyan pa po dang ; ston pa po dang / mngon par 'brel bas phan tshun 'dun pa can dang / snyom las can nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / snyom las kyis bral ba ni yang nyan pa po dang ; ston pa po dang / mngon par 'brel bas phan tshun 'dun pa can dang / snyom las can nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement to be without aspiration and laziness is a reference to the fact that the listener and the expositor are not mutually inspired, and are lazy.

original: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas bral ba ni yang de dag nyid phan tshun gyi 'dun pa can yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid du gang gsungs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas bral ba ni yang de dag nyid phan tshun gyi 'dun pa can yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid du gang gsungs pa'o ;
translated: The statement to be without the object of aspiration is a reference to the fact that they are mutually inspired, but wish to go to another place.

original: / rnyed pa gtsor byed pa dang / 'dod chen chung ba gnyis kyis bral ba ni yang de dag nyid phan tshun rnyed pa la sogs pa gtsor byed pa dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa dang ldan par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / rnyed pa gtsor byed pa dang / 'dod chen chung ba gnyis kyis bral ba ni yang de dag nyid phan tshun rnyed pa la sogs pa gtsor byed pa dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa dang ldan par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The two, the one who makes profit primary and the one who has little desire, are free from the other two, respectively, who make profit primary and who have little desire.

original: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa'i chos can dang / gtong ba dang / ser sna byed pa dang / ster ba dang / mi len pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dag dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa'i chos can dang / gtong ba dang / ser sna byed pa dang / ster ba dang / mi len pa dang /
translated: Similarly, those who have the virtues of austerity and those who do not, those who have neutral and non-neutral dharmas, those who give and those who are stingy, those who give and those who do not receive,

original: mgo smos pa dang / rnam par spros pas go ba nyid dang / mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mi shes pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: mgo smos pa dang / rnam par spros pas go ba nyid dang / mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang / mi shes pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang /
translated: those who understand through a brief indication and those who understand through an extensive explanation, those who understand the Dharma of the sutras, etc. and those who do not, those who possess the six perfections and those who do not, those who are skilled in means and those who are not,

original: mi mkhas pa dang / gzungs thob pa dang / ma thob ba dang / yi ger 'dri bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang / ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du nyan pa po dang /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dang / gzungs thob pa dang / ma thob ba dang / yi ger 'dri bar 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang / ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du nyan pa po dang /
translated: Those who are not skilled, who have and have not obtained retention, who desire and do not desire to write, who are and are not free from the desire to write, and so on.

original: ston pa po dang / mngon par 'brel pas na bral ba rnam pa bcu gcig po bar chad rnam pa bcu gcig tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ston pa po dang / mngon par 'brel pas na bral ba rnam pa bcu gcig po bar chad rnam pa bcu gcig tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: The eleven types of obstacles should be stated as the eleven types of separation from listening,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as stated in the sutra:

original: gzhan yang de dag nyid sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te yang de dag nyid phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang / bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyi tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa las bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag nyid sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te yang de dag nyid phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang / bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyi tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa las bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, those who possess and do not possess the qualities of training, and so on, and those who are and are not free from mutual desire, and so on, should be known as the works of Mara due to the lack of a complete assembly.

original: ngan 'gro'i 'gro @134a * //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'gro @134a * //
translated: The going of the lower realms

original: ba las phyir phyogs pa ni /
analyzed: ba las phyir phyogs pa ni /
translated: Turning away from the hells means

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'ongs te dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'ongs te dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that if someone comes and speaks in praise of the hells, etc.,

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba la legs par phyogs pa ni /
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba la legs par phyogs pa ni /
translated: Turning toward the happy realms means

original: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi bsngags pa brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that if someone comes and speaks in praise of the gods of the Four Great Kings, etc.,

original: 'di ni snga ma nyan pa po dang / phyi ma 'chad pa po la nges par byas te bral ba bshad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma nyan pa po dang / phyi ma 'chad pa po la nges par byas te bral ba bshad pa yin na /
translated: This is the explanation of the separation of the former listener and the latter speaker.

original: da ni snga ma 'chad pa po dang / phyi ma nyan pa po las nges par bral ba rnam pa bdun brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni snga ma 'chad pa po dang / phyi ma nyan pa po las nges par bral ba rnam pa bdun brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the separation of the former speaker and the latter listener will be explained in seven ways.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar nyan pa po dang ston pa po dag gi phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyis kyang chogs pa dang bral bas bdud kyi las nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar nyan pa po dang ston pa po dag gi phan tshun 'dod pa la sogs pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid kyis kyang chogs pa dang bral bas bdud kyi las nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since they are free from the assembly, they are the work of Mara.

original: ston pa po dang nyan pa po dag snga ma dang phyi mar rnam par bzhag pas kyang bar chad rnams 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa po dang nyan pa po dag snga ma dang phyi mar rnam par bzhag pas kyang bar chad rnams 'jig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teacher and the listener are established as prior and subsequent, and the obstacles are destroyed.

original: zhes nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po gnyi ga snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi gar gnas pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: zhes nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po gnyi ga snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi gar gnas pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: This is for the sake of understanding that both the listener and the expounder are to be known as abiding in both the prior and subsequent.

original: de la ston pa po dang / nyan pa po dang / mngon par 'brel ba rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ston pa po dang / nyan pa po dang / mngon par 'brel ba rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therein, the seven kinds of connection between the teacher and the listener are as follows:

original: gcig pu nyid dang / 'khor la dga' ba nyid dang / rjes su 'brel bar 'dod pa dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang / zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa dang / sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid dang / srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid dang / 'khor la dga' ba nyid dang / rjes su 'brel bar 'dod pa dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa nyid dang / zang zing cung zad tsam 'dod pa dang / sbyin par mi 'dod pa nyid dang / srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: going to places where there is a danger to life,🔽and not going to places where there is no danger to life,🔽and similarly, going to places where there is good harvest, famine, and so on,🔽and not going to places where there is no good harvest, famine, and so on,🔽and going to places that are disturbed by thieves and so on,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du lo legs pa dang / mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / chom rkun la sogs pa'i rgyus dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang /🔽mi 'gro ba dang / khyim la blta bas nyan pa po 'dor bar byed pa ni rab 'byor gzhan yang ston pa po dang dag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du lo legs pa dang / mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / chom rkun la sogs pa'i rgyus dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba dang / khyim la blta bas nyan pa po 'dor bar byed pa ni rab 'byor gzhan yang ston pa po dang dag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: and not going to places that are not disturbed by thieves and so on,🔽and abandoning the listener because of looking at the household that gives food.

original: zas ster ba'i khyim la blta bas de yong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zas ster ba'i khyim la blta bas de yong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with Subhūti, moreover, the teacher... up to because of looking at the household that gives food, he makes them come is stated.

original: bdud sdig can gyis 'byed pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis 'byed pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the evil Mara to divide is

original: gzhan yang bdud sdig to can @134b 'di skad du nged kyi mdo sder ji ltar byung ba de yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdud sdig to can @134b 'di skad du nged kyi mdo sder ji ltar byung ba de yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the evil Mara says, “It is just as it appears in our sutras.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not it.”

original: zhes bya ba dang / yang 'byed pa'i sbyor bas de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshogs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / yang 'byed pa'i sbyor bas de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshogs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And, “The application of division is that one who practices this perfection of wisdom will manifest the limit of reality.” This is the application of separating from the collection, which is taught.

original: bcos ma nye bar sgrub pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud dang rab tu ldan pa bdud kyis gtad pa la de'i las su yongs su spong bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcos ma nye bar sgrub pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ni bdud dang rab tu ldan pa bdud kyis gtad pa la de'i las su yongs su spong bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The application of establishing a counterfeit is the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom, which is given by Mara, the evil one, and is said to be completely abandoned as his work.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la sogs par dga' ba bskyed pa ni gzhan yang bdud sangs rgyas kyi cha byad 'dzin pa mthong nas 'dod pa skye ba dang / bdud kyis sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba la 'dod pa bskyed pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la sogs par dga' ba bskyed pa ni gzhan yang bdud sangs rgyas kyi cha byad 'dzin pa mthong nas 'dod pa skye ba dang / bdud kyis sprul pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba la 'dod pa bskyed pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: One degenerates from the knowledge of all aspects due to the generation of desire upon seeing a demon in the guise of a Buddha, and due to the generation of desire upon seeing a bodhisattva emanation of a demon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos thams cad spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos thams cad spyod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because in the perfection of wisdom, all dharmas are not practiced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because dharmas are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che chen po'i dpes ni de la de lta bu'i bar chad mang po yod du zin kyang bar chad ni chos bsal bar byas pa'i phyir na dkar po'i phyogs ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i rgyu nyid
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rin po che chen po'i dpes ni de la de lta bu'i bar chad mang po yod du zin kyang bar chad ni chos bsal bar byas pa'i phyir na dkar po'i phyogs ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i rgyu nyid
translated: The example of the great jewel of Jambudvipa shows that although there are many such obstacles, since the obstacles are removed, the side of virtue is completely perfected, due to the power of the Buddha.

original: dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bu mang po yod pa'i ma'i dpes de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dgongs pas de la brtson pa rnams kyis srung pa la sogs pa mdzad pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bu mang po yod pa'i ma'i dpes de la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dgongs pas de la brtson pa rnams kyis srung pa la sogs pa mdzad pa nyid dang /
translated: The example of the mother of many children shows that all noble beings, such as buddhas and bodhisattvas of the worlds of the ten directions, watch over those who strive in that practice.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rnams bskyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because they generate buddhas and reveal the world.

original: sbyor ba'i bar chad rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bar chad rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The obstacles to application have been explained.

original: // / de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya dgos pa'i phyir /🔽gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: // / de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya dgos pa'i phyir / gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
translated: Since its characteristics must be expressed,🔽it is said:

original: shes bya de yi rnam pa gsum //🔽shes pa khyad par byed pa ste //
analyzed: shes bya de yi rnam pa gsum // shes pa khyad par byed pa ste //
translated: The object to be known is threefold,🔽in terms of the characteristics of the knower,

original: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon bya yang //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon bya yang // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the known, and the nature of both.

original: de ltar na @135a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @135a * //
translated: Thus,

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the characteristics are fourfold.🔽The characteristic of knowledge should be understood as sixteenfold,

original: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni re zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyis dbang du byas nas rnam pa bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni re zhig thams cad shes pa nyid kyis dbang du byas nas rnam pa bcu drug tu shes par bya'o //
translated: in terms of the knowledge of all aspects, etc.🔽How is that?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata, the world,🔽the non-annihilation of beings, the conduct of beings' minds,🔽their inclusion, their regression,🔽the inexhaustibility of aspects,🔽the knowledge of the attached, etc., the vast,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya che dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya che dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang //
translated: the great, the immeasurable,🔽the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the absence of attributes,🔽the knowledge of the perfection of the Buddha's work,🔽the knowledge of the absence of conceptualization,🔽the knowledge of the absence of attributes,🔽the knowledge of the absence of characteristics,🔽the knowledge of the absence of arising,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-arising,🔽the knowledge of the absence of entities,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-entities,🔽the knowledge of the absence of self,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-self,🔽the knowledge of the absence of grasping,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-grasping,🔽the knowledge of the absence of birth,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-birth,🔽the knowledge of the absence of death,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-death,🔽the knowledge of the absence of affliction,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-affliction,🔽the knowledge of the absence of abandonment,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-abandonment,🔽the knowledge of the absence of peace,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-peace,🔽the knowledge of the absence of arising,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-arising,🔽the knowledge of the absence of birth,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-birth,🔽the knowledge of the absence of appearance,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-appearance,🔽the knowledge of the absence of existence,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-existence,🔽the knowledge of the absence of entities,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-entities,🔽the knowledge of the absence of self,🔽the knowledge of the absence of non-self,🔽the knowledge

original: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems ltar med dang shes pa ste //
analyzed: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems ltar med dang shes pa ste //
translated: And like mind, it is not a knower.🔽Motion and so forth are objects of knowledge,

original: g-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
translated: And other than these, they are

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness of suchness.

original: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs te //
analyzed: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs te //
translated: The Sage realizes suchness,🔽And teaches it to others.

original: gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya 'di //🔽thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
analyzed: gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya 'di // thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
translated: This is the summary🔽Of the defining characteristics of knowledge

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the context of the knowledge of all things.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni stobs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mtshan nyid kyi bar sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams bskyed pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa nyid
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes pa ni stobs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mtshan nyid kyi bar sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams bskyed pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bskyed pa nyid
translated: Here, the arising of the Tathāgata refers to the perfection of wisdom giving rise to the qualities that make one a buddha, such as the powers and so forth up to the characteristics. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is itself the producer of the Tathāgatas.

original: du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: 'jig rten 'jig pa med pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis na phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis 'jig pa ma yin rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid nges par ston par
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig pa med pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis na phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis 'jig pa ma yin rab tu 'jig pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid nges par ston par
translated: The statement “the world is not destroyed” means that emptiness and so on are not destroyed. The reality of the aggregates and so on is not destroyed, is not utterly destroyed, and so on.

original: byed pa nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By teaching this, it is said that the world is emptiness.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de la sems can dang der gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de la sems can dang der gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la sogs pa nas /
translated: The knowledge of the mental activity of sentient beings is the knowledge of the activity of all sentient beings, because it depends on the perfection of wisdom.🔽In that, the world is emptiness because the sentient beings and the causes for designating them, from the aggregates up to omniscience, are not apprehended.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa ni yin na /
analyzed: de la re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa ni yin na /
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom itself is not apprehended is the logical argument.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du lta ga la yod ces bya @135b pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du lta ga la yod ces bya @135b pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: How much less so the knowledge of all aspects! is the statement.

original: sems can bsdus pa shes pa dang de dag nyid g-yengs pa shes pa ni gang la re zhig chos rnams kyi chos nyid ma dmigs pa des sems can thams cad kyi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can bsdus pa shes pa dang de dag nyid g-yengs pa shes pa ni gang la re zhig chos rnams kyi chos nyid ma dmigs pa des sems can thams cad kyi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the collection of sentient beings and the knowledge of their distraction is stated as the knowledge of the collection of the minds of all sentient beings and the knowledge of their proliferation and distraction, which is the knowledge of the suchness of phenomena that does not apprehend any phenomena.

original: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni yang de rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / spong ba rnams kyi mi zad pa'i rnam pa rab tu mkhyen par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni yang de rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / spong ba rnams kyi mi zad pa'i rnam pa rab tu mkhyen par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of the inexhaustibility of mind is stated as the knowledge of the aspect of the inexhaustibility of their detachment, cessation, and abandonment.

original: sems dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa shes pa dang / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa shes pa dang / sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of a mind with passion, etc., and the knowledge of a mind without passion, etc.,

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: are the knowledge of a mind with passion as it really is, and the knowledge of a mind without passion as it really is.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Subhuti, a mind that is in accordance with reality is not apprehended, and a dharma that arises from a mind is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa'i sems ni dmigs su med cing sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med do zhes bya bas 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa'i sems ni dmigs su med cing sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med do zhes bya bas 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu
translated: This is the knowledge of a mind with passion, etc., as it really is,

original: shes par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: which is taught as the knowledge of a mind with passion, etc., as it really is.

original: sems rgya chen po shes pa ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas rgya cher mi byed pa'i phyir sems rgya che ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po shes pa ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas rgya cher mi byed pa'i phyir sems rgya che ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of an expansive mind is the knowledge of an expansive mind as it really is, which is taught as the knowledge of an expansive mind as it really is, because the intrinsic nature of a mind is not apprehended, and therefore it is not made expansive.

original: sems chen por gyur pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems chen por gyur pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the mind becoming great

original: de bzhin du sems chen por gyur pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems chen por gyur pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: is just as it is said: “The mind becomes great.”

original: sems tshad med pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems tshad med pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the immeasurable mind

original: sems kyi rgyun ni rten med cing tshad med pas te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ni rten med cing tshad med pas te /
translated: is just as it is said: “The stream of mind is without support and immeasurable.

original: gang la gnas par 'gyur ba de rnams la de rnams kyi rten yod pa ma yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la gnas par 'gyur ba de rnams la de rnams kyi rten yod pa ma yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no support for them in those places where they would abide.”

original: sems bstan du med par shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems bstan du med par shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the mind as unmanifest

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is just as it is said: “Because of the emptiness of its own mark, it is without mark.”

original: sems bltar med pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems bltar med pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the mind as invisible

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga la sems de dag snang bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga la sems de dag snang bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is just as it is said: “The mind does not appear in the five eyes of the Tathāgata.”

original: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa @136a * //
analyzed: sems g-yo ba la sogs pa @136a * //
translated: The knowledge of the mind as unmoving, etc.

original: shes pa ni sems 'phro ba dang 'du ba la sogs pa phung po lnga la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni sems 'phro ba dang 'du ba la sogs pa phung po lnga la brten pas skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Consciousness arises and occurs in dependence on the five aggregates, such as the mind’s movement and stillness, etc.

original: de la sgrub pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: In this regard, movement, etc. are established as follows:

original: bdag gang dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gang dang 'jig rten rtag ces bya ba de nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o //
translated: “The self and the world are permanent” is true, the others are ignorant.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te srog gang yin pa 'di ni lus so zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te srog gang yin pa 'di ni lus so zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from the beginning up to “This life-force is the body” and “This is based on consciousness.”

original: rang gi yul la sems 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul la sems 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind’s engagement with its own object is called “movement.”

original: btsum pa la sogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas sems yul gzhan du mi 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: btsum pa la sogs pa bkag pa'i sgo nas sems yul gzhan du mi 'jug pa ni /
translated: The mind’s non-engagement with another object due to the obstruction of closing the eyes, etc.

original: bdag dang 'jig rten mi rten ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten mi rten ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: is stated from “The self and the world are impermanent” up to🔽“The self and the world are finite” and “The self and the world are infinite.”

original: srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phung po lnga mkhyen pas g-yo ba la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa nyid du gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no // de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yang de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phung po lnga mkhyen pas g-yo ba la sogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa nyid du gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The statement life is one thing, the body is another up to it is based on consciousness is the knowledge of the consciousness of reality.🔽The statement the consciousness of reality is the knowledge of the five aggregates just as they are, as reality, is the knowledge of the movement, etc. of the consciousness of reality.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa de gzhan la yang dag par ston zhing 'dogs pa shes pa ni /🔽rab 'byor de ltar na sems 'phro ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa de gzhan la yang dag par ston zhing 'dogs pa shes pa ni /🔽rab 'byor de ltar na sems 'phro ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

original: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the basis for the suchness of all phenomena, and the Tathagata, having fully awakened to it, has explained it.

original: da ni ji ltar lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the generation of the Tathagata by the sixteen aspects of the knowledge of the path,🔽Emptiness, signlessness, and also wishlessness,🔽Non-production, non-cessation, and so forth,🔽The undifferentiated nature of phenomena,

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //🔽lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //🔽zhes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la // lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni // zhes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
translated: The unconditioned, and non-conceptuality,🔽The absence of distinctions, and the absence of characteristics,🔽Are asserted to be the characteristics

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path.

original: de la stong pa nyid @136b dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid @136b dang ; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness

original: de la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the knowledge of the characteristics of emptiness, etc.🔽The knowledge of non-production, non-cessation, etc.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa shes pa ni de la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa shes pa ni de la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the knowledge of the characteristics of non-production, non-cessation, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa shes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid shes pa dang / rten med pa shes pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid shes pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa shes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid shes pa dang / rten med pa shes pa dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid shes pa bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes the knowledge of non-defilement and non-purification, the knowledge of non-existence, the knowledge of non-substantiality, the knowledge of the characteristic of space.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhes bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhes bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There is no characteristic of defilement, purification, etc.”

original: chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid rnam par 'khrugs pa med pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the undistorted reality

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid de yin pa'i phyir des mtshan nyid de dor ba mi nus pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtshan nyid de yin pa'i phyir des mtshan nyid de dor ba mi nus pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, it is said that one cannot discard that characteristic.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of non-performance is

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid de mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid de mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: said to be the characteristic of form up to omniscience itself, which is not performed.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa ni de dag gis mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'dus byas kyi dngos po bzlog zla dang bcas pa bkag pas nam mkha'i dpes lam shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yang dag par ston par byed pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa ni de dag gis mtshan nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'dus byas kyi dngos po bzlog zla dang bcas pa bkag pas nam mkha'i dpes lam shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yang dag par ston par byed pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of non-conceptuality is said to be the characteristic of those, which is the negation of contaminated, mundane, and conditioned things, along with their opposites, by the example of space, in terms of the knowledge of the path.

original: rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung zhes bya ba nas brtsams te gang la dpyad pas de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung zhes bya ba nas brtsams te gang la dpyad pas de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The knowledge of their differentiation is indicated by the passage beginning with “whether a Tathagata appears or does not appear” and ending with “it is a great wonder that the Tathagata, having fully awakened to the reality of all the characteristics, should demonstrate it.”

original: mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pas rnam par 'gyur ba med par sems can gyi don byed pa'i 'bras bu ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽mtshan nyid med par shes pa yang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pas rnam par 'gyur ba med par sems can gyi don byed pa'i 'bras bu ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no // mtshan nyid med par shes pa yang /
translated: It is the result of acting for the benefit of sentient beings without change.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yongs su gtong @137a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yongs su gtong @137a * //
translated: The knowledge of the absence of characteristics is indicated by the passage beginning with “the characteristic of form is that it is capable of materiality” and ending with “the characteristic of the perfection of generosity is the complete relinquishment of all one’s possessions.”

original: ba la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang / chad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byin par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang / chad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'khrugs pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi nges par 'byin par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the characteristics of the concentrations, the formless attainments, and the immeasurables, the characteristics of the factors of enlightenment, and so on, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byed pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects, which are the direct realizations. The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics of all those.

original: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir na de rnams ni 'khrugs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir na de rnams ni 'khrugs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can du shes par bya'o //
translated: The concentrations and formless attainments should be understood to have the characteristic of non-disturbance because the noble path is generated in dependence on them.

original: 'di phan chad ni ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa de las brtsams ni /
analyzed: 'di phan chad ni ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam pa bcu drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa de las brtsams ni /
translated: That is the knowledge of the support,🔽respect,

original: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
analyzed: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
translated: the state of being a guru,🔽pleasing,🔽the absence of action,🔽the knowledge of all activities,🔽the teaching of the unseen,🔽the aspects of the emptiness of the world,

original: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
translated: the manifestation of the knowledge of expression,

original: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: the teaching of the inconceivable and peace,

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
translated: the cessation of the conceptions of the world,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: the knowledge of the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the characteristics of knowledge.🔽The knowledge of the support is as follows.

original: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyid kyi chos la brten nas gnas pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de nyid kyi chos la brten nas gnas pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the support is the knowledge of the support of the Tathagata himself.

original: rab 'byor gang gis de ltar bskyed pa dang / ston pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos 'di la brten cing gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gis de ltar bskyed pa dang / ston pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos 'di la brten cing gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, because of the cause of generating and teaching, the Perfectly Awakened One is said to rely on and abide in this Dharma.

original: de la gus par bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / mchod par shes pa dang / chos de la rim gror mdzad pa dang / bkur stor mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa ni byas pa mkhyen zhing byas pa tshor ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gus par bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / mnyes par bya ba dang / mchod par shes pa dang / chos de la rim gror mdzad pa dang / bkur stor mdzad pa dang / bsti stang mdzad pa dang / mchod pa mdzad pa ni byas pa mkhyen zhing byas pa tshor ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, knowing to respect, revere, please, and make offerings to that Dharma, and serving, honoring, respecting, and worshipping it, is said to be knowing and appreciating what is done.

original: byed pa med pa nyid shes pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa med pa nyid shes pa ni /
translated: Knowing the absence of activity is

original: byed @137b pa ngo med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed @137b pa ngo med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: said to be fully awakened to all dharmas as unmade, because there is no activity.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba shes pa ni /
translated: Knowing the all-pervading is

original: yang ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug ste zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the signless entry into all dharmas that is the entry into the wisdom that is not made.

original: ma mthong ba'i don ston pa ni /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of not seeing is taught.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i don gyis ma mthong ba'i gzugs mthong ba'i phyir de ni 'jig rten ston pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i don gyis ma mthong ba'i gzugs mthong ba'i phyir de ni 'jig rten ston pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the consciousness that has not arisen from the observation of form up to the observation of the knowledge of all aspects is the meaning of not seeing. Because form is seen, it is the teaching of the world.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / mthong bar mdzad pa shes pa ni go rims bzhin du yang dag par bsdus pa dang / yongs su smin par gyur pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i gdul bya rnams la yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / mthong bar mdzad pa shes pa ni go rims bzhin du yang dag par bsdus pa dang / yongs su smin par gyur pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i gdul bya rnams la yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the expression of emptiness, the knowledge of making known, and the knowledge of making seen are, respectively, for the disciples who are to be gathered, ripened, and liberated.

original: ji skad du de ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / ston par mdzad pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du de ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang / ston par mdzad pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, “That is called the emptiness of the world,” and “It is known, it is taught, it is realized.”

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la dgongs nas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum la dgongs nas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad de /
translated: With regard to that, intending the three knowledges, the three types of noble persons are considered,

original: go rims bzhin du phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes pa gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa dang / ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i 'jug pa'i dbang du mdzad nas shes pa gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the three knowledges should be understood as the engagement in one part, the engagement in the object of achievement, and the engagement in the direct realization, respectively.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhi ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang zhi ba shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the inconceivable and peace

original: gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it teaches the inconceivable.

original: 'jig rten 'gog pa shes pa ni yang chos rnams med pa nyid kyis ci nas kyang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung pa de ltar ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa
analyzed: 'jig rten 'gog pa shes pa ni yang chos rnams med pa nyid kyis ci nas kyang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung pa de ltar ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of the world is the perfection of wisdom, which is the producer of the Tathagata, because it teaches the non-existence of all things in such a way that the notion of this world and the next world does not arise.

original: nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what was said.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristic of knowledge has been explained.

original: // / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The characteristic of distinction is to be stated,🔽so it is said:🔽The characteristic of distinction is stated

original: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
translated: by the distinctions of the inconceivable, etc.

original: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: It is distinguished, having the four noble truths for its object,

original: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
translated: and is attained in sixteen moments.🔽The characteristic of distinction is stated

original: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽bden pa'i spyod @138a * //
analyzed: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te / bden pa'i spyod @138a * //
translated: by the distinctions of the inconceivable, etc.🔽The inconceivable refers to the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the Dharma of the Buddha, which is inconceivable even to the great disciples and pratyekabuddhas.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of the pure mind.🔽The pure mind is the seventh stage, because it is the basis of the pure path.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.

original: yul can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul gyis so //🔽khyad zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: yul can zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul gyis so //🔽khyad zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the knowledge of the bodhisattva who is in that stage.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is the object of the

original: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis zhes bya ba ni bden pa re re zhing chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis zhes bya ba ni bden pa re re zhing chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pas so //
translated: The sixteen moments are the four truths, each of which is included in the acceptance and knowledge of doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i khyad par sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
translated: The first moment of suffering is included in the inconceivable distinctions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: The inconceivable Dharma of the Tathagata

original: zhes bya ba bsam pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i don gyis dang ; rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pas yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsam pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i don gyis dang ; rab 'byor gzugs kyang bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pas yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is said to be the meaning of transcending thought, and the inconceivable object is known by the expression “form is inconceivable,” and so on.

original: de ltar byas pas rgyun tu zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spangs pa gang yin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas rgyun tu zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spangs pa gang yin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the knowledge and abandonment of stream enterers up to pratyekabuddhas is explained as the acceptance of a bodhisattva.

original: mi mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The distinction of the unequal is included in the second moment.

original: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba mnyam pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang mi mnyam pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba mnyam pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang mi mnyam pa'o // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The unequal is the meaning of having transcended equality, and Subhuti, form is unequal and so on.

original: gzhal du med pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The distinction of the immeasurable is included in the third moment.

original: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba tshad ma la yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang gzhal du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba tshad ma la yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang gzhal du med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The immeasurable is the meaning of having transcended measure, and Subhuti, form is immeasurable and so on.

original: grangs med pa nyid kyi khyad par sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: grangs med pa nyid kyi khyad par sdug bsngal gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The distinction of the innumerable is included in the fourth moment of suffering.

original: grangs med pa zhes bya ba grangs las yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang grangs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs med pa zhes bya ba grangs las yang dag par 'das pa'i don gyis dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyang grangs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase incalculable means beyond number, and the phrase incalculable forms, etc. means beyond measure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par ched du byed par gyur pa'i phyir na thams cad rgyu'i khyad par gyi sgo nas nye bar dgongs pa @138b yin par bya ba'am
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi khyad par ched du byed par gyur pa'i phyir na thams cad rgyu'i khyad par gyi sgo nas nye bar dgongs pa @138b yin par bya ba'am
translated: The phrase the dharmas of the Tathagata are equal to the unequaled means that all of them are intended by way of the distinctive cause, or else, that they are equal to the unequaled Buddhas by means of these very dharmas and subsequent cognition that are based on the culmination of distinction.🔽 The phrase incalculable forms, etc. means beyond measure, and the phrase incalculable dharmas of the Tathagata means beyond number.

original: / chos dang rjes su shes pa khyad par gyi mthar thug pa la brten pa 'di dag nyid kyis mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang mnyam par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa ni mnyam pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i don gyis na /🔽rab 'byor gzugs kyang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: / chos dang rjes su shes pa khyad par gyi mthar thug pa la brten pa 'di dag nyid kyis mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang mnyam par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa ni mnyam pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i don gyis na /🔽rab 'byor gzugs kyang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase forms, etc. are equal to the unequaled means that they are equal to the unequaled Buddhas by means of these very dharmas and subsequent cognition that are based on the culmination of distinction.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bya bas nye bar gnas pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is present for the Tathagata through deeds that are equal to the unequalled.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud par byed pa'i khyad par kun 'byung gi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud par byed pa'i khyad par kun 'byung gi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
translated: The first moment of the origin of the special collection of all noble persons is included in the example of the minister.🔽The noble dharmas are present through the perfection of wisdom, and the great vehicle and so on are present through the perfection of wisdom.

original: blon po'i dpes 'phags pa'i chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyis 'di ni byang chen po la sogs pas nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: blon po'i dpes 'phags pa'i chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyis 'di ni byang chen po la sogs pas nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that all dharmas are without grasping and without attachment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa nas /
analyzed: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa nas /
translated: It is present without grasping and without attachment to form,🔽and so on up to:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las yongs su gzung bar mi bya /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las yongs su gzung bar mi bya /
translated: One should not grasp at the knowledge of all aspects and the state of a tathāgata, nor should one settle down on them.

original: mngon par zhen par mi bya zhes gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa thun mong ma yin pa'i 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bya zhes gsungs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi thugs su chud pa thun mong ma yin pa'i 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This is the unique reasoning that is the Buddha’s own realization.

original: skyes bu'i khyad par gyis rig par bya ba nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i khyad par gyis rig par bya ba nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The difference that is to be known by means of the difference in the person is included in the second moment.

original: de ni phra ba mdzangs pa mkhas pa rnam par shes pas rig par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ni phra ba mdzangs pa mkhas pa rnam par shes pas rig par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: It is to be known by means of the subtle, the wise, and the learned.

original: / de la phra ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la phra ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the subtle is the object of reality.

original: mdzangs pa ni ma nus pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdzangs pa ni ma nus pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: The wise is the object of the non-able.

original: ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: The learned is the object of the able.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are also twofold:

original: gang dag sngar blo yongs su smin par byas pa so so'i skye bo skye bas 'thob pa'i shes rab don de dag gnyi ga la 'jug par nus pa dang ldan pa mkhas pa dang bden pa mthong bas rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag sngar blo yongs su smin par byas pa so so'i skye bo skye bas 'thob pa'i shes rab don de dag gnyi ga la 'jug par nus pa dang ldan pa mkhas pa dang bden pa mthong bas rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Those who have previously matured their minds are ordinary beings who obtain wisdom through birth. They are skilled in being able to engage in both of those objects and have seen the truth.

original: de dag ni don de gnyi ga la zhugs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni stong @139a * //🔽gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi grangs snyed dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas /
analyzed: de dag ni don de gnyi ga la zhugs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni stong @139a * // gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi grangs snyed dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas /
translated: They have knowledge that engages both of those objects.🔽The distinctive feature of unsharedness is included in the third moment. It is said that this very faith and so on is supreme, since it is the knowledge and elimination of as many sentient beings as there are in the trichiliocosm who become followers of faith

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gyur pa'i shes pa dang spangs pas 'di nyid la mos pa la sogs pa mchog nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du gyur pa'i shes pa dang spangs pas 'di nyid la mos pa la sogs pa mchog nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to pratyekabuddhas.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba'i khyad par kun 'byung gi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni 'di ni phul du byung ba'i chos rgya cher 'chad pa yin pas theg pa gzhan pas 'di la mngon par brtson pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid🔽du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba'i khyad par kun 'byung gi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni 'di ni phul du byung ba'i chos rgya cher 'chad pa yin pas theg pa gzhan pas 'di la mngon par brtson pa rnams myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since this is the extensive explanation of the supreme Dharma, those who strive in this path will swiftly attain nirvana.

original: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i khyad par 'gog pa'i skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i khyad par 'gog pa'i skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni /
translated: The feature of nondecrease and nonincrease subsumed by the first moment of cessation is stated in the sutra:

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur du zin kyang 'di la 'grib pa'am 'phel pa med pa'i che ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur du zin kyang 'di la 'grib pa'am 'phel pa med pa'i che ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Even if all sentient beings were to attain the nirvana that is the great transcendence of sorrow, there would be no decrease or increase in this.

original: drag tu yang dag par sgrub pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: drag tu yang dag par sgrub pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The feature of intense correct practice subsumed by the second moment is stated in the sutra:

original: ba drus ma be'u gzhon nu mi 'dor ba'i dpes mos pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig ldan pa'i thos pa dang ldan pa ni sngon gyi thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba drus ma be'u gzhon nu mi 'dor ba'i dpes mos pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig ldan pa'i thos pa dang ldan pa ni sngon gyi thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The example of the mother cow not abandoning her young calf illustrates the one who is endowed with learning concomitant with aspiration and so on, who is engaged in previous learning and so on.🔽The third moment subsumes the distinctive perfect accomplishment, which is stated as:

original: yang dag par 'grub pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni yang de nyid sangs rgyas mang po la brten pas dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa nyid dang bzlog pas 'phags pa'i sa gzhan gnyis por lhung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni yang de nyid sangs rgyas mang po la brten pas dga' ldan nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa nyid dang bzlog pas 'phags pa'i sa gzhan gnyis por lhung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa
translated: The one who is born here after passing away from Tusita due to relying on many buddhas and the opposite, who falls to the other two ārya levels.🔽The fourth moment subsumes the distinctive focal object, which is stated as:

original: yin no // dmigs pa'i khyad par 'gog pa'i skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni yang rgya mtshor gru zhig pa'i dpes bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par byed pa dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i
analyzed: yin no // dmigs pa'i khyad par 'gog pa'i skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni yang rgya mtshor gru zhig pa'i dpes bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par byed pa dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i
translated: The one who creates obstacles and the one who does not create obstacles, who abide in the sign of attaining omniscience through the example of a ship wrecked in the ocean.

original: dbang du byas te ;
analyzed: dbang du byas te ;
translated: This is from the perspective of

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the meaning of what is stated is that it is the basis for crossing over the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: rten gyi khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni yang bum pa so ma btang ba dang btang ba'i dpes sgrub pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa dang rten yin pa'i ngo bor bstan pa'i don gyis gang @139b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma dang pos bsdus pa ni yang bum pa so ma btang ba dang btang ba'i dpes sgrub pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa dang rten yin pa'i ngo bor bstan pa'i don gyis gang @139b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The distinction of support, included in the first moment of the path, is stated by the example of the unbaked and baked pot, and the meaning of what is stated is that it is the nature of the non-basis and basis of the Dharma of practice.

original: ma tshang ba mad pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: ma tshang ba mad pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gnyis pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The distinction of non-deficiency, included in the second moment,

original: yang rgya mtsho'i gru zag lhan ma byas pa dang byas pa'i dpes sgrub pa ma tshang ba dang tshang ba dang ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rgya mtsho'i gru zag lhan ma byas pa dang byas pa'i dpes sgrub pa ma tshang ba dang tshang ba dang ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is stated by the example of the unmended and mended boat, and the meaning of what is stated is that it is the teaching of non-deficiency and deficiency of practice.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par skad cig ma gsum pas bsdus pa ni /
translated: The distinction of possession, included in the third moment,🔽is stated by the example of the unfilled and filled vessel, and the meaning of what is stated is that it is the teaching of non-possession and possession of the result.

original: yang skyes bu rgas shing nyam chung ba'i dpes lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang yongs su ma bzung bar bstan pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gcig tu ltung
analyzed: yang skyes bu rgas shing nyam chung ba'i dpes lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba dang yongs su ma bzung bar bstan pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gcig tu ltung
translated: Also, by the example of an old, weak person, it shows the difference between being and not being sustained by the perfection of wisdom, the cooperative cause, and skill in means.

original: ba dang mi ltung bar ston pa'i don la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba dang mi ltung bar ston pa'i don la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It shows the difference between falling into the extremes of cyclic existence and nirvana and not falling into those extremes.
