original: ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'dod pa med pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa brten par bya ba la sogs pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par lam gyi skad cig ma bzhi pas bsdus pa ni yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'dod pa med pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sngo bar byed pa brten par bya ba la sogs pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The difference of not relishing, included in the fourth moment of the path, is indicated by the statement that because all phenomena are devoid of essence, one should not grasp at any phenomenon as supreme, and by the statement that one should dedicate the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without desire.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshig lhug pas gsungs pa'i don gang yin pa de tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshig lhug pas gsungs pa'i don gang yin pa de tshigs su bcad pas bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the above prose is summarized in the following verse:🔽Inconceivable, unequalled,

original: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
translated: beyond measure and number,

original: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
translated: the wise who gather all the noble qualities

original: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //
translated: know the path of the wise.🔽Swift knowledge, absence of decrease,🔽accomplishment, perfect achievement,🔽objective, support,🔽completeness, retention,

original: shes myur bri dang gang med dang // sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
analyzed: shes myur bri dang gang med dang // sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
translated: absence of enjoyment, and distinction

original: bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ste //
analyzed: bcu drug bdag nyid ces bya ste //
translated: are the sixteen characteristics of the path of the wise.

original: gang gis lam 'di gzhan dag las //🔽khyad du 'phags pas khyad par lam //
analyzed: gang gis lam 'di gzhan dag las // khyad du 'phags pas khyad par lam //
translated: Since this path is superior to other paths,🔽it is called the path of distinction.

original: zhes bya'o // khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics of distinction have been explained.

original: // / byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now the characteristics of function should be explained.

original: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dpung gnyen gling dang ni //🔽yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyi //
analyzed: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dpung gnyen gling dang ni // yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyi //
translated: and guide,🔽spontaneously present, not actualizing the🔽fruition of the three vehicles,

original: 'bras bu mngon du mi byed bdag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad @140a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du mi byed bdag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad @140a * //
translated: the final activity is the support.

original: pa ste // 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: pa ste // 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: This is the characteristic of activity.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la phan pa'i byed pa ni sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga las yongs su bton cing mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pas ma 'ongs pa'i phan pas bsdus pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: de la phan pa'i byed pa ni sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lnga las yongs su bton cing mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pas ma 'ongs pa'i phan pas bsdus pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no
translated: Among those, the activity of benefit is the benefit of sentient beings, since they are completely extracted from the five transmigrations and are established in nirvana. It is engaged in the benefit of the world, since it is included in future benefit. It is that which is said.

original: // bde ba'i byed pa ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten la bde bar yang dag par zhugs pas tshe 'di'i bde bas bsdus
analyzed: // bde ba'i byed pa ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su bkrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten la bde bar yang dag par zhugs pas tshe 'di'i bde bas bsdus
translated: The function of happiness is that, by engaging in the happiness of the world, the bodhisattva liberates beings from suffering, unhappiness, and agitation and establishes them in nirvana.

original: pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the meaning of the term “happiness” in the sense of being collected by the happiness of this life.

original: skyob pa'i byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba las skyob cing yang mi skye bar byed pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyob pa yin pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa med pa'i chos la
analyzed: skyob pa'i byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba na yod pa'i sdug bsngal gang ci yang rung ba las skyob cing yang mi skye bar byed pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyob pa yin pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa med pa'i chos la
translated: The function of protection is that, by being a protector of the world, the bodhisattva protects from any suffering whatsoever that exists in cyclic existence and teaches the Dharma so that it will not arise again.

original: 'jog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the meaning of the term “protection” in the sense of being established in the Dharma that has no maturation.

original: skyabs kyi byed pa ni sems can skye ba la sogs pa'i chos can rnams phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid kyis gtan du phan pa la zhugs pa'i don gang gsungs🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: skyabs kyi byed pa ni sems can skye ba la sogs pa'i chos can rnams phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu 'god pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid kyis gtan du phan pa la zhugs pa'i don gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The function of refuge is stated in the sense of engaging in permanent benefit, because the world is a refuge through establishing sentient beings, who are subject to birth and so on, in the expanse of nirvana without remainder.

original: gnas kyi byed pa ni chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa dang / 'brel pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par ston pa'i phyir gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las bzlog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas kyi byed pa ni chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa dang / 'brel pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par ston pa'i phyir gnas su gyur pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las bzlog pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The function of basis is stated in the sense of turning away from the cause of suffering, because the basis is taught as the nonmixing, nonconnection, nonarising, and noncessation of all phenomena.

original: dbung gnyen gyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: dbung gnyen gyi byed pa ni gang chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad ma yin no //
translated: The function of friend is stated in the sense of not being a friend, because the other side of all phenomena is not all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes chos ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i pha rol na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yang med do zhes chos ston pa'i phyir /
translated: There is no form, etc., anywhere beyond form, etc.

original: dpung gnyen du gyur pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpung gnyen du gyur pa nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is stated in order to accomplish the realization of the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana through the very nature of being a protector.

original: gling gi byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad @140b pas chus yongs su bskor ba'i skams dang chos mthun par sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa nyid kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gyur pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gling gi byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad @140b pas chus yongs su bskor ba'i skams dang chos mthun par sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'i phyir gling du gyur pa nyid kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten gyi ngo bor gyur pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The function of an island is to show the exhaustion of craving, freedom from attachment, cessation, and nirvana, since it is dry land surrounded by water, which is cut off from the prior and subsequent limits of form, etc. It is stated in order to accomplish the very nature of being a support for the realization of one's own and others' goals through the very nature of being an island.

original: yongs su 'dren pa'i byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos yang dag par ston pa las yongs su 'dren par gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa'i byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir chos yang dag par ston pa las yongs su 'dren par gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The function of guiding is the accomplishment of the aim of others, in the sense of engaging in that, by means of the teaching of the Dharma, which is the guiding itself, because all phenomena, such as form, are ungraspable, unborn, unceasing, unpolluted, and unpurified.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i byed pa ni /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i byed pa ni /
translated: The spontaneous function is taught in the passage beginning with the words:🔽Subhuti, form is of the nature of space, etc.,🔽and continuing up to:

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni nam mkha'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of form is without going.

original: de ni mi 'gro mi 'od ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'gro mi 'od ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It does not go, nor does it come.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Subhuti, all phenomena are of the nature of non-conditioning.

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da' zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis kyang sems can gyi don la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da' zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas chos ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis kyang sems can gyi don la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin
translated: This is stated in terms of the knowledge of all things, and it is stated in terms of the knowledge of all things in order to demonstrate that the buddhas are spontaneously engaged in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: no // thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i byed pa thams cad mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: no // thams cad shes pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i byed pa thams cad mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is stated in terms of the knowledge of all things in order to demonstrate that all the activities of the buddhas are directed toward nirvāṇa.

original: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung zhing de'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung zhing de'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa ni /
translated: The non-actualization of the result of the three vehicles and the renunciation of the three vehicles🔽.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi skye mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi skye mi 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena are by nature unborn, unceasing, uncontaminated, and unpurified.”

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi g-yo ba'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i chos ston pa nyid kyis theg pa ji lta ba bzhin nges par 'byung ba dang de mngon du mi byed pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad mi g-yo ba'i ngang tshul can te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lam shes pa'i chos ston pa nyid kyis theg pa ji lta ba bzhin nges par 'byung ba dang de mngon du mi byed pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa
translated: The passage from Subhuti, all dharmas are in the nature of non-movement up to Subhuti, all dharmas are in the nature of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment teaches the knowledge of paths, and what is taught by that is the meaning of the vehicle that goes forth according to reality and the establishment of not actualizing it.

original: yin no // rten gyi byed pa ni /
analyzed: yin no // rten gyi byed pa ni /
translated: The function of the basis is

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul can te zhes @141a * //🔽bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni gzugs kyi ngang tshul can te zhes @141a * // bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: from Subhuti, all dharmas are in the nature of form up to Subhuti, all dharmas are in the nature of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dang tshul can zhes bya ba chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi don du gang gsungs pa
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi dang tshul can zhes bya ba chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi don du gang gsungs pa
translated: What is taught by that is the meaning of the bodhisattva who goes forth for the sake of the world through teaching all dharmas as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yin no // byed pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: yin no // byed pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristic of function has been explained.

original: // / ngo bo nyid brjod par bya yin pas /
analyzed: // / ngo bo nyid brjod par bya yin pas /
translated: The essence should be stated, so it is said:

original: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang// mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // mi mthun thog pa med dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang// mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya gang yin dang // mi mthun thog pa med dang /
translated: the prohibition of attachment,🔽and that which is called the objective support,🔽the absence of counteragents, the absence of origination,🔽and thusness that is not apprehended,

original: de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //🔽mtshon bya lta bur mtshon pas na //🔽mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid // mtshon bya lta bur mtshon pas na // mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
translated: are the sixteen natures.🔽The four characteristics are accepted as follows:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the characteristic of the object to be characterized,🔽the characteristic of the cause,🔽the characteristic of the result,🔽and the characteristic of the essence.

original: bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How is it said to have the nature of sixteen?

original: nyon mongs pa las dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The nature of solitude from the afflictions

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnam par bsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the very nature of solitude through the removal of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: de'i rtags kyis dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags kyis dben par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rtags kyis dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags kyis dben par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of being isolated from signs refers to what was taught as being isolated from the signs of attachment and so on.

original: de'i mtshan mas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan mas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan mas dben pa'i rang bzhin du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The nature of being isolated from aspects refers to what was taught as being isolated from the aspects of the afflictions.

original: de la rtags ni lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: de la rtags ni lus la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: Here, signs are the negative tendencies of the body and so on.

original: mtshan ma ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Aspects are improper mental activity.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gis dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dag gis dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
translated: The nature of being isolated from the side of the antidotes and the side of what is to be abandoned is

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug med pas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dang tshul can nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang / gti mug med pas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dang tshul can nyid dang /
translated: similarly taught as the nature of being isolated from attachment and nonattachment, from anger and nonanger, and from delusion and nondelusion.

original: lhag par mos par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa'i lam nye bar bkod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par mos par byed pa rnams la bsgom pa'i lam nye bar bkod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught for those who are especially devoted, by setting forth the path of meditation.

original: bya dka' ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: bya dka' ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The essence of difficulty is as follows:

original: chos thams cad shin tu med @141b pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa med pa nyid nye bar bzung nas sems can thams cad yongs su nya ngan las 'das pa'i go chog bya dka' ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa bya dka'
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu med @141b pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa med pa nyid nye bar bzung nas sems can thams cad yongs su nya ngan las 'das pa'i go chog bya dka' ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa bya dka'
translated: Since all phenomena are utterly nonexistent, one should take up the armor of the difficult-to-conquer, the liberation of all sentient beings, and practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: ba'i don du ston pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'i don du ston pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Teacher taught this for the sake of the difficult practice.

original: nges pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de ltar go cha bgos pa ni nyan thos la sogs par lhung ba'i gnas kyi go skabs med pa nyid kyis sgom pa mtha' gcig tu nges par ston pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de ltar go cha bgos pa ni nyan thos la sogs par lhung ba'i gnas kyi go skabs med pa nyid kyis sgom pa mtha' gcig tu nges par ston pa'i don du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The essence of certainty is as follows: One who has thus donned the armor has no opportunity to fall into the states of śrāvakas and so on. It is taught for the sake of showing that the meditation is absolutely certain.

original: ched du bya ba'i don ngo bo nyid ni sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ya shes kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha bgos pas ni ched du bya ba la mi 'khrul bar bstan pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: ched du bya ba'i don ngo bo nyid ni sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ya shes kyi don du byang chub sems dpa'i go cha bgos pas ni ched du bya ba la mi 'khrul bar bstan pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no
translated: The reality of the object to be attained is taught by the statement:

original: // mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
analyzed: // mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
translated: The reality of non-apprehension is taught by the statement beginning with:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin tu zab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin tu zab ste /
translated: Bhagavan, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: de ni sus kyang bsgom par bgyi ba ma lags se zhes bya bas bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni sus kyang bsgom par bgyi ba ma lags se zhes bya bas bsgom par bya ba dang / sgom pa po dang / bsgom pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nas brtsams te /
translated: It is not something that anyone can meditate on.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ma lags so zhes bya bas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam par bsgom pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa sgom pa rnam par bsgom pa ma lags so zhes bya bas thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam par bsgom pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no
translated: Bhagavan, this meditation on the knowledge of all aspects is not a meditation that is a meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // mngon par zhe na med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
analyzed: // mngon par zhe na med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //
translated: The nature of non-attachment is🔽The irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattva should investigate this profound perfection of wisdom with wisdom.

original: rab 'bor shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par ma zhen par yongs su rtog🔽pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'bor shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par ma zhen par yongs su rtog pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, starting from the investigation of non-attachment to the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di bshad pa la mi dang / nga ba la sogs pa rnams kyis lam shes pa'i rnam gyis lam shes pa'i rnams pa bsgom pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di bshad pa la mi dang / nga ba la sogs pa rnams kyis lam shes pa'i rnam gyis lam shes pa'i rnams pa bsgom pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said that this explanation is the cultivation of the aspect of path-knowledge by those who know the path, such as Shariputra and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog pa lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog pa lags zhes bya ba nas brtsams te
translated: The nature of the object is from the question of Subhuti, Bhagavan, how do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas investigate the perfection of wisdom with the intention directed towards omniscience in all aspects?

original: / rab 'byor rmi lam dang sprul pa la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub @142a * //
analyzed: / rab 'byor rmi lam dang sprul pa la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub @142a * //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with a motivation that is intent on dreams and magical creations investigate this deep perfection of wisdom.”🔽Up to “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with a motivation that is intent on dreams and magical creations investigate this deep perfection of wisdom.”🔽The passage from “Will they investigate form up to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nye bar dgod pa dang / gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yong rtog par byed dam zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nye bar dgod pa dang / gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yong rtog par byed dam zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid dang /
translated: up to “Will they investigate the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi skabs su gsungs pa'i dmigs pa sgom pa 'i khyad par gyi zhar la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bsgom pa'i don dris pa dang / rab 'byor byang chub sems d'a sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs nas rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi skabs su gsungs pa'i dmigs pa sgom pa 'i khyad par gyi zhar la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bsgom pa'i don dris pa dang / rab 'byor byang chub sems d'a sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs nas rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti, the bodhisattva mahasattva does not think about form up to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Thus, the special object of observation of the knowledge of all aspects is taught by the meaning of the statement,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i khyad par shes par bye dpa'i don gyis🔽la bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i khyad par shes par bye dpa'i don gyis la bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the buddhadharmas.

original: de la rtog pa ni lhag mthong gi ye shes so //
analyzed: de la rtog pa ni lhag mthong gi ye shes so //
translated: In that regard, thought is the wisdom of vipashyana.

original: 'o na / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: 'o na / dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: But then, The object of observation is all phenomena.

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
translated: and so on, and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Form itself is the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is form.🔽Thus, they are profound in terms of their nature.

original: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya bas de dag phan tshun gyi ngo bo'i zab pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya bas de dag phan tshun gyi ngo bo'i zab pa nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid dag gnyis su byar med pa nyid du gang gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid dag gnyis su byar med pa nyid du gang gsung pa yin no //
translated: It is because the suchness of those is said to be nondual and not made dual.

original: gal te de lta de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'o na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ji ltar 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ji ltar 'thad ce na /
translated: how is the turning of the wheel of Dharma tenable?🔽The suchness of the Buddha and the knowledge of all aspects is nondual and not made dual.

original: sangs rgyas dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dag gnyis su me cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du thugs las chung ba nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin par gsungs te dmigs par bya ba dang
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dag gnyis su me cing gnyis su byar med pa nyid kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du thugs las chung ba nyid kyi rgyu nyid yin par gsungs te dmigs par bya ba dang
translated: The Buddha’s lack of mental activity is the cause for the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: / dmigs par byed pa'i dbye ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / dmigs par byed pa'i dbye ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no distinction in the object of apprehension.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid ni //🔽lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab ba'i phyir chos 'di zab po @142b zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid ni // lha'i bu dag nam mkha' zab ba'i phyir chos 'di zab po @142b zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The nature that is contrary to the whole world is

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: The gods say, “This doctrine is profound because space is profound,” and so on up to “It is not taught for the sake of apprehending the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mi bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags so //
analyzed: mi bzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags so //
translated: It is not taught for the sake of non-apprehension.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni 'dzin pa la spyod do zhes bya bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis ni 'dzin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten ni 'dzin pa la spyod do zhes bya bas 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis ni 'dzin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snod ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the world engages in grasping. By this statement about being contrary to the whole world, it is said that one who engages in grasping is not a vessel for the perfection of wisdom.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa legs par rdzogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad la ye shes kyi chos thogs pa med pa nyid🔽du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten mi dmigs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa legs par rdzogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad la ye shes kyi chos thogs pa med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no // gzhi med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rten mi dmigs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: because it is in accordance with the clear realization of the three kinds of omniscience that is well completed in all aspects.🔽The nature of non-ground is taught as the meaning of the equality of knower and known,

original: shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid kyi don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya mnyam pa nyid kyi don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: starting from the non-apprehension of the basis of form and so forth.

original: 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The nature of non-going is taught

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po mtha' dag kyang skyed par byed pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po mtha' dag kyang skyed par byed pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: in terms of the production of all three kinds of omniscience,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa las gnas brtan rab 'byor dper byas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa las gnas brtan rab 'byor dper byas te /
translated: taking the elder Subhūti as an example in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song bas na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song bas na /
translated: Just as the thusness of the Tathāgata is neither come nor gone, so also the thusness of the elder Subhūti is neither come nor gone.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata.

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas su 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas su 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i chos nyid do //
translated: The thusness of phenomena refers to the general reality of substances such as form that are held to be real.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun gyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun gyi chos nyid do //
translated: The thusness of abiding refers to the reality of a continuum.

original: mi 'gyur zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos khyad par du 'gro ba dang de la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i chos nyid do ;
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos khyad par du 'gro ba dang de la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i chos nyid do ;
translated: The thusness of non-change and non-conceptuality refers to the reality of a practice that progresses to a special state and is free of conceptuality.

original: / dbyer med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbye ba dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: / dbyer med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbye ba dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The suchness of non-division refers to the reality that is not observed as a division of the three vehicles.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum las de bzhin nyid du tshol ba med pa'i chos nyid do //🔽dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang @143a * //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa gsum las de bzhin nyid du tshol ba med pa'i chos nyid do // dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang @143a * //
translated: The suchness of non-differentiation refers to the reality that is not sought as a differentiation of the three vehicles.

original: bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The suchness of the equality of the three times is naturally in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, the suchness of the aggregates, the suchness of the constituents, the suchness of the sense fields, the suchness of dependent origination, and so on, the suchness of the perfection of generosity, and so on, up to the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba mi thob par gyur pa dang mi de'i mtshan ma dbang por gyur pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid du rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba mi thob par gyur pa dang mi de'i mtshan ma dbang por gyur pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten
translated: The signs of that person’s faculties pervade the worlds of the great trichiliocosm,

original: gyi khams su gtogs pa mtho ba dang dam bar gyur ba dang dma' bar gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: gyi khams su gtogs pa mtho ba dang dam bar gyur ba dang dma' bar gyur pa yin pas /
translated: reaching high, low, and in between.🔽At that moment, the worlds of the great trichiliocosm shook in six ways and eighteen great signs appeared.

original: mod las de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par 'gyur ba drug dang mtshan ma chen po bco brgyad du g-yos so //
analyzed: mod las de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par 'gyur ba drug dang mtshan ma chen po bco brgyad du g-yos so //
translated: They shook,

original: rab tu g-yos so //🔽kun ru rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: rab tu g-yos so // kun ru rab tu g-yos so //
translated: they shook strongly,🔽they shook intensely.🔽They trembled,

original: 'gul lo ; / rab tu 'gul lo /
analyzed: 'gul lo ; / rab tu 'gul lo /
translated: they trembled strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu 'gul lo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'gul lo //
translated: they trembled intensely.🔽They quaked,

original: ldeg go // rab tu ldeg go /
analyzed: ldeg go // rab tu ldeg go /
translated: they quaked strongly,🔽they quaked intensely.🔽They shuddered,🔽they shuddered strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu ldeg go //🔽chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu ldeg go // chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: they shuddered intensely.🔽They rattled,🔽they rattled strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //
translated: they rattled intensely.🔽They roared,🔽they roared strongly,

original: 'khrugs rab tu 'khrugs //
analyzed: 'khrugs rab tu 'khrugs //
translated: they roared intensely.

original: kun ru rab tu 'khrug go //🔽'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: kun ru rab tu 'khrug go // 'ur 'ur rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: It is agitated, very agitated,🔽it is agitated everywhere, very agitated,

original: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro zhes gang gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro zhes gang gsung pa yin no //
translated: it is agitated everywhere, very agitated.

original: de la rnam pa drug ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa drug ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the six aspects are: trembling, rising, sinking, moving upward, moving downward, and resounding.

original: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni g-yo ba la sos pa'i 'gyur ba rnams pa drug po de rnams nyid go rims bzhin du chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis shes par bya'o //🔽snyod kyi 'jig rten gyi mngon par 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma nyas pa'i dbang du byas pa dang 'jig rten thams cad na sems can gyi ris bzhi po mi dge ba la spyod pa dang lhag sna tshogs la mos ba dang / nga rgya can dang /
analyzed: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni g-yo ba la sos pa'i 'gyur ba rnams pa drug po de rnams nyid go rims bzhin du chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis shes par bya'o // snyod kyi 'jig rten gyi mngon par 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma nyas pa'i dbang du byas pa dang 'jig rten thams cad na sems can gyi ris bzhi po mi dge ba la spyod pa dang lhag sna tshogs la mos ba dang / nga rgya can dang /
translated: The eighteen great signs are the six aspects of trembling, etc. , which are to be known in order as small, middling, and great.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The world is agitated by the agitation of the world, in terms of the manifest and unmanifest. The world is agitated by the agitation of beings, in terms of the four modes of sentient beings in all worlds: those who practice nonvirtue, those who are devoted to various deities, those who are proud, and those who are righteous.

original: bya chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas g-yos so zhes bya ba nas nas kun tu rab ru 'ur 'ur ro zhes bya ba'i bar tshigs bcom brgyad kyi don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bya chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas g-yos so zhes bya ba nas nas kun tu rab ru 'ur 'ur ro zhes bya ba'i bar tshigs bcom brgyad kyi don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the eight verses from “The small, medium, and great” up to “trembling, trembling” should be understood as taught.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes su @143b skyes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rjes su @143b skyes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught by the arising of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: skye med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: skye med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The nature of non-arising is

original: de ltar na lha'i bu dag gnas bran rab 'byor gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
analyzed: de ltar na lha'i bu dag gnas bran rab 'byor gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
translated: Thus, O Devaputras, the elder Subhūti has not arisen in the form,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su ma skyes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su ma skyes so //
translated: nor has he arisen in the suchness of form.

original: zhes bya ba gnas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnas brtsams te /
translated: Thus begins the section.

original: gang zhig gang rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
analyzed: gang zhig gang rjes su skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis /
translated: All those phenomena that would arise in that way do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de ltar lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su skyes pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught by the arising of the aspect of the knowledge of the path.

original: de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The essence of the non-apprehension of thatness is also called the profound suchness of the transcendent state of all the buddhas.

original: rtag tu de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / chos rnams nyid las chos nyid btsal ba'i don gyis gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang / chos rnams nyid las chos nyid btsal ba'i don gyis gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dang /
translated: It is called suchness because it always exists as such, and it is called unmistaken suchness because it is the meaning of nonerroneousness, and it is called undifferentiable suchness because the dharmatā is sought from the dharmas themselves.🔽It is called dharmatā because it is the meaning of the characteristic of nondifferentiation, and it is called the dharmadhātu because it is the cause of the qualities of the āryas.

original: dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyis chos nyid ces ya ba dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir don gyi chos kyi dbyings zhes bya dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa'i don gyis chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyis chos nyid ces ya ba dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir don gyi chos kyi dbyings zhes bya dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdzad pa'i don gyis chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba dang /
translated: It is called the state of the Dharma because it is the meaning of the activity of all buddhas.

original: rgyud dang rkyen mi 'khrul ba'i chos nge pa nyid ces bya ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pa'i don gyis nas yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rgyud dang rkyen mi 'khrul ba'i chos nge pa nyid ces bya ba dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pa'i don gyis nas yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The ultimate is called the “nature of phenomena that is undeceiving with respect to causes and conditions,” and it is called the “perfect limit” because it is the final, unmistaken meaning.

original: re zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: Since even omniscience is not apprehended,

original: de'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par ltag la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par ltag la 'gyur /
translated: how could its suchness be apprehended?

original: 'dab chags bya lus chen po gyur pa'i dpes sbyin pa la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan du zin kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral zhing thabs mkha' pas yongs su ma bzung na nyan tsho la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba'i don gyis de'i
analyzed: 'dab chags bya lus chen po gyur pa'i dpes sbyin pa la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan du zin kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral zhing thabs mkha' pas yongs su ma bzung na nyan tsho la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba'i don gyis de'i
translated: The example of the bird with a large body shows that even if one is endowed with generosity and so on, if one is devoid of the perfection of wisdom and not sustained by skillful means, one will fall to the levels of the śrāvakas and so on.

original: tshe mang po zhig bstan pa rtogs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe mang po zhig bstan pa rtogs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, many will be taught the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the characteristics of the nature has been completed.

original: // / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, the factors conducive to liberation will be explained.

original: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: The signless is the giving, etc.

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
translated: Skill in the right practice

original: rnam pa thams cad rtog 'di la //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtog 'di la //
translated: is the conception of all aspects.

original: thar pa'i chad dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: thar pa'i chad dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: It is considered to be in conformity with the termination of liberation.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: thog mar sems bskyed pa nas nye bar @144a * //
analyzed: thog mar sems bskyed pa nas nye bar @144a * //
translated: Beginning from the first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: bzung ste / thabs mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa gtong ba mtshan ma mi 'dzin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bzung ste / thabs mkhas pa dang ma bral bar sbyin pa gtong ba mtshan ma mi 'dzin zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: one gives gifts without being separated from skill in means, as it is said, “without seizing on signs,”

original: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽de 'ang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyis rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgom zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no // de 'ang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyis rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: up to the cultivation of the knowledge of all modes without seizing on signs.🔽Moreover, it is fivefold, being of the nature of faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de la / sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la / sangs rgyas sogs dmigs dad pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, faith is the conviction that the Three Jewels are the highest goal.

original: dus gsum gyi sang rgyas dang / de rnams kyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yid la sems kyang mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sang rgyas dang / de rnams kyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po rnams dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yid la sems kyang mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: He does not form mental images of the Buddhas of the three times, nor of their aggregates of morality, etc., nor of the concentrations of signlessness and wishlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni ma snad cing ma smas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni ma snad cing ma smas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that this Bodhisattva will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment without injury or affliction.

original: de la snad pa ni nyan thos la sogs par ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de la snad pa ni nyan thos la sogs par ltung ba'o //
translated: Therein, injury is falling into the state of a Disciple, etc.

original: smas pa ni byang chub chen po la nyams pa'o //
analyzed: smas pa ni byang chub chen po la nyams pa'o //
translated: Affliction is the loss of great enlightenment.

original: sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin sogs spyod yul brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The domain of generosity, etc., is effort.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de thog mar sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de thog mar sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: beginning with the first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: sbyin pa byin pa na /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa na /
translated: when the Bodhisattva gives a gift,

original: shes rab sgom pa'i bar du mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab sgom pa'i bar du mtshan mar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning One should not apprehend a sign in the perfection of wisdom up to the perfection of meditation refers to this.

original: bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // zhes byas ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa phun tshogs dran pa dang // zhes byas ba ni /
translated: The passage beginning The perfection of thought is mindfulness refers to the following.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dang ma bral ba'i bsam pa can gang yin pa de'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni the tshom ma mchis so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dang ma bral ba'i bsam pa can gang yin pa de'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni the tshom ma mchis so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning The unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of one who has the thought of not being separated from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means is not in doubt refers to this.

original: rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The passage beginning The nonconceptual samādhi refers to the following.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po des /🔽gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba'i gzugs sam tshor ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽chos rnams rnams pa thams cad du //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po des / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba'i gzugs sam tshor ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // chos rnams rnams pa thams cad du //
translated: The passage beginning The great bodhisattva who has this samādhi refers to the following.🔽The passage beginning The form or feeling or refers to this.🔽The passage beginning The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all phenomena in all aspects refers to the following.

original: shes pa'i shes rab /🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i shes rab /🔽ces bya ba ni /
translated: The passage beginning The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all phenomena in all aspects refers to the following.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par yang bya ba dang / chos de dag kyang @144b ma mchis shing mi dmigs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'byung bar dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par yang bya ba dang / chos de dag kyang @144b ma mchis shing mi dmigs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'byung bar dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The great bodhisattva should also realize all phenomena in all ways, and since those phenomena do not exist and are not apprehended, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: de rnam lnga /
analyzed: de rnam lnga /
translated: They are fivefold.

original: zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is how the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation are.

original: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag la dbang por brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag la dbang por brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Faith and so on should not be called faculties

original: dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they lack the meaning of faculty.

original: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Those very faith and so on are threefold by the division of small, medium, and great.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnon po yis /
translated: Because it is said:

original: rtogs sla / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtogs sla / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Perfect enlightenment is easily realized by those with sharp faculties.

original: chen pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chen pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of great is the meaning of sharp.

original: de 'ang bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong ba la ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa'i chos de lta bu ma mchis te /
analyzed: de 'ang bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong ba la ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa'i chos de lta bu ma mchis te /
translated: In regard to the emptiness of all things, there is no such thing as a dharma which is fully enlightened, etc.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni stong pa ste /
translated: For, in this way, all dharmas are empty.

original: chos gang 'phel par bgyi ba'am yongs su 'grib par bgyi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed /
analyzed: chos gang 'phel par bgyi ba'am yongs su 'grib par bgyi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed /
translated: There is no dharma which can be increased or decreased, etc.

original: ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni //
translated: It is difficult to understand for the slow-witted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed bla na med pa yang pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bstan pas de mngon par 'tshang rgya bar dka' ba yin pa dang / gzugs pa sogs pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed bla na med pa yang pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bstan pas de mngon par 'tshang rgya bar dka' ba yin pa dang / gzugs pa sogs pa dang /
translated: It is difficult for the bodhisattvas who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river to be fully enlightened, because they are taught that they are not irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de las gzhan pa dang / de'i de bzhin nyid dang / de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhir ldog pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma nye bar mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes can mngon par byang chub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang / de'i de bzhin nyid dang / de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhir ldog pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma nye bar mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes can mngon par byang chub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four kinds of nonapprehension of the signs of the Dharma are taught as the four kinds of perception of signlessness: nonapprehension of the sign of the Dharma as other than that, nonapprehension of the sign of the Dharma as the reality of that, and nonapprehension of the sign of the Dharma as other than that reality.

original: de lta na 'on nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa byang chub pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum med pa nyid kyis mi 'do pa byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na 'on nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa byang chub pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum med pa nyid kyis mi 'do pa byang chub sems dpa' gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that there is only one kind of bodhisattva, since there is no third kind of bodhisattva, such as the one who is enlightened by the vehicle of the disciples and so on.

original: khyed byang chub sems dpa' gcig 'dod dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: khyed byang chub sems dpa' gcig 'dod dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Do you accept only one kind of bodhisattva?

original: bden pa dang gnas pas byang chub sems dang 'gag cig dang du mar kha mi len pa'i chad dang 'thad pas 'bring yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang gnas pas byang chub sems dang 'gag cig dang du mar kha mi len pa'i chad dang 'thad pas 'bring yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: From this point on, the text explains the middle way that does not accept the extreme of the cessation of the bodhisattva spirit or the extreme of its permanence, by means of the truths and reality.

original: de la bden pas zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pas so / gangs pa zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i gnas skabs su rnams su rnam par gnas pa'o//
analyzed: de la bden pas zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pas so / gangs pa zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i gnas skabs su rnams su rnam par gnas pa'o//
translated: Snow means existing in the form of designations.

original: @145a * // gang gis de mtshon par byed pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di'i rtags rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: @145a * // gang gis de mtshon par byed pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di'i rtags rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: By what is that indicated? The three signs of this concordance with a portion of liberation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are those three?🔽The sign of not being discouraged and not being frightened, the sign of not being overwhelmed and not being terrified, and the sign of not having regret and not being afraid.

original: sems mi zhum pa mi dang nga ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi gong ba mi skrag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid la 'gyod pa med pa skrag par mi 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi phyir de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rab tu phye ba rnams la bye brag med par byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: sems mi zhum pa mi dang nga ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi gong ba mi skrag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yid la 'gyod pa med pa skrag par mi 'gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi phyir de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rab tu phye ba rnams la bye brag med par byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa
translated: Because of that, the great bodhisattvas, without distinction, have the conception of bodhisattvas in all the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam par pa gsum mi dmigs pas gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong yid phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar
analyzed: rnam par pa gsum mi dmigs pas gal te byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong yid phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar
translated: If the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's mind does not become timid, does not become discouraged, and does not turn away, then that bodhisattva-mahāsattva will certainly go forth to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa mtshan par mi bye par yang dag par bsgrub pas ni chung du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa mtshan par mi bye par yang dag par bsgrub pas ni chung du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the small is taught by the perfect practice of generosity, etc. without conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'i rnam par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bring gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'i rnam par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bring gsung pa yin no //
translated: The medium is taught by One should train in the aspect of the emptiness of all phenomena and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa rnams dang / de rnams la gzhan du dang / de'i de bzhin nyid dang / de las gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chen po gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa rnams dang / de rnams la gzhan du dang / de'i de bzhin nyid dang / de las gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chen po gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The great is taught by form, etc. and other than that, suchness of that, other than that, and so forth.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: All of these should be understood as having the nature of hearing and reflection,

original: de thog ma kho nar bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the causes for engaging in the teaching from the very beginning.

original: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par yin la /
analyzed: 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par yin la /
translated: Here, liberation is a special separation,

original: de'i cha la phan pas na thar ba'i chad dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i cha la phan pas na thar ba'i chad dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: and since it is beneficial for a portion of that, it is conducive to liberation.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bshad zin to /
translated: The factors conducive to liberation have been explained.

original: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas /🔽dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
analyzed: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa brjod par bya ba yin pas / dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight should be mentioned,🔽so it is said:

original: sems can thams cad yin par brjod //🔽de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yin par brjod // de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
translated: The focal object of the heat stage is said to be all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni bcur bshad do // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The aspects are explained as ten, such as the equality of mind toward them.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Here means from the perspective of the path of preparation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su brjod pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las khyad par du rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin te /
analyzed: ci nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skabs su brjod pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las khyad par du rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin te /
translated: In order to realize the meaning of the factors conducive to penetration, as they are described in the context of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni mngon par @145b rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la 'di sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par @145b rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin la 'di sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: That is the realization of the direct realization, and this is the realization of the application.

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed pa dang / de la dmigs pas gnas pa nyid du gnag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed pa dang / de la dmigs pas gnas pa nyid du gnag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is said that one should generate the sameness of mind towards all sentient beings, and abide in that observation.

original: de bzhin du byams pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid dang / nga rgyal bcom pa bskyed cing g-yo ba med pa la dmigs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du phan pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid dang / gnod pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid dang / nga rgyal bcom pa bskyed cing g-yo ba med pa la dmigs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du phan pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid dang / gnod pa med pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, one should generate the mind of love, and abide in that observation, and generate the destruction of pride, and abide in that observation of immovability, and similarly generate the mind of benefit, and generate the mind of non-harm,

original: mi 'tsho ba'i sems bskyed pa yan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'tsho ba'i sems bskyed pa yan brjod par bya'o //
translated: and generate the mind of non-exploitation, and so on should be stated.

original: de bzhin du ma dang / pha dang / spun dang / srid mo dang ; bu dang / bu mo dang / grogs po dang / yid brtan pa dang / gnyen dang / snga gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems bskyed pa nyid dang / de la dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma dang / pha dang / spun dang / srid mo dang ; bu dang / bu mo dang / grogs po dang / yid brtan pa dang / gnyen dang / snga gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems bskyed pa nyid dang / de la dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Likewise, it is the same with regard to mother, father, brother, sister, son, daughter, friend, intimate, relative, and acquaintance, because of the generation of the Thought and the focusing on them.

original: de la ma dang pa la sogs pa gnyis gnyis gcig tu byas nas rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma dang pa la sogs pa gnyis gnyis gcig tu byas nas rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, mother and father, etc., are taken as two each, so there are ten aspects.

original: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdig pa las ldog cing //
translated: One turns away from evil,

original: sbyin la sogs la gnas pa gzhan //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs la gnas pa gzhan //
translated: and one establishes others in giving, etc.

original: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
analyzed: de dag la ni 'god pa dang // bsngags pa brjod dang mthun pa nyid //
translated: One praises them and is in accord with them.

original: rtser gyur / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtser gyur / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The summit is the highest.

original: de dag la ni zhes bya ba sdig pa las ldog pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa la gnas pa dag dang / bdag kyang srog gcod pa las ldog par bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag la ni zhes bya ba sdig pa las ldog pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa la gnas pa dag dang / bdag kyang srog gcod pa las ldog par bya zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Therein, “them” refers to those who turn away from evil and who are established in giving, etc., and “myself” refers to “I will turn away from taking life,” etc.

original: bdag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang lugs ma yin pa la mnyam par gzhug par bya dang / de la gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan dag la mthun par dga' bar bya ba nyid kyis de'i dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: bdag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang lugs ma yin pa la mnyam par gzhug par bya dang / de la gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan dag la mthun par dga' bar bya ba nyid kyis de'i dmigs pa dang /
translated: I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.

original: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin bzod pa ni /
translated: I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.

original: rang bzhin rten can bden shes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin rten can bden shes pa //
translated: I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtse mo rnams su rang bzhin la brten pa'i dbye bas dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod pa bzhin du ste /🔽ji skad du //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtse mo rnams su rang bzhin la brten pa'i dbye bas dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod pa bzhin du ste / ji skad du //
translated: I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.

original: bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba bas brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba bas brtsams te /
translated: I will explain its benefits, and I will be attentive to it myself.🔽I will encourage others to be attentive to it, I will praise the practice of it, and I will rejoice in it.🔽I

original: bdag nyid kyang skyod med pa la 'jug cing de la gzhan 'god pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no //🔽@146a * // chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang skyod med pa la 'jug cing de la gzhan 'god pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gsungs pa yin no // @146a * // chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
translated: and he himself enters into the unshakable, and he establishes others in it, and so on.

original: smi nyed sog kyis shes par bya //🔽shes bya ba la /
analyzed: smi nyed sog kyis shes par bya // shes bya ba la /
translated: The supreme Dharma should be understood in the same way with regard to sentient beings.🔽The supreme Dharma should be understood in the same way with regard to sentient beings.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same way means

original: rang dang gzhan la brten pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la brten pa nyid kyis so //
translated: with regard to oneself and others.

original: 'de dag gi dmig pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ni sems can rnams smin par byed pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'de dag gi dmig pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ni sems can rnams smin par byed pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The difference in their aim and aspect is that the supreme Dharma is for the sake of maturing sentient beings, etc.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba nas btsams te /
analyzed: ji skad du bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba nas btsams te /
translated: I will mature sentient beings, etc.

original: de ltar slob pa de ni gzugs na dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa de ni gzugs na dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar la sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who trains in this way will have no obscurations with regard to the supreme Dharma, up to the duration of form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des sngon kho nar gzugs la sogs pa yongs su sa bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sngon kho nar gzugs la sogs pa yongs su sa bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has previously taken up form, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yongs su gzung du med pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid dag ga bar 'thad pa nyid kyis ste /🔽'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa de ni ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de yongs su gzung du med pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid dag ga bar 'thad pa nyid kyis ste / 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa de ni ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The nonapprehension of that is the reality of that.

original: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa bzhin no //
