analyzed: rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung du med pha de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, “The nonapprehension of form is the reality of form, and so on up to: the nonapprehension of the knowledge of all modes is the reality of the knowledge of all modes.”

original: nges par 'byed pa'i chad dang mthun pa 'di dag kyang chung du dang dung 'breng dang chen po'i rings kyi dbye bas re re zhing gsung gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i chad dang mthun pa 'di dag kyang chung du dang dung 'breng dang chen po'i rings kyi dbye bas re re zhing gsung gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: These aids to penetration, moreover, are each threefold, according to the division of lesser, etc.

original: de la dro bar gtogs pa chung du ni /
analyzed: de la dro bar gtogs pa chung du ni /
translated: The lesser of the heat aids to penetration is that which is said:

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed pa dang de la dmigs par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed pa dang de la dmigs par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: “The production of the thought of the equality of all beings, and the abiding in the objective support of that.”

original: de'i tsho na gzhan la mi 'tshe ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tsho na gzhan la mi 'tshe ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, one does not harm others.🔽The medium of the heat aids to penetration is that which is said:🔽“The production of the thought of the equality of all beings, and the abiding in the objective support of that.”

original: 'bring ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bring ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la sogs pas gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The medium is the generation of the thought of benefit for all sentient beings and so on.🔽

original: phyi ma la gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽chen po ni /
analyzed: phyi ma la gzhan la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // chen po ni /
translated: The medium is that which is stated by the generation of the thought of benefit for all sentient beings and so forth.

original: ma dang / sring mo la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma dang / sring mo la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The great is that which is stated by the generation of the thought of mother, sister, and so forth and by the very observation of that.

original: de'i tshe dang phyi ma la gzhan la 'dod pa sgrub par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dang phyi ma la gzhan la 'dod pa sgrub par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time and in the future, it is the very desire to accomplish the aims of others.

original: rtse mor gtogs pa chung du ni bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa las ldog par zhes bya ba la sgo pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtse mor gtogs pa chung du ni bdag nyid kyang srog gcod pa las ldog par zhes bya ba la sgo pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The small belonging to the peak is that which is stated by the avoidance of taking life by oneself and so forth.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las bzlog par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las bzlog par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the very desire to turn others away from the cause of suffering.

original: 'bring ni bdag gis kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @146b phyin ba yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bring ni bdag gis kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @146b phyin ba yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The medium is that which is stated by the perfection of the perfection of generosity by oneself and so forth.

original: gzhan bde ba'i rgyal yang dag bar sbyor bar phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan bde ba'i rgyal yang dag bar sbyor bar phyir ro //
translated: because it is the true union of the joy of others.

original: chen po ni dag gis kyang nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chen po ni dag gis kyang nang stong pa nyid bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The great patience is that which is stated in the passage beginning, “The bodhisattva, the great being, should cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag sdug bsngal dang bde bar phyir ci log pa spong bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag sdug bsngal dang bde bar phyir ci log pa spong bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the desire to eliminate the error of others in regard to suffering and the error of others in regard to happiness.

original: bzod ba chung du ni bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod ba chung du ni bdag gis kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The small supreme worldly realization is that which is stated in the passage beginning, “I should fully understand suffering,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag 'phags pa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'phags pa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the desire to connect others to the ārya path.

original: 'bring ni bdag gis kyang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir shes pa bskyed de yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bring ni bdag gis kyang rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir shes pa bskyed de yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The medium supreme worldly realization is that which is stated in the passage beginning, “I should generate the knowledge that realizes the fruit of stream-enterer and I should not actualize the very limit of reality,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag 'bras bu le nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'bras bu le nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others are definitely joined to the result.🔽The great is that which is stated:

original: chen po ni bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par byang chub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chen po ni bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par byang chub par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “I will also awaken to the faultless enlightenment of a bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag sangs rgyas nyid las yang dag par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag sangs rgyas nyid las yang dag par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others are definitely joined to buddhahood.

original: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i bzod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i bzod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the forbearance of a single moment.

original: chos kyi mchog chung du ni /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog chung du ni /
translated: The small supreme mundane quality is that which is stated:

original: bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “I will also ripen sentient beings,” and so on.

original: khyad par med par theg pa gsum gyis de yongs su smin par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par theg pa gsum gyis de yongs su smin par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the desire to ripen them by means of the three vehicles without distinction.🔽The medium is that which is stated:

original: 'bring ni / bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring ni / bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa bskyed par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “I will also generate the superknowledges of a bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: sems can rnams khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i lam la nges par sbyor bar 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are intent on definitely joining sentient beings to the Bodhisattva path.

original: chen po ni /
analyzed: chen po ni /
translated: The great is that which is stated:

original: bdag gis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed par bya zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “I too will generate the exalted wisdom of omniscience.”

original: gzhan dag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar thug pa la 'jig par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ji ltar bzod pa chen pa skad cig ma gcig yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog yin no zhes gsungs pa de ni rang @147a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rab kyi mthar thug pa la 'jig par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar bzod pa chen pa skad cig ma gcig yin pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog yin no zhes gsungs pa de ni rang @147a * //
translated: Because they are intent on the highest perfection of others.

original: gi don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gi don gyi dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: The statement that just as the great patience is a single moment, so too are the supreme mundane state, is from the perspective of one’s own aim.

original: 'di ni gzhan la brten pa'i chung du dang 'bring dang chen po 'di dbye ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la brten pa'i chung du dang 'bring dang chen po 'di dbye ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is an explanation of the division of the small, medium, and great patience in dependence on others.

original: gzhan gyi don la ni rim gyis gnas skabs yod pa yin bas de dang 'di la 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la ni rim gyis gnas skabs yod pa yin bas de dang 'di la 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Since there is a sequence of states in the case of others, there is no contradiction with this.

original: sbyor pa'i lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bshad zin bshad te /
analyzed: sbyor pa'i lam gyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bshad zin bshad te /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight on the path of preparation have been explained.

original: // / ci ste 'di nyan thos kyi dag 'dun nam byang chub sems dpa'i dag 'dun gang yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / ci ste 'di nyan thos kyi dag 'dun nam byang chub sems dpa'i dag 'dun gang yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now we must explain whether this refers to the saṅgha of śrāvakas or the saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: de la nyan thos kyi dag 'dun ni lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhi yin par shes par zad do /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi dag 'dun ni lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhi yin par shes par zad do /
translated: The saṅgha of śrāvakas is known as the four pairs of individuals, classified by the path and its result and the result and the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun brjod par bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun brjod par bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: The saṅgha of bodhisattvas is described in three contexts:🔽the context of the path of preparation that is subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight,🔽the context of the path of seeing that is subsumed by the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena and the knowledge of the nonarising of phenomena,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa sbyor pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang / bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pa mthong pa'i lam gyis gnas skabs dang / rgyun dang ldan pa bsgom pa'i lam gnas skabs de gang gi phyir /🔽nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa sbyor pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs dang / bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pa mthong pa'i lam gyis gnas skabs dang / rgyun dang ldan pa bsgom pa'i lam gnas skabs de gang gi phyir / nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste /
translated: and the context of the path of meditation that is subsumed by the uninterrupted and liberated paths.🔽The saṅgha of bodhisattvas is on the paths

original: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag lags //
analyzed: mthong dang goms pa'i lam dag lags //
translated: of seeing and meditation, beginning with the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gang dag gnas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gang dag gnas /
translated: Where are the bodhisattvas who are irreversible?

original: de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: Here they are the assembly of the irreversible.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dag 'dun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dag 'dun zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “pure and intent.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa las de'i khyad par brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa las de'i khyad par brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since it is to be expressed as different from the śrāvakas, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
translated: The signs of turning away from form, etc.,

original: rnam pa nyid shur brjod pa yis //🔽nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa nyid shur brjod pa yis // nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //
translated: are said to be the aspects themselves.🔽The signs of irreversibility

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan yid 'di //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan yid 'di //
translated: of those abiding in the branches of penetration

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: are said to be these.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa ni /
translated: Therein, turning away from form, etc.,

original: rab 'byor chos thams chad ni rnam pa med pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams chad ni rnam pa med pa /
translated: is to be known as “Subhūti, all phenomena are without aspects,

original: rtags med pa /
analyzed: rtags med pa /
translated: without signs,

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i 'brel pa bkag pas gzungs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar las phyir ldog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa nyid yin pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i 'brel pa bkag pas gzungs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar las phyir ldog pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa nyid yin pa dang /
translated: without marks,” and the cessation of the connection between the knower and the known is the irreversibility of the bodhisattva from form up to perfect complete enlightenment. This is the irreversibility of the bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la gos pa la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la gos pa la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three statements are made with regard to form, because it is unattached, because it is unattached by nature, and because it is unattached by nature.

original: de la rnams pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnams pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Among them, the aspect is included in the side of the antidote.

original: rtags ni rang la brten pa'i mtshan mas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni rang la brten pa'i mtshan mas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The sign is included in the mark that is based on it.

original: @147b mtshan ma ni de yongs su longs spyod pa'i rkyen du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: @147b mtshan ma ni de yongs su longs spyod pa'i rkyen du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The mark is understood as the condition for the complete enjoyment of that.🔽Moreover, because of the absence of doubt, one does not bow down to other gods, nor does one offer flowers, etc.

original: yang the tshom med pa nyid kyis lha gzhan la phyag mi 'tshal zhing me tog la sog pa sbyin par mi byad pa dang / yang mi khom pa brgyad dang bud med kyi dngos po yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang ste /
analyzed: yang the tshom med pa nyid kyis lha gzhan la phyag mi 'tshal zhing me tog la sog pa sbyin par mi byad pa dang / yang mi khom pa brgyad dang bud med kyi dngos po yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang ste /
translated: And one does not take up the eight unfavorable conditions or the state of a woman.

original: de la mi kho ma pa brgyad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi kho ma pa brgyad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The eight unfavorable conditions are as follows:

original: log par lta ba dang / dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka' mi thos pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba dang / dbang po rnams blun zhing lugs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka' mi thos pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob tu skye ba dang / dbang po rnams blun zhing lugs pa nyid dang /
translated: It is to be born in the hells, as an animal, or in the world of Yama; to not hear the Buddha’s teachings; to be born in a border region; to have dull and impaired faculties;

original: lha tshe ring por skye ba'o //
analyzed: lha tshe ring por skye ba'o //
translated: and to be born as a long-lived god.

original: yang dag nyid dag ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas te /
analyzed: yang dag nyid dag ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas te /
translated: “It is to abide in the path of the ten actions that are correct and pure;

original: de nyid la gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la mthun pas dga' ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la mi dmigs te pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom zhing mdo la sogs pa sbyin pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid la gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / de la mthun pas dga' ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la mi dmigs te pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom zhing mdo la sogs pa sbyin pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang /
translated: to encourage others in that; to praise it; to rejoice in it; to cultivate the six perfections without apprehending any sentient being; to fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings by giving them the sūtras and so on;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / chos thams cad mthong ba med pas chos zab mo la dogs pa dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom med pa dang ste ;
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / chos thams cad mthong ba med pas chos zab mo la dogs pa dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom med pa dang ste ;
translated: and not having doubts, uncertainty, or skepticism about the profound Dharma because of not seeing any phenomena.

original: de la lam gzhan 'dod pa ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam gzhan 'dod pa ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir dogs pa'o //
translated: Here, “doubts” are doubts because of not being complete.

original: lam drang po dang mi mthun pa ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: lam drang po dang mi mthun pa ni yid gnyis so //
translated: “Uncertainty” is not being in accord with the straight path.

original: rigs kyi chos la dag ba rnams pa sna tshogs la 'phel bar gro ba med pas na gsor mi rung ba'i phyir the tshom mo //
analyzed: rigs kyi chos la dag ba rnams pa sna tshogs la 'phel bar gro ba med pas na gsor mi rung ba'i phyir the tshom mo //
translated: “Skepticism” is not being able to be cured because of not being able to increase the various aspects of the qualities of the family.

original: byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dang lhan cig mi gnas pa dang ste /
analyzed: byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa dang / sgrib pa lnga dang lhan cig mi gnas pa dang ste /
translated: He is endowed with loving physical, verbal, and mental actions, and does not dwell together with the five hindrances.

original: de la sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: Here, the five hindrances are will for sense objects, malice, torpor and sleep, excitedness and regret, and doubt.

original: bag la nyal ba thams cad nas thams cad du med pa ni ma rig pa dang lta ba'i zag pa bsdus pa'i bag la nyal yin gyi /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba thams cad nas thams cad du med pa ni ma rig pa dang lta ba'i zag pa bsdus pa'i bag la nyal yin gyi /
translated: The complete absence of latent tendencies is the latent tendency that includes the contaminants of ignorance and views.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattva is not included in the contaminants of desire and existence, because he takes existence intentionally.

original: 'gro ba'am 'ongs ba la sogs pa'i spyod lam la dran pa nye bar @148a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'am 'ongs ba la sogs pa'i spyod lam la dran pa nye bar @148a * //
translated: The bodhisattva is always mindful in all activities, such as going and coming, and so on.

original: 'jog pa nyid dang / gtsang sbra'i kun du spyod pa dang ldan zhing nas nyung ba nyid kyis chos gso dang longs spyod smad du bye pa nyid ces bya bas ni drod du gyur pa'i ngas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'jog pa nyid dang / gtsang sbra'i kun du spyod pa dang ldan zhing nas nyung ba nyid kyis chos gso dang longs spyod smad du bye pa nyid ces bya bas ni drod du gyur pa'i ngas skabs yin no //
translated: He is endowed with pure conduct and is not contemptuous of the Dharma or of enjoyments. This is the stage of heat.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid yin pas lus la srin bu'i rigs stong rag brgyad cu med pa nyid dang / dag ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pas sems gyu dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas gong nas gong du lus dang sems yongs su dag pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid yin pas lus la srin bu'i rigs stong rag brgyad cu med pa nyid dang / dag ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pas sems gyu dang bral bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas gong nas gong du lus dang sems yongs su dag pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa dang /
translated: Since the roots of virtue are pure, the mind is free from distraction. Having transcended the stage of śrāvakas and so on, they become the cause for holding the body and mind to be pure, higher and higher.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa lhur len pa ma yin pas sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs te spyod pa dang / ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa lhur len pa ma yin pas sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs te spyod pa dang / ste /
translated: Since they are not intent on gain, honor, and so on, they take up and practice the twelve ascetic qualities.

original: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di yin te /
translated: The twelve ascetic qualities are as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid du gyur pa dang / phying pa pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyir mi len pa nyid dang / dgon pa pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid du gyur pa dang / phying pa pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyir mi len pa nyid dang / dgon pa pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang /
translated: They are the ascetic practices of wearing clothes made of rags, wearing felt clothes, living on alms, having only one sitting, not eating after the afternoon, living in the forest, living at the foot of a tree, living in the open,

original: dur khrod pa nyid dang / cog pu pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dur khrod pa nyid dang / cog pu pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid do //
translated: living in a charnel ground, sitting cross-legged, and living in whatever place one finds oneself.

original: ha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / blo brtan pa yin zhing zab pas gzhan la chos mnyan pa nyid dang sbyor ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: ha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / blo brtan pa yin zhing zab pas gzhan la chos mnyan pa nyid dang sbyor ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor yang dag par sgrub pa dang /
translated: They are the practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is the practice of not giving rise to a miserly or any other opposing attitude, the practice of listening to the teachings of others with a stable and profound mind, and the practice of applying oneself to the teachings.

original: yang bdud sdig can gyi sprul pa sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad du ltung zhing sdug bsngal drag pa dang / bar chad med pa myong bas dbang du byas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sar lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po tshad me pa bstan pas cher zin kyang 'khrug pa med par 'gro ba yongs su skyob cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: yang bdud sdig can gyi sprul pa sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad du ltung zhing sdug bsngal drag pa dang / bar chad med pa myong bas dbang du byas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sar lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po tshad me pa bstan pas cher zin kyang 'khrug pa med par 'gro ba yongs su skyob cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas who are prophesied to the irreversible stage are not agitated by the display of the eight great hells and the experience of intense and uninterrupted suffering that is brought about by the emanations of the evil Mara.

original: byang chub las sems mi ldag pa nyid kyis ni rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: byang chub las sems mi ldag pa nyid kyis ni rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: They protect the world and never turn back from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig can dag sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bdud sdig can dag sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs te 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, the evil Mara comes to the bodhisattvas in the guise of a brahman and says,🔽Even if you are taught a lesser path, you will not go by the influence of others, like a bhikshu arhat.

original: lam zhan ston du zin kyang dge slong dgra @148b bcom pa'i dpes gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lam zhan ston du zin kyang dge slong dgra @148b bcom pa'i dpes gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gang la dag pas 'gro ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la dag pas 'gro ba'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any dharma at all by means of which he could go to purification.

original: zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas /
translated: This is the argument.

original: gzhan yang bdud 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa rus par 'du shes pa la sogs pa lam gyi gzungs brnyan ston pa la 'di ni bdud yin no zhes khong du chud pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas ni bzod par gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no🔽// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: gzhan yang bdud 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa rus par 'du shes pa la sogs pa lam gyi gzungs brnyan ston pa la 'di ni bdud yin no zhes khong du chud pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bas ni bzod par gtogs pa'i gnas skabs yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen
translated: Moreover, in the situation of forbearance, he does not abandon any sentient being, because he has penetrated the thought that the māras who display the semblance of the path, such as the perception of bones in the world, are māras.

original: pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi bar las yongs su mi nyams pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
translated: In the situation of the supreme mundane quality, he is not separated from the attention of the perfection of wisdom, and he abides in accordance with the conduct that is well-spoken by the Tathāgata, and he has the thought that he will not regress from the perfection of generosity and so forth up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mdo'i don tshig lhug pas rgya cher gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni drug yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i don tshig lhug pas rgya cher gsungs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni drug yin te /
translated: The verses are:🔽The reversal of form and so on,🔽the exhaustion of doubt, the exhaustion of weariness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ldog pa dang // the tshom mi ngal zad pa dang / bdag nyid dag ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ldog pa dang // the tshom mi ngal zad pa dang / bdag nyid dag ba la gnas shing /
translated: abiding in one's own purity,🔽establishing others in that,🔽generosity and so on based on others,

original: gzhan dag de la 'god pa dang / gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la'ang som nyi med //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la 'god pa dang / gzhan gyi rten can sbyin sogs dang // zab mo'i don la'ang som nyi med //
translated: and being free from doubt regarding the profound meaning.🔽The five aspects of love,

original: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
analyzed: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
translated: the body and so on,🔽the non-association with the five obscurations,🔽the destruction of all latent tendencies,🔽mindfulness, alertness,🔽clean clothes and so on,

original: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
translated: and the absence of parasites on the body.

original: gyi gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: gyi gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
translated: The training of the mind without laziness,🔽the absence of grasping and miserliness,🔽the possession of the Dharma,🔽the search for hell for the sake of sentient beings,🔽the inability to be led astray by others,

original: len dang se sna med sos dang // chos nyed ldan pa 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la /
analyzed: len dang se sna med sos dang // chos nyed ldan pa 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la /
translated: and the teaching of other paths to Mara.

original: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: and the conduct pleasing to the buddhas.🔽These twenty signs

original: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
translated: are the signs of the irreversible.

original: drod dang rtse mo bzod bcas dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod bcas dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni //
translated: The one who abides in heat, peak, forbearance,🔽and the supreme mundane state does not turn away from complete awakening.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / nges par 'byed pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog / nges par 'byed pa'i chos dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The defining characteristics of the irreversible bodhisattva have been explained in terms of the stage that is conducive to the penetrations.

original: // / @149a * //  da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / @149a * //  da ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyi brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the stage of the path of seeing will be discussed.

original: de'ang gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de'ang gang gi phyir /
translated: And for that reason,🔽it is said:

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug no // byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
translated: On the path of seeing, there are sixteen moments of forbearance and knowledge.🔽They are the defining characteristics of the irreversible

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: bodhisattva.

original: bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las phyir ldog pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Because in that way the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva, by the emptiness of their own marks of all phenomena, enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: des chos de'ang mi dmigs te des na mngon par 'du mi byed cing des nas skye bar mi byed pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'du shes dang /
analyzed: des chos de'ang mi dmigs te des na mngon par 'du mi byed cing des nas skye bar mi byed pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba la bzod pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'du shes dang /
translated: And they do not apprehend that dharma. Therefore, they do not form volitions. Therefore, they do not give rise to anything. That is the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas for the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva.”

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what was said by the rationale of the definition of irreversibility, which is the turning away from discrimination and the turning away from forming volitions.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa yang /
translated: And the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering

original: bdud nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: bdud nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: The demon approaches and🔽turns one away from aspiration, beginning with “This knowledge of all aspects is like space, the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, empty of an intrinsic identity.

original: mos pa bzlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mos pa bzlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ”🔽Because the one who realizes, the realization, and the object of realization are not observed, one turns away from aspiration for the subsequent Dharma.

original: rtogs pa po dang rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba mi dmigs pas rjes kyi chos la 'dun pa zlog par byed pa khong du chu pa'i phyir sems brtan pa dang mi g-yo ba dang mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis yang dag par blangs pa'i sbyor bas ched du
analyzed: rtogs pa po dang rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba mi dmigs pas rjes kyi chos la 'dun pa zlog par byed pa khong du chu pa'i phyir sems brtan pa dang mi g-yo ba dang mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis yang dag par blangs pa'i sbyor bas ched du
translated: Because of a firm, unwavering, and unassailable mind, one does not fall away from the practice of taking up the training.

original: bya ba las mi nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba las mi nyams pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught by the meaning of “not falling away from the practice.”

original: de la sems brtan pan bi rgya mi 'chad pas so //
analyzed: de la sems brtan pan bi rgya mi 'chad pas so //
translated: There, the firm mind is because of not being interrupted.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mngon sum du byed pas so //
translated: The unwavering mind is because of manifesting.

original: mi 'phrogs pas ni gzhan rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pas ni gzhan rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The unassailable mind is because of not being the object of others.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dag dang rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las bzlog pa dang mi ldog pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa dang bzlog pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dag dang rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las bzlog pa dang mi ldog pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa dang bzlog pa gnyi ga la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa'
translated: Acceptance of the subsequent cognition of suffering is irreversible because it is the opposite of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha stages and it is not the opposite of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: brtan pas gang gsung pa @149b yin no //🔽de la bden pa la zhugs pa na ldog pa gang yin pa dang bden pa la ma zhugs pa na /
analyzed: brtan pas gang gsung pa @149b yin no // de la bden pa la zhugs pa na ldog pa gang yin pa dang bden pa la ma zhugs pa na /
translated: The steadfast bodhisattva is so called because he is not subject to regression.🔽Here, regression refers to the regression of one who has entered the truth and nonregression refers to the nonregression of one who has not entered the truth.

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'dir ldog pa'am mi ldog par sbyar gyi bzlog pa tsam ma 'jig pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'dir ldog pa'am mi ldog par sbyar gyi bzlog pa tsam ma 'jig pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not refer to mere regression or mere nonregression.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'bral pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar 'gyur ba dag srid de de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la ni rjes su shes pa dang 'bral pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung bar 'gyur ba dag srid de de ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the third moment, there is the possibility of falling to the sravaka stage, etc., because one is separated from subsequent knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal la rje su shes pa ni yang yan lhag zad pa dang ldan pa spong ba la ku tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rje su shes pa ni yang yan lhag zad pa dang ldan pa spong ba la ku tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas ;
translated: The knowledge of suffering is for the sake of eliminating the branches of meditative attainment.🔽The Sūtra says:🔽For the sake of eliminating the branches, bodhisattvas who delight in relinquishing the higher take on a body that is in accordance with sentient beings.🔽This is said from the perspective of bodhisattvas who delight in relinquishing the higher.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing de'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed pas yan lag zad par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya🔽bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing de'i 'bras bu thob par mi byed pas yan lag zad par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Eliminating the branches means that bodhisattvas who delight in relinquishing the higher enter the nine meditative attainments of the serial and nondiscriminating absorptions, the thirty seven factors of enlightenment and the three doors of liberation and they do not obtain the result of those meditative attainments.🔽For the sake of eliminating the branches, they take on a body that is in accordance with sentient beings.

original: yan lag zad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan nam snyoms par 'jug pa gang la yan lag gang dag yod pa de spong ba lhur len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yan lag zad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan nam snyoms par 'jug pa gang la yan lag gang dag yod pa de spong ba lhur len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Eliminating the branches means that bodhisattvas who delight in relinquishing the higher are intent on relinquishing whatever branches exist in whatever meditative attainment or absorption they possess.

original: dper na bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “The first concentration has five members.”

original: yan lag zad pa dang / ldan pa brjod pa ni rjes su shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: yan lag zad pa dang / ldan pa brjod pa ni rjes su shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: The statement of the members that are exhausted and possessed is for the purpose of understanding that subsequent knowledge is the antidote to form and the formless.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa nyid 'dor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rjes su shes pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa' 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa nyid 'dor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it apprehends things that are in accordance with itself, in the state of subsequent knowledge of suffering, the bodhisattva who has attained freedom from attachment abandons it.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: Acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma of origin

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po byang chub yid la byed pa dang / ldan te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po byang chub yid la byed pa dang / ldan te /
translated: Moreover, the great bodhisattva is endowed with the attention of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog par brtags pas bsal ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba nyid bskyed pas gzugs lhur len pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas /🔽sangs rgyas lta ba dang dge @150a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog par brtags pas bsal ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba nyid bskyed pas gzugs lhur len pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas / sangs rgyas lta ba dang dge @150a * //
translated: Not being separated from the Thought of Enlightenment is not being intent on form, etc., up to not being intent on seeing the Buddha and on producing the roots of virtue, as is extensively refuted.

original: ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lhur len pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher bkag pa nyid dang / de ci phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lhur len pa nyid kyi bar du rgya cher bkag pa nyid dang / de ci phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Because all his dharmas are equal to space, and are the non-entity nature, empty of own-character.

original: de ni 'di ltar de'i chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa dang / de ltar yid la byed pa na 'ang spyod lam thams cad du 'khrul pa me dpa'i sems kyis byed pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de'i chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam zhing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa dang / de ltar yid la byed pa na 'ang spyod lam thams cad du 'khrul pa me dpa'i sems kyis byed pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And when he thus attends, he does it with a mind free from error in all his deportments.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni khyim gyi nang na gnas kyang thabs mkhas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar ston pa dang / zas la sogs pa'i yo byad mang zhing sna tshogs ster bas bdag nyid sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni khyim gyi nang na gnas kyang thabs mkhas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar ston pa dang / zas la sogs pa'i yo byad mang zhing sna tshogs ster bas bdag nyid sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: Even though they live in a house, through skill in means they display the five sense objects and give away many and various necessities such as food and so on, abiding in the perfection of generosity.

original: gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dag par bskul ba dang / de'i bsngags pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They also exhort others to generosity and rejoice in it through praising it.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The subsequent perseverance for the truth of origin is taught by the statement:

original: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa dang / gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa mi bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa dang / gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa mi bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They always practice pure conduct and do not harm others in a way that would displease them.

original: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyi 'di'i 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi bskyed pas de bdud las 'di'i rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan bar ston pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsam te /
analyzed: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid kyi 'di'i 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi bskyed pas de bdud las 'di'i rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan bar ston pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsam te /
translated: He is always celibate, abandoning sexual desire and not harming others, so his mindstream is moistened by sustained calm, which is the cause of his being free from demons.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin par gtong ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i rigs pa rjes su 'brang bas de bdud la sogs pas mi brdzi ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang ba sbyin par gtong ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i rigs pa rjes su 'brang bas de bdud la sogs pas mi brdzi ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no /
translated: He gives gifts of the seven precious substances filling the trichiliocosm, beginning from Jambudvīpa, and he is not crushed by demons and so on by following the logic of Vajrapāṇi.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni sems mi g-yeng ba thob pa'i phyir dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ma tshang ba me pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems mi rjed pa la dbang thob pa'i don gyis skyes bu dam par gyur pa nyid dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni sems mi g-yeng ba thob pa'i phyir dang dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ma tshang ba me pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems mi rjed pa la dbang thob pa'i don gyis skyes bu dam par gyur pa nyid dang /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is the attainment of the power not to forget the mind of enlightenment, because he has attained undistracted mind and because he has attained the power of the unimpaired faculties of faith and so on.

original: bud med dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang / rigs pa dang / sman dang / rtsi la sogs pa dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa ze slong ba la sogs sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bud med dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang / rigs pa dang / sman dang / rtsi la sogs pa dang / bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa ze slong ba la sogs sbyor ba mi byed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi mthong ba dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas gnas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi mthong ba dang 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas gnas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because he does not see any phenomena as having characteristics, and because he abides with a completely pure livelihood.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la @150b yan lag tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni sman no //
analyzed: de la @150b yan lag tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni sman no //
translated: In this regard, medicine is the characteristic of a collection of parts.

original: yan lag gcig pa ni rtsi'o //
analyzed: yan lag gcig pa ni rtsi'o //
translated: A single part is a herb.

original: yang nad skyes pa rnams gso bar byed pa'i don gyis sman /
analyzed: yang nad skyes pa rnams gso bar byed pa'i don gyis sman /
translated: Or, medicine is for the purpose of curing illnesses that have arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma bskyed pa'i gnyen pa rtsi'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma bskyed pa'i gnyen pa rtsi'o //
translated: A herb is a remedy that prevents future illnesses from arising.

original: yang 'tsham pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs thob par byed pa ni sman no //
analyzed: yang 'tsham pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs thob par byed pa ni sman no //
translated: Medicine is for attaining a suitable physical condition.

original: mi 'tsham pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa ni rtsi'i zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: mi 'tsham pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa ni rtsi'i zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: A herb is for attaining an unsuitable condition. This is another classification.

original: 'og pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: 'og pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the lower realm is the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
translated: Subhuti, here when the bodhisattva mahasattva practices the perfection of wisdom, he is never separated from the attention of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsam te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsam te /
translated: Starting from here,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bar nges pa bkag pas nyan thos la sogs pa las bzlog par shes par byas ba'i don te /
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bar nges pa bkag pas nyan thos la sogs pa las bzlog par shes par byas ba'i don te /
translated: the meaning of the negation of the application and subsequent application to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is to be understood as the opposite of the sravakas and so forth.

original: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba smos pas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba sngon dang phyi mar shes par byed pa'i don dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba smos pas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba sngon dang phyi mar shes par byed pa'i don dang /
translated: The mention of application and subsequent application refers to the meaning of understanding the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path in order, as prior and subsequent application and subsequent application.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar song pa nyid la gnas pas des chos gang la yang dam pa dang mchog tu gyur par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes phyin ci log tu shes par byed pa'i 'thad pas ngag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar song pa nyid la gnas pas des chos gang la yang dam pa dang mchog tu gyur par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes phyin ci log tu shes par byed pa'i 'thad pas ngag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he abides in just that going, and he does not see any dharma as supreme or excellent.🔽The knowledge of the dharma of cessation is taught by the reason that “he does not see those as existing in the knowledge of cessation, because he is engaged in and connected with the discourse that is the cause of realization and the side of purification and the impediment to that.”

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu dang dag ba'i phyogs dang gi bar chad kyi gtam la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas gnas pa bkag pas 'gog pa'i shes pa la de rnams shin tu so sor nub pa nyid du ston pa'i don dang
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu dang dag ba'i phyogs dang gi bar chad kyi gtam la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas gnas pa bkag pas 'gog pa'i shes pa la de rnams shin tu so sor nub pa nyid du ston pa'i don dang
translated: The meaning is that he shows that they completely disappear in the knowledge of cessation.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'i chos rnams la chos gang yang khyer ba'am dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ba'i chos rnams la chos gang yang khyer ba'am dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is because he does not see any dharma that is taken up or put down in any dharma that is empty of its own mark.

original: gtam smos pa'i dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi shes pa'i dus nyid na bcom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtam smos pa'i dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi shes pa'i dus nyid na bcom pa'i phyir /
translated: The conceptual thought that is the basis for the expression of speech is destroyed at the time of the knowledge of suffering and origin.

original: 'gog pa'i shes pa ni gtam tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i shes pa ni gtam tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: The knowledge of cessation is to be understood as the antidote to conceptual thought through mere expression.

original: 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas 'di dag thams cad @151a * //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas nas 'di dag thams cad @151a * //
translated: From the perspective of this situation, all of these

original: ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming tsam ste /
translated: are mere names.

original: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas //🔽rjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: 'du shes tsam la rab tu gnas // rjod par byed las ma gtogs pa //
translated: They abide in mere discriminations.🔽Apart from the one who expresses,

original: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yod ma yin //
translated: the object of expression does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam rab tu mang po sna tshogs pa chos kyi dmag gi gtam la snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gtam rab tu mang po sna tshogs pa chos kyi dmag gi gtam la snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The forbearance that is subsequent knowledge of cessation is the accumulation of enlightenment, the extensive various discourses on generosity and so on, the discourse of the army of Dharma, as before.

original: 'gog pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs su yang dag par 'grub pa mang po la nye bar mkho ba'i don ston par byed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs su yang dag par 'grub pa mang po la nye bar mkho ba'i don ston par byed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung du 'am mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung du 'am mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because, in this way, one who abides in emptiness does not see any dharma as either diminished or increased.🔽The subsequent knowledge of cessation is the antidote, and the side of non-seeing is the one to be harmed and the one who harms, like a story of a battle.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gnyen po dang mi mthong ba'i phyogs dag ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa g-yul gyi gtam la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni gnyen po dang mi mthong ba'i phyogs dag ni gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa g-yul gyi gtam la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: lam gyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang rjes su chags pa'am khong khro bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang rjes su chags pa'am khong khro bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because, in this way, one who abides in the suchness of the path does not see any dharma as either attachment or aversion.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni rang gi dang kho nas rnam par smin pa 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni rang gi dang kho nas rnam par smin pa 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The occasion of such a bodhisattva is the fourfold cessation of karmic maturation.🔽The cessation of the city of the sense faculties is the cessation of the city of the sense faculties, which is the remainder of karmic maturation.

original: dbang po'i grong 'gog pa ni de phan chad ni rnam par smin pa tsam gyi lhag mar gyur pa dbang po'i grong gi gtam la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i grong 'gog pa ni de phan chad ni rnam par smin pa tsam gyi lhag mar gyur pa dbang po'i grong gi gtam la snga ma bzhin dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang chogs sam tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang chogs sam tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because one sees that all phenomena are empty, one does not see any phenomenon as a collection or non-collection.🔽The cessation of the city of the great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties is the cessation of the city of the great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i grong khyer 'gog pa ni de nas dbang po'i rten du gyur pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la snga ma bzhin pa dang ; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i rten 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i grong khyer 'gog pa ni de nas dbang po'i rten du gyur pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la snga ma bzhin pa dang ; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang bsdu ba'am mi bsdu bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la yang bsdu ba'am mi bsdu bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the fact that, abiding in the emptiness of space, one does not see any phenomenon as included or not included.

original: dbang po'i yul grong rdal 'gog pa ni de nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi grong rdal gyi @151b gtam gyi sbyor ba la snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul grong rdal 'gog pa ni de nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi grong rdal gyi @151b gtam gyi sbyor ba la snga ma bzhin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The cessation of the city of the objects of the senses is as follows: Then, as before, one engages in the discourse of the city of the objects of the senses such as form, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas chos gang la gnas pas chos gang la yang 'phel ba'am 'bri bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas chos gang la gnas pas chos gang la yang 'phel ba'am 'bri bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the fact that, abiding in the limit of reality, one does not see any phenomenon as increasing or decreasing.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni de nas rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings bsgoms pas de'i bdag nyid can du gnas yongs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gtam la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa 'gog pa ni de nas rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings bsgoms pas de'i bdag nyid can du gnas yongs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gtam la sogs pa la snga ma bzhin pa dang /
translated: The cessation of the manifest clinging to a self is as follows: Then, by meditating on the completely pure sphere of reality in all aspects, one abides in the transformation of one’s being that is of the nature of that sphere of reality. As before, one engages in the discourse of the self and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bar gnas pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bar gnas pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the attention associated with the knowledge of all aspects is the basis for the application and subsequent application of the discourse on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par smin pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di 'ang khams gsum la so sor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di 'ang khams gsum la so sor shes par bya'o //
translated: And these four types of karmic maturation should be understood separately for the three realms.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig dbang po 'gog pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gang la dbang po gang zhig yod pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po 'gog pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa gang la dbang po gang zhig yod pa ste /
translated: First, the cessation of the faculties is in the dhyanas and formless [absorptions], where any faculty exists.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: In the dhyanas of birth🔽There is the feeling of mental satisfaction, equanimity,🔽Equanimity, mental satisfaction, pleasure,

original: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
translated: And equanimity, equanimity.🔽In the formless [absorptions] there is equanimity,

original: gzugs med rnam la btang snyoms dang // srog dang yid kyi dbang po yin //
analyzed: gzugs med rnam la btang snyoms dang // srog dang yid kyi dbang po yin //
translated: The faculties of life, mind,

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said.

original: ji ltar na de'i dbang po'i rten 'gog pa yin zhe na /🔽der ni ris dang srog la yang //
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i dbang po'i rten 'gog pa yin zhe na / der ni ris dang srog la yang //
translated: How is the basis of the faculties stopped?🔽There, the continuum of mind

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rten pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rten pa yin //
translated: is the basis of the class and life force.

original: zhes bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained.

original: dbang po'i yul grong rdal 'gog pa yang /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul grong rdal 'gog pa yang /
translated: The stopping of the town, which is the object of the faculties,🔽is also explained.

original: de la yid kyi yul ni chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: de la yid kyi yul ni chos rnams yin no //
translated: The object of mind is phenomena.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni thams cad na yod pa nyid yin pas de 'gog pa yang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ni thams cad na yod pa nyid yin pas de 'gog pa yang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Since clinging to a self exists everywhere, stopping that is also tenable.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing ser sna la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas gnas pa bkag pa'i don dang / bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam yin pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rgyu nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas shing chos 'dod pa nyid kyis dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i rjes su 'jug
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing ser sna la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor bas gnas pa bkag pa'i don dang / bzod pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam yin pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i rgyu nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas shing chos 'dod pa nyid kyis dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i rjes su 'jug
translated: The meaning of perseverance is that one should understand that it is the cause of freedom from affliction since it is the uninterrupted path.

original: par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos kyi dbyings la @152a * //
analyzed: par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos kyi dbyings la @152a * //
translated: The meaning of one should understand that one engages in the emptiness of all phenomena and engages in aspiration for virtue since one desires Dharma.

original: spyod cing chos thams cad mi dad par brjod pa nyid kyis sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i chos dag la 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du dor ba dang blang bar shes par bya ba'i don dang /
analyzed: spyod cing chos thams cad mi dad par brjod pa nyid kyis sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i chos dag la 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir go rims bzhin du dor ba dang blang bar shes par bya ba'i don dang /
translated: The meaning of one should understand that one engages in the dharmadhatu and since one does not abandon any phenomenon, one should understand that one engages in the phenomena of practice and result since they are neither compounded nor uncompounded.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i thad du bshes gnyen du 'dod pa nyid kyis shin tu khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i rgyu shes par byed pa'i don dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang🔽dag par bskul ba dang / 'dzud pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang / rtogs pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i tshogs 'dod na sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa skye zhing skye ba la dbang ba shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i thad du bshes gnyen du 'dod pa nyid kyis shin tu khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i rgyu shes par byed pa'i don dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba dang / 'dzud pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa dang / rtogs pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i tshogs 'dod na sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa skye zhing skye ba la dbang ba shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of the teaching is to make known the cause for attaining the state of a spiritual friend in relation to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and to make known the cause for attaining the state of a spiritual friend in relation to the disciples and so forth, in order to encourage, introduce, establish, and cause the attainment of the distinctive realization of the disciples and so forth in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽🔽The purpose of the teaching is to make known the cause for the arising of the Buddhas in every birth, and to make known the cause for the power over birth.

original: lam la chos shes pa ni /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni /
translated: The purpose of the Buddha's teaching is to cause one to understand the cause for attaining the very special state of being a spiritual friend in relation to the buddhas and bodhisattvas, to cause one to understand the cause for attaining the very special state of being a spiritual friend in relation to the buddhas and bodhisattvas, to cause one to understand the cause for attaining
