and bodhisattvas, to cause one to understand the cause

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i dpes chos phra rab tsam yang rjes su ma dmigs pas nang stong pa nyid nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i bar la gnas pa ni rang gi sa la dogs pa med pa nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir shes pa bral ba thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa dang ;
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i dpes chos phra rab tsam yang rjes su ma dmigs pas nang stong pa nyid nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa'i bar la gnas pa ni rang gi sa la dogs pa med pa nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir shes pa bral ba thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa dang ;
translated: Abiding on the irreversible level is the cause for attaining the knowledge of omniscience because it is the cause for attaining the knowledge of omniscience.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / bdud kyi las shes pa dang / rnam par 'joms pa dang / srab mor byed pas bral ba thob pa'i byed pa'i don dang / mtshams med pa'i las byed pa'i skyes bu'i dpes yang dag pa la gnas shing rnam par mi rtog pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir ldog par mi nus pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / bdud kyi las shes pa dang / rnam par 'joms pa dang / srab mor byed pas bral ba thob pa'i byed pa'i don dang / mtshams med pa'i las byed pa'i skyes bu'i dpes yang dag pa la gnas shing rnam par mi rtog pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sems ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir ldog par mi nus pa nyid dang /
translated: The meaning of the example is that the irreversible mind of the nonconceptual bodhisattvas who abide in reality cannot be turned back by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, just as a person who has committed the heinous crime of killing his mother cannot be turned back from the experience of the result of that action.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te skyon med par zhugs pa nyid kyis lam la chos shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin par byed pa'i don dang / mngon par shes pa rnams thob nas sangs rgyas rnams la lta ba la sogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing khyad par can gyi yon tan rnams mngon par sgrub pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te skyon med par zhugs pa nyid kyis lam la chos shes pa ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin par byed pa'i don dang / mngon par shes pa rnams thob nas sangs rgyas rnams la lta ba la sogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing khyad par can gyi yon tan rnams mngon par sgrub pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don
translated: It is the knowledge that, having attained the superknowledges, one goes from buddha realm to buddha realm in order to see the buddhas and so on and that one accomplishes the special qualities without interruption.🔽It is the knowledge that, through skill in means, one applies the activities of Mara to the limit of reality and that one is without doubt on one's own level.

original: dang / bdud kyi las rnams thabs la mkhas @152b pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed pas rang gi sa la nem nur med pa nyid dang / sbyor ba 'dren ma ma yin zhing rnam par dag pa shes pa'i phyir mi ldog par shes par byed pa'i don dang /
analyzed: dang / bdud kyi las rnams thabs la mkhas @152b pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed pas rang gi sa la nem nur med pa nyid dang / sbyor ba 'dren ma ma yin zhing rnam par dag pa shes pa'i phyir mi ldog par shes par byed pa'i don dang /
translated: It is the knowledge that, because one is not a mixture of applications and one knows purity, one is irreversible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med par yang dag pa'i mtha' la gcig gam gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas skye ba rjes su zin kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skye ba'i sbyor ba theg pa gzhan du
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med par yang dag pa'i mtha' la gcig gam gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas skye ba rjes su zin kyang nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skye ba'i sbyor ba theg pa gzhan du
translated: Even though one is born in the formless realm, the mind of a sravaka and so on does not arise, since one is not liberated in other vehicles.🔽One should understand that this is the meaning of the single definite emergence.

original: nges par 'byung ba med pas gcig tu nges pa nyid shes par byed pa'i don dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba med pas gcig tu nges pa nyid shes par byed pa'i don dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, one does not see them as arising or ceasing and so on.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir skye ba'am 'gag pa la sogs pa rjes su mi mthong bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las bzlog par shes pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir skye ba'am 'gag pa la sogs pa rjes su mi mthong bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las bzlog par shes pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning that should be understood to reverse the levels of sravakas and so on.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: Acceptance of subsequent knowledge of the path

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i nges pa'i rnyed pas mngon par byang mi chub pa dang ma bral bar shes par byed pa'i don dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa'i nges pa'i rnyed pas mngon par byang mi chub pa dang ma bral bar shes par byed pa'i don dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The meaning of the knowledge that one is not separated from the enlightenment that is not fully known is the certainty of thought: “I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.”🔽Why is that?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because unsurpassed, complete enlightenment is empty of its own mark.

original: de ltar gnas pa ni sa de la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni sa de la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par gnas yin no //
translated: One who is thus situated is situated without relying on another on that stage.

original: rang gi sa la brdzi ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba dang ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa la brdzi ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba dang ste /
translated: One is not overcome on one’s own stage.

original: rang gi sa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa gsum ni rang gi sa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa gsum ni rang gi sa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One’s own stage should be understood as the three knowledges of all aspects, etc., in order.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: One who is thus situated has the knowledge that is not overcome.

original: yang bral ba dang bral ba thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid sa gsum du bstan to zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang bral ba dang bral ba thob pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid sa gsum du bstan to zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yin no //
translated: Another enumeration is: the three stages are taught as the attainment of separation from separation, and the unshared knowledge of all aspects.

original: khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig / khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig / khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
translated: You should attain arhatship right here. You have not been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽You have not attained the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise, by which you would be predicted.

original: gang gis khyod lung bstan par 'gyur ba mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yang khyod kyis ma thob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud kyi 'dun pa ba zlog pa'i tshig thos pas na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong ba la
analyzed: gang gis khyod lung bstan par 'gyur ba mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yang khyod kyis ma thob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud kyi 'dun pa ba zlog pa'i tshig thos pas na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi zhum mi 'gong ba la
translated: Hearing these words of Mara, the Great Being's mind does not become discouraged, does not become cowed, and so on.

original: @153a * // sogs pa ni lung bstan par nges pa zhes bya ba dang ste /
analyzed: @153a * // sogs pa ni lung bstan par nges pa zhes bya ba dang ste /
translated: This is called certainty of prediction.

original: 'di la gnas pa ni rtog pa'i chos kyi skad cig ma gcig lus pa yin pa'i phyir ltung ba'am khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni rtog pa'i chos kyi skad cig ma gcig lus pa yin pa'i phyir ltung ba'am khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one who is in this state is one step away from the Dharma of investigation, he will either fall or progress.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos de la yod pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos de la yod pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because the Buddha has declared that the Dharma of those who have entered the stage of nonregression is the cause of prediction.

original: skyon med par zhugs pa ni lung bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med par zhugs pa ni lung bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma of those who have entered the stage of nonregression is the cause of prediction.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni yang bdud kyis khyod la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni yang bdud kyis khyod la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: When one is in the path of subsequent understanding, Mara says to him, What is the use of your unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin no zhes zer zhing rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin no zhes zer zhing rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: These sutras that you are practicing are the teachings of Mara.

original: kye ma 'di ni bdud yin no snyam du rtogs pas mngon par byang chub pa dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa thob pa shes par byed pa'i don dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni bdud yin no snyam du rtogs pas mngon par byang chub pa dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa thob pa shes par byed pa'i don dang chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir
translated: The meaning of “I will give up my life” is that one should understand that one will attain the discovery of manifest enlightenment by realizing that this is Mara.

original: bdag dang srog kyang yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba dang ste /🔽gnyi ga smos pa ni phyogs gcig dang ma lus pa'i bdag yongs su gtong ba shes par bya ba'i don du'o //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad dang bdag gis 'di nyid yin no zhes don gyis dbang 'di mthong nas bral ba thob pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gtong ba'i skal ba mnyam par shes par byed pa'i don dang / yang gzhung 'dzin pa'i gzung thob pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag dang srog kyang yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba dang ste /🔽gnyi ga smos pa ni phyogs gcig dang ma lus pa'i bdag yongs su gtong ba shes par bya ba'i don du'o //🔽sangs rgyas thams cad dang bdag gis 'di nyid yin no zhes don gyis dbang 'di mthong nas bral ba thob pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gtong ba'i skal ba mnyam par shes par byed pa'i don dang / yang gzhung 'dzin pa'i gzung thob pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The meaning of “I will give up my life” is that one should understand that

original: chud mi gzon pas de'i khyad par gyis yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shes par byed pa'i don dang / yang gzungs thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nyan thos dang lha la sogs pa'i skad dang brda la sogs pa la nges pa rnyed pa nyid kyis de'i sems can thams cad smin pa'i thabs kyis byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chud mi gzon pas de'i khyad par gyis yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shes par byed pa'i don dang / yang gzungs thob pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nyan thos dang lha la sogs pa'i skad dang brda la sogs pa la nges pa rnyed pa nyid kyis de'i sems can thams cad smin pa'i thabs kyis byed pa nyid dang /
translated: Because they do not waste their lives, they are distinguished by their special qualities, which are to be understood as the means of accomplishing the qualities.

original: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They have great qualities.🔽They have immeasurable qualities.

original: yon tan gzhal du ma mchis pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gzhal du ma mchis pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They have inconceivable qualities.

original: yon tan dpag tu ma mchis pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum po go rims bzhin du bzod pa dang shes pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te shes par bya ba rnams dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu ma mchis pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum po go rims bzhin du bzod pa dang shes pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te shes par bya ba rnams dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: These three phrases should be understood respectively in terms of the acceptances and the knowings, in terms of the knower of all aspects, and in terms of the knower of paths.

original: de ni 'di ltar des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin @153b pa'i ye shes mtha' yas mu med pas rab tu thob pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin @153b pa'i ye shes mtha' yas mu med pas rab tu thob pa'i phyir zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is because he has attained the infinite, limitless intuition that is not shared by the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de la mtha' yas pa ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la mtha' yas pa ni rnam pa mtha' yas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therein, infinite is due to the infinite aspects.

original: mu med pa ni thams cad du yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mu med pa ni thams cad du yul ma yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Limitless is due to the absence of any object whatsoever.

original: mdo'i don rgyas pa 'di'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni lnga yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i don rgyas pa 'di'i tshig le'ur byas pa ni lnga yin te /
translated: The verse summary of this extensive meaning is five verses:

original: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brten theg pa dman dag las //
analyzed: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brten theg pa dman dag las //
translated: The reversal of the notion of form, etc., the support of mind, the reversal from the individual vehicle,

original: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
translated: The reversal from the meditative concentrations, etc.,

original: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The exhaustion of the branches, the lightness of body and mind,

original: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // tshor ba rnam par dag nyid dang // phung sogs bar chad byed rnams dang // tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // tshor ba rnam par dag nyid dang // phung sogs bar chad byed rnams dang // tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa yin /
translated: the accumulations, the powers, and so forth.

original: g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs la //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs la //
translated: In battle, stinginess, and so on,

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
translated: the application and subsequent application🔽of the individual rejections,

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: and the mere non-observation of phenomena.

original: rang gi sa la nges pa ni ;
analyzed: rang gi sa la nges pa ni ;
translated: The certainty in one's own stage,🔽abiding in the three stages,

original: / sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
analyzed: / sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
translated: and giving one's life for the sake of the Dharma.

original: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: Such are the sixteen moments

original: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
analyzed: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
translated: of the wise abiding in the path of seeing.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //
translated: These are the signs of irreversibility.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rtags kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rtags kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics of the signs of the irreversible Saṅgha of bodhisattvas abiding on the path of seeing have been explained.

original: // / da ni sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rtags brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i rtags brjod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Now, the signs of one who is on the path of cultivation are to be stated. Therefore,

original: sgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
translated: The path of cultivation is profound.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, “Blessed One, please teach the profound, the very profound.”

original: bzlas te brjod pa ni sgom pa yang nas yang du goms par byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: bzlas te brjod pa ni sgom pa yang nas yang du goms par byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: The repetition is for the purpose of repeatedly cultivating the path of cultivation.

original: gnas zhes bya ba gnas par brjod pas ni de rgyun dang ldan par bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba gnas par brjod pas ni de rgyun dang ldan par bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The statement “abode” is for the purpose of teaching that it is continuous.

original: gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' chen pos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas ;
analyzed: gang la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' chen pos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas ;
translated: In dependence on what abode do the bodhisattvas complete the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de rtogs pa ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de rtogs pa ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par byed pa'i don to //
translated: up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha? This is for the purpose of understanding that it is the cause for the completion of all realizations.

original: yang 'di'i zab pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di'i zab pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is its profundity?

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //🔽zhes gsungs @154a * //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs // zhes gsungs @154a * //
translated: The profound is emptiness and so on.

original: te ; di ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: te ; di ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: This is the statement that emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-production, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, non-performance, non-undertaking, non-thought, and so on,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams ni zab mo'i gnas nyid yin par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rnams ni zab mo'i gnas nyid yin par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as well as suchness, the limit of reality, and the ultimate, are the profound topics.

original: ci'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs ba zab mo yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs ba zab mo yin zhe na /
translated: Why are emptiness and so on profound?

original: zab mo de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
analyzed: zab mo de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //
translated: That profundity is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: This is stated.

original: de la sgro btags pa'i mtha' las grol ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa'i mtha' las grol ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Among them, freedom from the extreme of superimposition is as follows:

original: gzugs las kyang bzlog ces bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la ni gzugs med pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs las kyang bzlog ces bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid la ni gzugs med pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, Even from form, it is reversed, and in suchness, there is no form.

original: de la skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Among them, freedom from the extreme of denial is as follows:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba dang / gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med do zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba dang / gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med do zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and “nirvana is also taught” and “there is no suchness apart from form.”

original: de ltar chos thams cad las bzlog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ston pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas zab mo nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad las bzlog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ston pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas zab mo nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by teaching the reversal of all phenomena and nirvana, he teaches the profound reality of form and so on.

original: yang sgom pa'i lam gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang sgom pa'i lam gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the path of meditation?

original: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //🔽lam dang sgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i // lam dang sgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: The factors of ascertainment,🔽the path of seeing, and the path of meditation🔽are the path of meditation

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtogs sgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtogs sgom pa'i lam //
translated: because they repeatedly contemplate,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: measure, and ascertain.

original: gang gi tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i gnas zab mo 'di dag la nye bar mkho ba bzlog pa'i don du bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i gnas zab mo 'di dag la nye bar mkho ba bzlog pa'i don du bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When one repeatedly contemplates, measures, and ascertains the profound reality of form and so on, which is taught by the perfection of wisdom, it is the path of meditation.🔽The path of meditation is the path of meditation because it repeatedly contemplates, measures, and ascertains the profound reality of form and so on, which is taught by the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems par byed cing bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so //🔽'jal bar byed ces bya ba ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: sems par byed cing bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so // 'jal bar byed ces bya ba ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so //
translated: One reflects by means of the wisdom that consists in learning.🔽One measures by means of the wisdom that consists in deliberation.

original: nges par rtog par byed ces bya ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so //🔽yang sgom pa'i lam yul gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: nges par rtog par byed ces bya ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis so // yang sgom pa'i lam yul gang la yin zhe na /
translated: One determines by means of the wisdom that consists in meditative development.

original: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //🔽lam dang sgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i // lam dang sgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: Again, what is the object of the path of meditative development?🔽The limbs of insight, the path of insight

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽bdag gis 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag gi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las @154b ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / bdag gis 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag gi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las @154b ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du'o //
translated: and the path of meditative development itself.🔽It is said: I should stand in this way - this is in regard to the limbs of insight, as has been stated in the Prajñāpāramitā.

original: bdag gis 'di ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad brjod pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad brjod pa bzhin du'o //
translated: It is said: I should train in this way - this is in regard to the path of insight, as has been stated in the Prajñāpāramitā.

original: bdag gis 'di ltar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad du brjod pa bzhin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag bzhi dang mthong ba'i lam dang sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas de bzhin du sgrub pa dang / de bzhin du nges par rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du nye bar rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di ltar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad du brjod pa bzhin no // de nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag bzhi dang mthong ba'i lam dang sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas de bzhin du sgrub pa dang / de bzhin du nges par rtogs pa dang / de bzhin du nye bar rtogs pa dang /
translated: The passage, I will practice in this way, is stated in the Perfection of Wisdom in terms of the path of meditation.🔽Therefore, the six terms practice, realization, apprehension,

original: de bzhin du rtsol ba dang / de bzhin du sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du 'bad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig drug gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsol ba dang / de bzhin du sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du 'bad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig drug gsungs pa yin no //
translated: exertion, application, and endeavor are stated in terms of the four aids to penetration, the path of seeing, and the path of meditation.

original: sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa de nyid ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa de nyid ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
translated: How is that one abiding in the path of meditation an object?

original: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir phyi ma phyi ma'i yul snga ma'i yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir phyi ma phyi ma'i yul snga ma'i yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Because it is a continuum, there is no fault in saying that the latter is the object of the former.

original: sgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon rnam pa gsum ni tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa las ni gzhan gyi bud med dang btus pa'i brdar byas pa'i skyes bu'i rtog pa mang po'i dpes bsod nams tshad med pa skye bas bskal pa dpag tu
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon rnam pa gsum ni tshad med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin pa las ni gzhan gyi bud med dang btus pa'i brdar byas pa'i skyes bu'i rtog pa mang po'i dpes bsod nams tshad med pa skye bas bskal pa dpag tu
translated: The benefit of abandoning samsara for immeasurable eons through generating immeasurable merit by means of the example of the many thoughts of a man who has intercourse with another's wife.

original: med par 'khor ba spong ba dang / rgyab kyis bltas pa dang / mthar byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas zad pa dang rnam par gnon pa dang sngar ma skyes pa mi bskyed par brjod pa rnams kyis sgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par 'khor ba spong ba dang / rgyab kyis bltas pa dang / mthar byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas zad pa dang rnam par gnon pa dang sngar ma skyes pa mi bskyed par brjod pa rnams kyis sgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The benefit of eliminating, suppressing and not generating previously unarisen afflictions through the terms exhaustion, suppression and nonarising.

original: de rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /🔽de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na / de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
translated: How many types are there?🔽It is said to have nine types

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //🔽chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi //🔽rnam pas rnam pa dgur 'dod do //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams // chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi // rnam pas rnam pa dgur 'dod do //
translated: through the divisions of small-small and so on.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to have nine types through the divisions of small-small and so on.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The terms “non-conducive” and “conducive” should be applied to the above.

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po gsum ni rtsa ba'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po gsum ni rtsa ba'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: The three types of afflictions—small, medium, and great—are the basic types.

original: yang de rnams re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bar byas na rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de rnams re re zhing chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bar byas na rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: When each of these is divided into small, medium, and great, there are nine types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chung ngu'i chung du dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung du dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung du dang / chen po'i @155a * //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung du dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung du dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung du dang / chen po'i @155a * //
translated: small-small, small-medium, small-great, medium-small, medium-medium, medium-great, great-small,

original: 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: great-medium, and great-great.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The non-conducive side should be understood in the same way as the conducive side.

original: de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spong ba nas /
analyzed: de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chen po spong ba nas /
translated: Here, the small-small path eliminates the great-great conception,🔽and so on.

original: chen po'i chen pos chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i bar du yin te /
analyzed: chen po'i chen pos chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i bar du yin te /
translated: The great of the great abandons the small of the small.

original: thog ma kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'am /
translated: The path of great separation does not exist at the beginning,

original: lam chen po ma kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: lam chen po ma kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'am /
translated: nor does the path of great separation exist at the end,

original: lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po yod mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po yod mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: because when the path of great separation arises, it is impossible for there to be great afflictions.

original: gos kyi dri ma chen po dang por bsal nas phyis ni phra mo dag par byed pa dang / mun pa chen po ni snang ba chung dus sel la chung du ni chen pos sel ba zhes bya ba'i dpes 'di 'dir 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi dri ma chen po dang por bsal nas phyis ni phra mo dag par byed pa dang / mun pa chen po ni snang ba chung dus sel la chung du ni chen pos sel ba zhes bya ba'i dpes 'di 'dir 'byor pa yin no //
translated: This is similar to the example of removing great stains on clothing first and then removing subtle stains, and the example of great darkness being removed by small light and small darkness being removed by great light.

original: dkar po'i chos ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la nag po ni nyam chung ba yin pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma chung dus kyang 'khor ba med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brtan pa'i nyon mongs pa chen bo rtsa ba nas 'byin pa🔽yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la nag po ni nyam chung ba yin pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma chung dus kyang 'khor ba med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brtan pa'i nyon mongs pa chen bo rtsa ba nas 'byin pa🔽yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since virtuous phenomena are powerful and nonvirtuous phenomena are weak, even the small moment of the arya path removes the great root of the afflictions that are passed down from one life to another in samsara.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang dus mang por bsags pa'i nad rnams dur byid kyis khrus byas pa dang 'dra bar sel ba dang skad cig ma'i sgron ma chung dus mun pa chen po 'joms pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang dus mang por bsags pa'i nad rnams dur byid kyis khrus byas pa dang 'dra bar sel ba dang skad cig ma'i sgron ma chung dus mun pa chen po 'joms pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The master Vasubandhu also explains that it is like the elimination of many illnesses accumulated over a long time by a purgative, and like the destruction of great darkness by a small lamp.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po ni /
translated: The great of the great aspects of conceptuality

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas bskal pa gang'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dkon mchog gsum la zang zing gi sbyin pa byin pa bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas bskal pa gang'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dkon mchog gsum la zang zing gi sbyin pa byin pa bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the giving of material things to the Three Jewels for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, without the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di spong bas lam gyi rnam pa chung du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam gyi rnam pa chung du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la sogs pa la brtson par byed pa de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The small aspect of the path is the abandonment of that, and the one who strives in listening to the perfection of wisdom and so on increases merit much more.🔽Why is that?

original: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni 'di yin bas zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lam ni 'di yin bas zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The same as the above refers to being without the perfection of wisdom.🔽The same should be applied to the following.

original: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring ni de nyid kyis bskal pa de nyid du rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i 'bring ni de nyid kyis bskal pa de nyid du rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
translated: The medium of the small is the same as the above, but in that very eon, they become stream-enterers,🔽and so forth, up to “by offering material gifts to the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.”🔽The same as the above refers to being without the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar rnams la zang zing gi yon phul ba bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar rnams la zang zing gi yon phul ba bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The same should be applied to the following.🔽The small of the small is the same as the above, but in that very eon, they become stream-enterers,🔽and so forth, up to “by offering material gifts to the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.”

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi @155b pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi @155b pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bas te /
translated: The same as the above refers to being without the perfection of wisdom.🔽The same should be applied to the following.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The small of the small is the same as the above, but in that very eon, they become stream-enterers,🔽and so forth, up to “by offering material gifts to the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.”🔽The same as the above refers to being without the perfection of wisdom.🔽The same should be applied to the following.

original: 'di spong bas lam chung ngu'i 'bring ni /
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam chung ngu'i 'bring ni /
translated: The small of the small is the same as the above, but in that very eon, they become stream-enterers,🔽and so forth, up to “by offering material gifts to the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.”🔽The same as the above refers to being without the perfection of wisdom.🔽The same should be applied to the following.🔽The small of the small is the same as the above, but in that very eon, they become stream-enterers,🔽and so forth, up to “by offering material gifts to the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.”🔽The same as

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed na de chos bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed na de chos bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'das nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'thad bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because one surpasses the levels of the śrāvakas and so forth and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung du ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du gnas shing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chen po'i chung du ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du gnas shing sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The small of the great discriminations is one who abides for that many eons and cultivates generosity, ethics, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.🔽The great of the small path of abandonment is the other who, in one day, possesses generosity and so forth and increases merit greatly.

original: 'di spong bas lam chung ngu'i chen po ni cig shos nyin gcig cig sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam chung ngu'i chen po ni cig shos nyin gcig cig sbyin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gnas na chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the perfection of wisdom that causes the perfection of all dharmas when one abides in it, the perfection of wisdom is generated by the bodhisattvas.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The other is one who is endowed with striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chen po ni /
translated: The medium of the great discriminations is🔽as stated:

original: yang de nyid bskal pa de nyid du sems can rnams las chos sbyin pa bas zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de nyid bskal pa de nyid du sems can rnams las chos sbyin pa bas zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Moreover, in just that eon, through the gift of Dharma to sentient beings…”🔽The small of the medium path is the other who increases much more merit in one day through the gift of Dharma.

original: 'di spong bas lam 'bring gi chung du ni cig shos kyi nyin gcig gis chos kyi sbyin pa de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam 'bring gi chung du ni cig shos kyi nyin gcig gis chos kyi sbyin pa de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba dang bral ba dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba dang bral ba nyid kyi 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba dang bral ba dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba dang bral ba nyid kyi 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are not separated from the perfection of wisdom and those who are separated from it are not separated from and are separated from the knowledge of all aspects, respectively.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du bsam gtan bzhi dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du bsam gtan bzhi dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams nas /
translated: The medium conception is that very one who, for that many eons, exerts himself in the four concentrations, the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la brtson par byas pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no /🔽par byed na de ches bsod nams mang du 'phel shos de rnams la nyin zhag @156a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la brtson par byas pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no / par byed na de ches bsod nams mang du 'phel shos de rnams la nyin zhag @156a * //
translated: and so on up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽If one were to make an effort for one day and night in those, the merit would increase much more.

original: gcig mngon par brtson par byas na de bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gcig mngon par brtson par byas na de bsod nams mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba dang bral ba dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa dang / ldog pa'i gnas med pa dang yod pa nyid kyis mtha' gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba dang bral ba dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog pa dang / ldog pa'i gnas med pa dang yod pa nyid kyis mtha' gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are not separated from the perfection of wisdom and those who are separated from it are irreversible from the knowledge of all aspects and are not irreversible from the knowledge of all aspects, respectively.🔽The medium of medium discriminations is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The great of medium is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The small of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung du ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du zang zing gi sbyin pa dang nang yang dag 'jog pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub🔽tu yongs su bsdos pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'bring gi chung du ni yang de nyid bskal pa de snyed du zang zing gi sbyin pa dang nang yang dag 'jog pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdos pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The medium of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The great of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The small of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The medium of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The great of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The small of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The medium of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The great of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The small of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: 'di spong bas lam 'bring gi chen po ni cig shes nyi ma gcig zang zing sbyin ba de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam 'bring gi chen po ni cig shes nyi ma gcig zang zing sbyin ba de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The medium of great is when those who have the mental activity of giving material things and being in meditative equipoise for that many eons dedicate that to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.🔽The great of

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni dam pa nyid du brjod pas gang gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i yongs su bsngo ba ni dam pa nyid du brjod pas gang gsungs pa yin no /
translated: The dedication of the perfection of wisdom is said to be the best.🔽The small of the great is the dedication of the Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma, which states:🔽Whatever roots of virtue there are of the past, future, and present Bhagavat Buddhas together with the saṅgha of hearers, I rejoice in all of them.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po ni yang de nyid bkal pa de snyed du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chen po ni yang de nyid bkal pa de snyed du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su
translated: If I dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bsngos pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsngos pa bas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the small of the medium is the dedication of the Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma, which states:🔽If I rejoice in the roots of virtue of the past, future, and present Bhagavat Buddhas together with the saṅgha of hearers for one day,

original: 'di spong bas lam chen po'i chung du ni cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig dge ba'i rtsa ba la rje dus yi rang ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam chen po'i chung du ni cig shos kyis nyi ma gcig dge ba'i rtsa ba la rje dus yi rang ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang
translated: and if I dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsngo ba ni dam nyid yin pa'i 'thad sad pas gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsngo ba ni dam nyid yin pa'i 'thad sad pas gsungs pa yin no /
translated: It is because the dedication of rejoicing in the perfection of wisdom is the highest.

original: rnal par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring ni mngon par 'dus byas pa ni brtag pa nyid kyis bsod nams mang du bskyed pa nyid dang mngon par 'dus byas pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la bskyed pa'i skyon med par 'dug pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon chub tu mngon par rdzogs par mtshar rgya bar mi nus pas @156b mi 'dod par thal ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal par rtog pa chung ngu'i 'bring ni mngon par 'dus byas pa ni brtag pa nyid kyis bsod nams mang du bskyed pa nyid dang mngon par 'dus byas pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la bskyed pa'i skyon med par 'dug pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon chub tu mngon par rdzogs par mtshar rgya bar mi nus pas @156b mi 'dod par thal ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The small-small path is the small-middling imagination, which is the generation of much merit by the imagination itself, the entry into the faultless state of the correct view by the imagination itself, and the inability to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di spong bas lam chen po 'bring ni //
analyzed: 'di spong bas lam chen po 'bring ni //
translated: The middling-small path is the abandonment of that.

original: rab 'byor mngon par byas pa de'ang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor mngon par byas pa de'ang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Subhūti, that imagination also appears as emptiness.

original: gsog nyid dang / gson nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid su sang ngo zhes bya bas snga ma mi sgom pa'i lam rnam par brgyad pa'i skabs kyi ma yin no zhes bsams pa'i don gyis lan brjod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsog nyid dang / gson nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid su sang ngo zhes bya bas snga ma mi sgom pa'i lam rnam par brgyad pa'i skabs kyi ma yin no zhes bsams pa'i don gyis lan brjod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the reply is that it is not the same as the eightfold path of non-cultivation mentioned earlier.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis ni /
translated: Among them, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, and the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa stong pa nyid du snang bar bshad do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa stong pa nyid du snang bar bshad do //
translated: explain the appearance of the emptiness of what is manifestly conditioned.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang ; chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa gsog nyid du snang bar bshad do //🔽'dus byas do /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang ; chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa gsog nyid du snang bar bshad do // 'dus byas do /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of the great, and the emptiness of the ultimate explain the appearance of the emptiness of what is manifestly conditioned as being worthless.

original: 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / tha ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyis ni de gsob nyid du snang bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / tha ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong ba nyid kyis ni de gsob nyid du snang bar bshad do //
translated: The emptiness of what is beginningless and endless, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, and the emptiness of intrinsic nature explain the appearance of the emptiness of what is manifestly conditioned as being insubstantial.🔽The emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of defining attributes, the emptiness of
