original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyi stong pa nyid dang // mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de snying po med pa nyid du snang bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyi stong pa nyid dang // mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de snying po med pa nyid du snang bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of own-character, the emptiness of non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence are explained as the appearance of its lack of essence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la shin tu bslabs pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la shin tu bslabs pa'o zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the great bodhisattva has trained well in the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence. This is what is stated by the logical reason.

original: yang mngon par 'dus byas pa ni go rims bzhin du go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa nyid du snang ba la sogs pa rnam par bzhir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang mngon par 'dus byas pa ni go rims bzhin du go cha dang 'jug pa dang tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas stong pa nyid du snang ba la sogs pa rnam par bzhir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the accumulation of the armor, engagement, accumulation, and definite emergence are respectively stated in terms of the four appearances such as the appearance of emptiness.

original: 'di ltar de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag go cha chen po bgos pa lags par rig par gyi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag go cha chen po bgos pa lags par rig par gyi ste /
translated: Thus, as I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said, these bodhisattva great beings are to be known as wearing the great armor,

original: gang 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni sgyu ma'i chos nyid lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni sgyu ma'i chos nyid lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because in this way, the emptiness of intrinsic identity is the reality of illusory phenomena.”

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung du ni grangs yod dang dang / gzhal du yod pa dang // tshad yod pa @157a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu'i chung du ni grangs yod dang dang / gzhal du yod pa dang // tshad yod pa @157a * //
translated: The small of the small conceptualization is included in the path of meditation, because it is subsumed by the realization of the small of the small degree of the small.

original: rtogs pas bsdus pas sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas sa dgu pa la de'i gnyen po lam gyi rnam par den po'i chen por je ltar 'gyur ba gang gsungs pa ni ji skad di /
analyzed: rtogs pas bsdus pas sgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas sa dgu pa la de'i gnyen po lam gyi rnam par den po'i chen por je ltar 'gyur ba gang gsungs pa ni ji skad di /
translated: In terms of the path of meditation, it is said that on the ninth ground, its antidote, the great aspect of the reality of the path, is cultivated.🔽It is said:

original: stong ba nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba sgom /
analyzed: stong ba nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba sgom /
translated: Abiding in emptiness,

original: pa'i lam rnam pa dgus bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba la /
analyzed: pa'i lam rnam pa dgus bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba la /
translated: the perfection of wisdom subsumed by the nine aspects of the path of meditation is cultivated.

original: bsod nams grang med pa dang gzhal du med pa dang tshad med pas bsdus pas /
analyzed: bsod nams grang med pa dang gzhal du med pa dang tshad med pas bsdus pas /
translated: because it is included in the immeasurable, incalculable and infinite merit.

original: dpe rnam pa gsum mthar phyin par byed pa'i don gyis yin no //
analyzed: dpe rnam pa gsum mthar phyin par byed pa'i don gyis yin no //
translated: It is the meaning of perfecting the three kinds of example.

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa la khyad par ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa la khyad par ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the difference between the incalculable and so on?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i don du yongs su dris pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i don du yongs su dris pa yin no //
translated: What is the distinction? This is a question about the meaning of the specific characteristics.

original: grangs yod pa dang // grangs med pa'i khams 'khor ba dang / nya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dag la grangs yong pa ma yin pa nyid dang grangs med pa nyid kyis de mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par shes par byed pa'i don gyis na rnams grangs med par yin no //
analyzed: grangs yod pa dang // grangs med pa'i khams 'khor ba dang / nya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dag la grangs yong pa ma yin pa nyid dang grangs med pa nyid kyis de mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par shes par byed pa'i don gyis na rnams grangs med par yin no //
translated: The incalculable is the meaning of the realization of the equality of the realms with and without number, in terms of the characteristics of samsara and nirvana, by means of their non-number and numberlessness.

original: dus rnams la ni tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis de rtogs na 'dus ma byas nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: dus rnams la ni tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis de rtogs na 'dus ma byas nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis tshad med pa yin no //
translated: Since time is not observed to have a measure, it is immeasurable. By understanding it to be immeasurable, one should understand it to be unconditioned.

original: gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul la dbang thob par shes par byed pa'i don gyis tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid kyis rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul la dbang thob par shes par byed pa'i don gyis tshad med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not possible to measure it, it is immeasurable. By understanding it to be immeasurable, one should understand that one has attained mastery over the domain of omniscience.

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The characteristics of the immeasurable, etc., are defined in terms of this characteristic of reality.

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyis na grangs med pa dang ; gzhal du med pa dang // tshad med pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyis na grangs med pa dang ; gzhal du med pa dang // tshad med pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since all phenomena are emptiness, they are immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless.

original: gal te de ltar yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
analyzed: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //
translated: The teachings on the immeasurable, etc.,

original: dam pa'i don du brjod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du brjod ma yin //
translated: Are not expressed in terms of ultimate reality.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don dam pa ni mngon par brjod pa tha dad pas kyang tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsam pa yin no //🔽kun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don dam pa ni mngon par brjod pa tha dad pas kyang tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bsam pa yin no // kun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
translated: The ultimate, which is the characteristic of emptiness, is not different even though it is expressed in different ways.🔽The Sage accepts that they are

original: rgyu mthun de dag thub pa bzhed //
analyzed: rgyu mthun de dag thub pa bzhed //
translated: the cause of compassion in the conventional.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: yi ge dang don dag la tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir na mngon par brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing bgrang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yi ge dang don dag la tha dad du bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir na mngon par brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing bgrang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Because they are not perceived as different, they are not to be expressed or enumerated.

original: nya ngan @157b las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nya ngan @157b las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Up to: ‘This is the teaching of the cause of the compassion of the Tathāgatas.’

original: gal te 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin na ni /
translated: If these are the teachings of the cause of the compassion of the Tathāgatas,

original: 'di dag thams cad kyi yul can du 'gyur dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi yul can du 'gyur dgos so zhe na /
translated: then they must be the objects of all of these.

original: gsol ba ni /
analyzed: gsol ba ni /
translated: The request is:

original: ji ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad rnams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dbang du byas
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa yin pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad rnams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dbang du byas
translated: The Tathāgata, from the perspective of having manifestly and completely awakened to all phenomena,

original: nas / chos thams cad brjod du ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nas / chos thams cad brjod du ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: has said, “All phenomena are inexpressible.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni brjod par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid ni brjod par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The emptiness of those cannot be expressed.”

original: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
translated: In regard to the inexpressible thing,

original: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
analyzed: nyams pa dang ni 'phel mi rung //
translated: There is no decrease and no increase.

original: sgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: sgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: By the path called “cultivation,”

original: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob //
analyzed: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob //
translated: What is decreased and what is obtained?

original: ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa chen pa'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu ni ci zhig nyams shing ji skad brjod pa chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa lam gyi rnam par dgu ni /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa chen pa'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu ni ci zhig nyams shing ji skad brjod pa chung ngu'i chung du la sogs pa lam gyi rnam par dgu ni /
translated: What is lost and what is gained in the nine aspects of the path, from the small of the small and so on,

original: ci zhig 'thob ces bya ba brtson pa yin te ;🔽ji skad du brjod du med pa'i son la nyam pa dang 'phel ba bkag pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'thob ces bya ba brtson pa yin te ; ji skad du brjod du med pa'i son la nyam pa dang 'phel ba bkag pa'i phyir na /
translated: is the effort to ask, “What is lost and what is gained in the nine aspects of the great of the great and so on, as described above?”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nas /
translated: Because the loss and increase of the path that is described above is refuted,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la nyams pa dang 'phel ba bkag pas rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur bar gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la nyams pa dang 'phel ba bkag pas rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur bar gsungs pa yin no /
translated: it is said that one would not be fortunate enough to attain complete enlightenment in omniscience.

original: 'di'i lan brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'di'i lan brjod pa ni //
translated: The answer to this is stated:

original: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du //🔽'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du // 'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
translated: Just as enlightenment,

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: this is what accomplishes the desired aim.

original: sgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the path of meditation.

original: ji skad du rtogs pa'i chos thams cad la dar 'dzin pa rnam par 'phel ba bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pa yongs su bsngo ba dang ldan pa de skal🔽ba dang ldan pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rtogs pa'i chos thams cad la dar 'dzin pa rnam par 'phel ba bkag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yid la byed pa la sogs pa yongs su bsngo ba dang ldan pa de skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “The one who dedicates with the thought that is like unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, by stopping the increase of grasping at the qualities of the Dharma, is endowed with good fortune.”

original: byang chub kyang ji lta bu yin zhes na /
analyzed: byang chub kyang ji lta bu yin zhes na /
translated: What is enlightenment like?

original: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid //🔽de yang de @158a * //
analyzed: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid // de yang de @158a * //
translated: Enlightenment is suchness as its characteristic.

original: yi mtshan nyid bzhed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: yi mtshan nyid bzhed // ces bya ba gsungs pa yin te //
translated: And that is accepted as its characteristic.🔽The suchness of form, up to the suchness of nirvana, is unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid nas nya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i nyams pa dang
analyzed: / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid nas nya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i nyams pa dang
translated: Thus, the one who practices the perfection of wisdom, by not seeing the suchness of form, up to the suchness of nirvana, does not fall into the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'phel ba bkag pas rjes su gnang ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phel ba bkag pas rjes su gnang ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since the increase is prohibited, it is permitted that the mind is the cause.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam 'bras bu dang rgyu dag phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa phyin ci ma log par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam 'bras bu dang rgyu dag phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa phyin ci ma log par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, cause and effect or effect and cause are said to be the unmistaken relationship of cause and effect because they mutually conform to the nature of each other.

original: de ltar byas na yang ;
analyzed: de ltar byas na yang ;
translated: Even if this is done,

original: sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
analyzed: sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
translated: the previous mind does not awaken

original: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //
analyzed: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //
translated: to enlightenment, nor does the later one.

original: ji skad du sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyi ma dag phan tshun phrad pa med pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa med pas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub
analyzed: ji skad du sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyi ma dag phan tshun phrad pa med pa'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa med pas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub
translated: As it is said, “Since the first and later arousals of mind do not mutually contact each other, there is no accumulation of roots of virtue that are properly accomplished over three measureless kalpas.

original: tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa gang zhig lags zhes zhus pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sems bskyed pa gang zhig lags zhes zhus pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is the arousal of mind that will awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?”

original: da ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how will it arise?

original: 'jig rten na grags pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa /
translated: It is renowned in the world.

original: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By the method of the example of the lamp,🔽it is said that the first and subsequent generation of the thought of enlightenment are not the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,🔽because they are the objects of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: ji skad du mar me'i snying po tshig pa'i dpes sems bskyed pa gnyis ka 'bras bu bcas par shes par byed pas sems bskyed pa de'i yul du gyur pas sa bcu slob pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par shes par byed pa
analyzed: ji skad du mar me'i snying po tshig pa'i dpes sems bskyed pa gnyis ka 'bras bu bcas par shes par byed pas sems bskyed pa de'i yul du gyur pas sa bcu slob pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par shes par byed pa
translated: The ten stages of learning are the objects of the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: nyid kyis sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin la //
analyzed: nyid kyis sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin la //
translated: It is said that the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is not by the first and subsequent generations of the thought of enlightenment alone,

original: de dag la ma brten par yang mngon par rdzogs par byan chub pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ma brten par yang mngon par rdzogs par byan chub pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and that the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is not without relying on them.

original: 'di ji ltar rnam par shes par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rnam par shes par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: zab mo'i chos nyid rnam par rgyud //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos nyid rnam par rgyud // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The profound reality is to be understood.

original: skabs 'di'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs 'di'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied as “is to be understood by the method of the example of the lamp.”

original: ji ltar rnam par brgyad yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par brgyad yin zhe na /
translated: How is it eightfold?

original: zab mo rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: zab mo rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The profound is eightfold.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?🔽Arising, cessation, suchness, the knowable,🔽knowledge, practice, nonduality,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs la mkhas pa zab pa nyid //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs la mkhas pa zab pa nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: and skill in means are the profound.🔽Therein, the profound arising is the profound dependent origination, because they do not arise from that, nor does perfect enlightenment exist without depending on them.

original: de la skye ba @158b zab pa ni de dag gis kyang ma yin de dag la ma brten par yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid dang / 'gag pa'i sems skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba @158b zab pa ni de dag gis kyang ma yin de dag la ma brten par yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa nyid dang / 'gag pa'i sems skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The profound cessation is the cessation of the mind of enlightenment, as it is said:

original: ji skad du rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji skad du rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhuti, what do you think?

original: sems gang 'gag pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sems gang 'gag pa de phyir skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Does the mind that ceases arise again?”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni lags so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni lags so zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Blessed One, it does not.”

original: 'gag pa zab pa ni sems skyes pa ni 'gag pa'i chos nyid kyis na de'i chos can la 'gag pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa zab pa ni sems skyes pa ni 'gag pa'i chos nyid kyis na de'i chos can la 'gag pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The profound cessation is that, since the mind that has arisen has the nature of cessation, its attribute is cessation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems //
translated: Subhuti, what do you think?

original: sems gang skyes pa de 'gag pa'i chos can yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sems gang skyes pa de 'gag pa'i chos can yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the mind that has arisen one that has the attribute of cessation?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'gag pa'i chos can lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gag pa'i chos can lags so //
translated: Blessed One, it has the attribute of cessation.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think?

original: 'gag pa'i chos can de 'gag par 'gyur snyam mam /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can de 'gag par 'gyur snyam mam /
translated: Is that which has the attribute of cessation one that will cease?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Blessed One, it is not.

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: skyes pa rtsam nyi na de 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir na 'gag pas zin pa ni de'i rang bzhi yin pas yang ci zhig 'gog tu yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rtsam nyi na de 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir na 'gag pas zin pa ni de'i rang bzhi yin pas yang ci zhig 'gog tu yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Since that which has arisen is directed toward cessation, that which is pervaded by cessation is its nature. So what is there to cease?

original: de bzhin nyid zab pa ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag gnas pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin par dgongs nas yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zab pa ni de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag gnas pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul yin par dgongs nas yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The profundity of suchness is that, just as it is, it is the object of the non-conceptual, as it is stated with the thought that it is the reality of the perfect.

original: shes bya zab pa ni de bzhin nyid las sems gzhan ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya zab pa ni de bzhin nyid las sems gzhan ma yin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The profundity of the knowable is that the mind is not different from suchness, as it is stated.

original: shes pa zab pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa zab pa ni /
translated: The profundity of knowledge is that

original: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: suchness does not see suchness, as it is stated.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Suchness does not see suchness.🔽The profundity of practice is the permission to practice the profound perfection of wisdom, because that practice does not practice anything at all.

original: spyod pa zab pa ni de ltar spyod pa de ni gang la yang mi spyod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la spyod pa rjes su gnang ba nyid dang // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: spyod pa zab pa ni de ltar spyod pa de ni gang la yang mi spyod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la spyod pa rjes su gnang ba nyid dang // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la ni lung bstan pa la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa med pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas pa la ni lung bstan pa la sogs pa kun tu spyod pa med pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And for one who abides in suchness, there is no engagement in the practice of prophecy, etc.

original: gnyis su med pa zab pa ni don dam pa'i spyod pa la ni gnyis su kun tu spyod pa med pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' @159a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zab pa ni don dam pa'i spyod pa la ni gnyis su kun tu spyod pa med pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' @159a * //
translated: The profundity of nonduality is that in the practice of the ultimate, there is no engagement in duality, and

original: la mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyi sbyor ba med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa nas //
analyzed: la mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes kyi sbyor ba med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no // thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa nas //
translated: for the bodhisattva, there is no engagement in the discrimination of signs and signlessness.🔽The profundity of skill in means is that, by the skill in means of blocking the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment without having completed the ten powers, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par rab byas par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba bkag pa'i thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis chos gang yang dngos po dang dngos
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par rab byas par ma byas par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba bkag pa'i thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis chos gang yang dngos po dang dngos
translated: up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, any dharma is blocked from being an entity or non-entity.

original: po med par bya ba bkag pa nyid dang // de ci'i slad di zhe na /
analyzed: po med par bya ba bkag pa nyid dang // de ci'i slad di zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pa la gnas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dang de la spyod pa'i sems can rnams de dang de'i gnyen po la 'god pas sems can yongs su smin pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du shes pa la gnas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dang de la spyod pa'i sems can rnams de dang de'i gnyen po la 'god pas sems can yongs su smin pa
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who abides in the knowledge that the defining characteristics of all phenomena are emptiness brings sentient beings to full maturity by establishing those who engage in this or that incompatible factor in the corresponding antidote.🔽🔽

original: la mkhas pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: la mkhas pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the skill in ripening sentient beings is the skill in the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of all phenomena.

original: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun bshad zin to /
analyzed: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun bshad zin to /
translated: The irreversible saṅgha of bodhisattvas in training who abide on the paths of seeing and meditation has been explained.

original: // / da ni mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam par nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam par nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to teach the characteristics of the irreversible saṅgha of bodhisattvas beyond training, the equality of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa will be described.

original: bslabs par bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad de //
analyzed: bslabs par bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad de //
translated: The training is just this:

original: 'di lta ste //
analyzed: 'di lta ste //
translated: It is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba dang // rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba dang // rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog par spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the conceptualization of defilement and the conceptualization of purification.

original: de gnyi mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas ni mi slob par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de gnyi mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas ni mi slob par 'gyur te //
translated: By realizing the sameness of those two, one becomes a non-learner,

original: de phan chad bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phan chad bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing further to learn beyond that.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir // chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir // chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: because phenomena are like dreams,

original: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //
translated: one does not conceptualize existence or peace.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di phan chad mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs yongs su gtugs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gnyi mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'khor ba rmi lam dang 'dra bar dgongs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyin mo sgom par
analyzed: 'di phan chad mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs yongs su gtugs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gnyi mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'khor ba rmi lam dang 'dra bar dgongs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyin mo sgom par
translated: From here on, in terms of the limit of the occasion of conceptualization of opposition and antidote, by realizing the sameness of those two, with the intention that samsara is like a dream, the daytime meditation of non-conceptual wisdom

original: rnam par 'phel ba bkag pas ni rmi lam du rtog pa sgom par rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa dang // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba bkag pas ni rmi lam du rtog pa sgom par rnam par 'phel ba bkag pa dang // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, because there is no conceptual thought in dreams and in the daytime.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par rtog pa yin @159b pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rmi lam dang nyin par ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par rtog pa yin @159b pa'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said by the reason that refutes the conceptual thought of the counteragent.

original: las med la sogs glan ka yi //
analyzed: las med la sogs glan ka yi //
translated: The response to the objection that there is no karma,

original: lan ni ji skad bshad par zad//
analyzed: lan ni ji skad bshad par zad//
translated: and so on, is just as explained.

original: de la las med par brtsad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la las med par brtsad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the objection that there is no karma:

original: rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i chos can yin na rmi lam dang 'dra bar dngos gzhi dang mjug gis bdugs pa'i nyams pa dang 'phel ba med par thal ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i chos can yin na rmi lam dang 'dra bar dngos gzhi dang mjug gis bdugs pa'i nyams pa dang 'phel ba med par thal ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If it has the property of being like a dream, then it follows that there is no increase or decrease of the dream-like by the main part and conclusion.”

original: 'di'i lan ni //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni //
translated: The response to that is:

original: 'on te sad nas yong su shes pa phyi mas rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on te sad nas yong su shes pa phyi mas rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: “But when one awakens, the subsequent consciousness conceptualizes it.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa ni ma yin na zhes bya bas las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa brda las byung ba nyid du nye bar bkod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa ni ma yin na zhes bya bas las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa brda las byung ba nyid du nye bar bkod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But he does not conceptualize it indicates that the connection between action and effect is merely a conventional symbol.

original: nyin par srog gcod pa byas pa gang yin pa dang rmi lam gyi nang di srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo nyid mngon par brjod par ro //
analyzed: nyin par srog gcod pa byas pa gang yin pa dang rmi lam gyi nang di srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo nyid mngon par brjod par ro //
translated: The phrase the killing that is done during the day and the killing that is done in a dream refers to the well-known terms day and night.

original: nang na smos pas ni 'khor ba'i rmi lam khyad par du bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: nang na smos pas ni 'khor ba'i rmi lam khyad par du bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word even is used to indicate that the dream of cyclic existence is to be distinguished from it.

original: tshe dang ldan ba sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ji skad smra zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su dris pas gnyen po 'gal ba yin yang rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'jug par thal bas de don dam pa nyid
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ji skad smra zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yongs su dris pas gnyen po 'gal ba yin yang rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'jug par thal bas de don dam pa nyid
translated: The phrase Venerable Śāriputra, what do you say about that action? is a question about the nature of reality. The response is a contradiction of the remedy, but it is also an implication of the engagement of conceptual thought.

original: du yang dag par ston pa'i don gyis de ltar brtsad pa yin no //
analyzed: du yang dag par ston pa'i don gyis de ltar brtsad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a dispute about the ultimate reality of that action, which is taught to be non-existent.

original: 'di'i lan ni //🔽'di'i lan ni //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni //🔽'di'i lan ni //
translated: The response to that is:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa las las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa med pa'i las skyed ba bkag pa'i phyir na slar de brda las byung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa las las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa med pa'i las skyed ba bkag pa'i phyir na slar de brda las byung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no /
translated: Because it is accepted that karma arises with reference, and because it is refuted that karma arises without reference, it is said that it arises again from signs.

original: sems dpa' thams cad dben pa yin pa'i phyir na de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' thams cad dben pa yin pa'i phyir na de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa yin no //
translated: Since all mental states are isolated, there is no object of reference. This is the objection.

original: 'di'i lan ni //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni //
translated: The reply is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan mar byas nas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan mar byas nas zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, having made a sign...

original: yongs su brtags pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos por khas blangs pa na rmi lam gyi nang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bal na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su brdos na yang dag pa'i myang dag pa ma yin par
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos por khas blangs pa na rmi lam gyi nang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bal na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su brdos na yang dag pa'i myang dag pa ma yin par
translated: When it is accepted that the object of reference is imagined, even the roots of virtue such as generosity in a dream, if dedicated to perfect complete enlightenment, are not dedicated to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: bsngos pa yin zhes dris pa ni brtsad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsngos pa yin zhes dris pa ni brtsad pa yin no //
translated: This is the question, which is the objection.

original: 'di'i lan ni /
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni /
translated: The reply is:

original: 'phags pa byams pa 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa mngon du byas pa yin pa'i phyir @160a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa mngon du byas pa yin pa'i phyir @160a * //
translated: This noble Maitreya has realized the three knowledges of a Buddha.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa 'di nyid kyis dri ba 'di'i lan ldon pa dbang du gyur pa yin no zhe sgang gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa 'di nyid kyis dri ba 'di'i lan ldon pa dbang du gyur pa yin no zhe sgang gsungs pa yin no /
translated: He is able to answer this question because he is only one birth away from Buddhahood.

original: don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: dri 'di'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas brgyud mar 'byung ba des na di dri ba 'di ni yongs su ma rdzogs bar bstan pa yin te //
analyzed: dri 'di'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas brgyud mar 'byung ba des na di dri ba 'di ni yongs su ma rdzogs bar bstan pa yin te //
translated: The question is not fully answered because it implies the succession of future Buddhas.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa yin na ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med par thal lo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa yin na ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba don med par thal lo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it were fully answered, it would follow that the appearance of future Buddhas would be pointless.

original: ji ltar na yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan pa yin zhe na //
translated: How is it that the question is not fully answered?

original: ming nas brtsams te chos thams cad lan sngon par byed pa'i dngos por dmigs su med pas so //
analyzed: ming nas brtsams te chos thams cad lan sngon par byed pa'i dngos por dmigs su med pas so //
translated: Because, beginning with the name, all phenomena are not perceived as entities that existed in the past.

original: de lta na yang 'di dag rang nyid kyis mngon du ma byas par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag rang nyid kyis mngon du ma byas par gnas pa yin no //
translated: However, they remain without being actualized by them.

original: de mngon sum du ma byas par dam bcas pa ni mngon du byas pa'i don pa dri ba de'i lan btab pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes pa yang spang ba'i don du yin te /
analyzed: de mngon sum du ma byas par dam bcas pa ni mngon du byas pa'i don pa dri ba de'i lan btab pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i nyes pa yang spang ba'i don du yin te /
translated: The promise not to actualize them is made in order to avoid the fault of completing the object of actualization,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang dag par chad pa chad pa med pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul yang dag par chad pa chad pa med pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he desires the uninterrupted continuity of the future Buddha lineage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi dmigs par spyod pa'i 'phags pa byams pa ni shes rab zab pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa na 'khor ba dang mya dan las 'das pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa'i mtshan ma rtogs pa dang ldan
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi dmigs par spyod pa'i 'phags pa byams pa ni shes rab zab pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa na 'khor ba dang mya dan las 'das pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa'i mtshan ma rtogs pa dang ldan
translated: Therefore, the noble Maitreya, who practices the six perfections without objectifying the three sectors, is shown to possess the sign of realization of the teaching of the differentiation of cyclic existence and nirvana by the profundity of his wisdom.

original: pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'khor ba dang nya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang nya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe dgongs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: When it is taught that cyclic existence and nirvana are the same, then, in terms of the power of the intention,

original: mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa la mi skrag pa la sogs pa de dag gis rdzogs par byang chub par nges pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa la mi skrag pa la sogs pa de dag gis rdzogs par byang chub par nges pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is certain that those who are not afraid of the practice of non-apprehension and so forth will fully awaken.

original: 'khor ba dang nya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang nya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The sameness of cyclic existence and nirvana has been explained.

original: // / da ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbye bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing kyi yongs su dag pa rnam par gnyis brjod par bya ba yin par des na /
analyzed: // / da ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbye bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing kyi yongs su dag pa rnam par gnyis brjod par bya ba yin par des na /
translated: Now, the complete purity of the buddha-field should be stated in terms of the division of the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
translated: The world of sentient beings and likewise

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ma dang pa //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ma dang pa //
translated: the world of the environment are impure.

original: de la dag par bsgrub pa yis //
analyzed: de la dag par bsgrub pa yis //
translated: Through the practice of purifying them,

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te //
translated: the buddha-field is completely pure.

original: sems can gyi 'jug rten gyi ma dag pa bkres pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por de la lha rdzas kyi nye bar spyad @160b pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang // snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ma dag pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jug rten gyi ma dag pa bkres pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por de la lha rdzas kyi nye bar spyad @160b pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang // snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ma dag pa /
translated: Whatever is the impurity of the world of sentient beings, such as hunger, etc., the antidote to that is the accomplishment of divine enjoyments, etc.

original: sdong dum dang // tsher ma la sogs pa gnag yin pa de'i gnyen por de lag mthil ltar mnyam par la sogs pa bsgrubs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dang pa yin te //
analyzed: sdong dum dang // tsher ma la sogs pa gnag yin pa de'i gnyen por de lag mthil ltar mnyam par la sogs pa bsgrubs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dang pa yin te //
translated: Whatever is the impurity of the world of the environment, such as stumps, thorns, etc., the antidote to that is the accomplishment of a buddha-field that is even like the palm of the hand, etc.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is in brief.

original: rgyas par ni do ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyas par ni do ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: In detail, it is just as in the sutra.🔽Having seen sentient beings with hunger, etc., one accomplishes the divine enjoyments and pleasures in one's own buddha-field, and practices the perfections.

original: sems can bkres pa la sogs pa mthong nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rig drug gi nye bar spyad pa dang yongs su spyod pa bsgrubs pas pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa dang // de bzhin dul srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang de'i 'bras bu las bzlog pa sgrub pa dang //
analyzed: sems can bkres pa la sogs pa mthong nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du lha rig drug gi nye bar spyad pa dang yongs su spyod pa bsgrubs pas pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa dang // de bzhin dul srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang de'i 'bras bu las bzlog pa sgrub pa dang //
translated: And likewise, one accomplishes the opposite of killing, etc., and their results.

original: gnod sems la sogs pa las bzlog pa dang // le lo la sogs pa las bzlog pa dang // sgrib pa snga dang // bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ma thob pa las bzlog pa dang // shes rab 'chal pa las bzlog pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pas go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba dang // yang rnag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can des pa dang // ma nges pa dang // log par des pa ste ;
analyzed: gnod sems la sogs pa las bzlog pa dang // le lo la sogs pa las bzlog pa dang // sgrib pa snga dang // bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ma thob pa las bzlog pa dang // shes rab 'chal pa las bzlog pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pas go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba dang // yang rnag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can des pa dang // ma nges pa dang // log par des pa ste ;
translated: The practice of the perfections is the practice of the six perfections, such as generosity, in order to attain the ten masteries, such as mastery over life, mind, and so forth.🔽The practice of the perfections is the practice of the six perfections, such as generosity, in

original: phung po gsum par gnas pa dang // dan song rnams dang // sdong dum dang // tsher ma la sogs pa yod pa dang // sa 'ji las grub pa'i sa chen po dang / da'i bar byed pa'i sems can yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rigs bzhi po rnams las bzlog pa nye bar bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: phung po gsum par gnas pa dang // dan song rnams dang // sdong dum dang // tsher ma la sogs pa yod pa dang // sa 'ji las grub pa'i sa chen po dang / da'i bar byed pa'i sems can yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rigs bzhi po rnams las bzlog pa nye bar bsgrubs pas so //
translated: and the three abodes, and the pretas, and the stumps and thorns, etc., and the great earth consisting of dust, and the beings who live in the space in between, and the four castes, are all completely eliminated.

original: de la de las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: de la de las bzlog pa ni 'di yin te //
translated: Here is the opposite of that:

original: ci nas kyang bdag sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na chung du na rigs bzhi'i sgra yang ma mi srid pa zhes gsungs pa yin te //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na chung du na rigs bzhi'i sgra yang ma mi srid pa zhes gsungs pa yin te //
translated: “In my Buddha-field in my Buddha-land, may there not even be the words ‘four castes’!”🔽Here, since the meaning of caste is denied, it is shown that the word “Brahmin” is just a sound, etc.

original: 'dis ni rigs kyi don bkag pa'i phyir na bram ze zhes bya ba 'di ni sgra tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa dang // sems can rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang // kha dog bzang po dang /
analyzed: 'dis ni rigs kyi don bkag pa'i phyir na bram ze zhes bya ba 'di ni sgra tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pa dang // sems can rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma dang // kha dog bzang po dang /
translated: And the beings who are best, middling, and worst, and those who are fair-skinned, dark-skinned, and in between, are all completely eliminated.

original: kha dog dan pa dang / chos kyi rgyal po'i bdag po las ma gtogs pa'i bdag po dang / dran po nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa las gcig pa nyid @161a * //🔽kyis 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / rdzus te skye ba ma gtogs pa'i skye gnas gsum po dang / mngon par shes pa dang bral ba dang / bshad gci la sogs pa 'dzag pa dang / 'od dang mi ldan pa dang / nyin mo dang /🔽mtshan mo dang / zla ba la sogs pa dang / tsho thung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed par nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: kha dog dan pa dang / chos kyi rgyal po'i bdag po las ma gtogs pa'i bdag po dang / dran po nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa las gcig pa nyid @161a * // kyis 'gro ba tha dad pa dang / rdzus te skye ba ma gtogs pa'i skye gnas gsum po dang / mngon par shes pa dang bral ba dang / bshad gci la sogs pa 'dzag pa dang / 'od dang mi ldan pa dang / nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang / zla ba la sogs pa dang / tsho thung ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bral ba dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed par nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: They are not the color of gold, they are not the lord of the Dharma, they are not the lord of the gods, they are not the same as the four establishments of mindfulness and so on,🔽they are not different migrating beings, they are not born from the three birth processes except miraculous birth, they are not endowed with higher perception, they do not emit urine and so on, they are not endowed with light, they are not endowed with day and night, they are not endowed with the moon and so on, they are not endowed with a short life span, they are not endowed with the thirty two marks of a great being and they are not endowed with roots of virtue that can serve the Buddha.🔽🔽

original: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang 'dus pas kun nas bslang ba'i nad skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la go rims bzhin du bsal ba dang / mi skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang 'dus pas kun nas bslang ba'i nad skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag la go rims bzhin du bsal ba dang / mi skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: It is the application of the conditions that are favorable to the elimination of the diseases of wind, bile, phlegm, and their combination, whether they have arisen or not.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mos pa dang / mngon pa'i rgyal can las bzlog nas ji ltar srid par rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa de dag bsgrubs pas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mos pa dang / mngon pa'i rgyal can las bzlog nas ji ltar srid par rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa de dag bsgrubs pas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba
translated: It is the accomplishment of the forms of excellence in one's buddhaverse, to the extent possible, by turning away from attachment and so on, from the aspiration for the vehicle of the sravakas and so on, and from the pride of the Abhidharma, and by accomplishing those forms of excellence.

original: dang / tshe dang / 'od dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun tshad yod pa las bzlog pas /
analyzed: dang / tshe dang / 'od dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun tshad yod pa las bzlog pas /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the perfection of the transcendences and the approximation of the knowledge of all the aspects of reality by turning away from the limited life span, limited light, and limited community of monks.

original: de dag tshad med par gyur pas na bdag nyid mngon par 'tshang rgya bar sems bskyed pa dang / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed bzung ba de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad zhing gcig tu gyur pa ni de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba thob
analyzed: de dag tshad med par gyur pas na bdag nyid mngon par 'tshang rgya bar sems bskyed pa dang / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji snyed bzung ba de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad zhing gcig tu gyur pa ni de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba thob
translated: The bodhisattvas' own generation of bodhichitta and their attainment of manifest, perfect buddhahood are immeasurable.🔽The worlds in all the buddha realms as many as the grains of sand in the river Ganges are transformed into a single realm.🔽This is the attainment of perfect buddhahood in unsurpassable, complete, perfect enlightenment.

original: par byed pa nyid dang / nam mkha' ltar mu med pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la 'khor rnams la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang med par yongs su rtogs pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen
analyzed: par byed pa nyid dang / nam mkha' ltar mu med pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams la 'khor rnams la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang med par yongs su rtogs pa'i yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen
translated: The bodhisattvas' complete perfection of the six transcendent perfections is due to their attitude of realizing that, in the infinite realms of sentient beings, like space, samsara and nirvana are nothing whatsoever.

original: pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa nyid dang / srid mo gangg'a'i lha mos de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs par khas blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @161b byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang /
analyzed: pa nyid dang yang nye bar gyur pa nyid dang / srid mo gangg'a'i lha mos de lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs par khas blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @161b byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang /
translated: and the goddess Gangātīrtha, who vowed to purify a buddha-field in that way, were prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by the root of merit of that vow.

original: 'khor rnams ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa thob par yid ches pas dbang du gyur pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor rnams ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs pa thob par yid ches pas dbang du gyur pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And the retinue, by believing that they would attain the purification of a buddha-field as explained, became receptive.🔽This is what was said.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bshad zin to /
translated: The purification of a buddha-field has been explained.

original: // / thabs la mkhas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / thabs la mkhas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Skill in means should be mentioned.

original: de la re zhig / yul dang sbyor ba can de ni //🔽ci zhig yin par brjod par bya //
analyzed: de la re zhig / yul dang sbyor ba can de ni // ci zhig yin par brjod par bya //
translated: Here, first,🔽what is it that is said to be

original: zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes 'brel to //
translated: related to the object?

original: de la thabs mkhas pa'i yul ni /
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pa'i yul ni /
translated: Here, the object of skill in means is

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Lord has said, “The bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom should become familiar with emptiness, and so on up to,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dris pa dang / de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgom pa zhugs pas thabs la mkhas pa'i yul nye bar bkod pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la yongs su 'dris pa dang / de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgom pa zhugs pas thabs la mkhas pa'i yul nye bar bkod pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: how should he become familiar with the emptiness of the compounded and the emptiness of the uncompounded?”

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of skill in means is

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: what the Lord has said, beginning with “Subhūti, when bodhisattvas discern emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all attributes, and so on up to,

original: yongs su 'dris par bsgom pa mngon du byed pa'i dus ma yin pa shes pa nyid kyi bar gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris par bsgom pa mngon du byed pa'i dus ma yin pa shes pa nyid kyi bar gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the time has not come to manifest the cultivation of familiarity with it.”

original: yang thabs ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang thabs ni rnam pa bcur 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: it is said:🔽Transcending enemies,

original: dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
analyzed: dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
translated: non-abiding, as it is, and power,🔽uncommon characteristics,🔽non-attachment, non-apprehension,🔽extinction of signs and vows,🔽its marks, immeasurables,

original: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and skillful means are tenfold.

original: de la bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs la mkhas pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs la mkhas pa 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is the skillful means for transcending the phenomena of obstacles:🔽It is like a man skilled in all the arts who is surrounded by enemies in a wilderness,🔽and is taught the skillful means for transcending the phenomena of enemies.🔽The meaning of this is understood as follows:🔽The realm of sentient beings to be protected is like the man.

original: skyes bu sgyu rtsal ma lus pa la byang ba zhig 'brog dgon par cha sa pa'i dpes yongs su bzung ba'i sems can gyi khams phyir rgol ba'i chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs mkhas pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu sgyu rtsal ma lus pa la byang ba zhig 'brog dgon par cha sa pa'i dpes yongs su bzung ba'i sems can gyi khams phyir rgol ba'i chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i thabs mkhas pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The wilderness is like the three realms.🔽The enemies are like the afflictions.🔽The skillful means for transcending the phenomena of enemies is like the skillful means for transcending the phenomena of afflictions.

original: mi gnas pa gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni 'dab chags bya bar snang la rgyu zhing sa la mi ltung ba'i dpes mi gnas @162a * //🔽par gnas pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa gnas pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni 'dab chags bya bar snang la rgyu zhing sa la mi ltung ba'i dpes mi gnas @162a * // par gnas pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Skill in the means of abiding without abiding is taught by the example of a bird flying in the sky and not falling to the ground, with the meaning of knowing the means of abiding without abiding.🔽Skill in the means projected by the force of aspiration is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.

original: smon lam gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang skyes bu 'phong la shin tu mkhas shing stobs dang ldan pas mda' brgyud mar 'phangs pa'i dpes smon lam gyi shugs kyis thabs la rjes su 'jug pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa🔽yin no // thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba'i bsam pas 'di ltar dka' ba'i gnas la sbyor ba na thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: smon lam gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang skyes bu 'phong la shin tu mkhas shing stobs dang ldan pas mda' brgyud mar 'phangs pa'i dpes smon lam gyi shugs kyis thabs la rjes su 'jug pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa🔽yin no // thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba'i bsam pas 'di ltar dka' ba'i gnas la sbyor ba na thun mong ma yin pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Skill in the extraordinary means is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.🔽Skill in the extraordinary means is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.🔽Skill in the extraordinary means is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.🔽Skill in the extraordinary means is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.🔽Skill in the extraordinary means is taught by the example of a very skilled and powerful archer shooting arrows in succession, with the meaning of knowing how to engage in the means by the force of aspiration.

original: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bsam gtan la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad las yongs su ma nyams shing mngon par 'phel bar brjod pas ro myang ba med pa'i thabs shes par
analyzed: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bsam gtan la sogs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad las yongs su ma nyams shing mngon par 'phel bar brjod pas ro myang ba med pa'i thabs shes par
translated: by the expression “without ever losing any of the virtues of the concentrations and so on, and by increasing them, one does not attain the fruits of stream enterer and so on.”

original: byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Skill in means of nonapprehending is what is stated in the sutra,🔽which is stated in order to make one understand the means of nonapprehending,

original: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas mi dmigs pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas mi dmigs pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: by the expression “one meditates on the door of liberation of emptiness through the concentration of emptiness.”

original: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas mtshan ma med pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas mtshan ma med pa'i thabs shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Skill in means with regard to the signless is what is taught for the sake of knowing the means of the signless, since it is the completion of the meditation on the door of liberation that is the concentration of the signless.

original: smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni yang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas smon pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Skill in means with regard to the wishless is what is taught for the sake of knowing the means of the wishless, since it is the completion of the meditation on the door of liberation that is the concentration of the wishless.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong pa yin du zin kyang de la thabs kyi khyad par yod pa'i don no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong pa yin du zin kyang de la thabs kyi khyad par yod pa'i don no //
translated: Even though emptiness and so on are shared in common with śrāvakas and so on, the point is that there are special means in the Mahāyāna.

original: de ltar spyod pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par ltung ba dang khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas pa med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gzhan gyis dris pa na phyir mi ldog pa'i rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par lung @162b ston pa dang lung mi ston pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges par bzung bas thabs ni de'i rtags su🔽shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par ltung ba dang khams gsum pa dang lhan cig gnas pa med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no // phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags kyi thabs la mkhas pa ni gzhan gyis dris pa na phyir mi ldog pa'i rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par lung @162b ston pa dang lung mi ston pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid du nges par bzung bas thabs ni de'i rtags su shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the practice is what is said to be the non-falling of the bodhisattva into non-performance, and the non-abiding of the bodhisattva together with the three realms.🔽The skill in means of the signs of irreversibility is the skill in means of the bodhisattva who is irreversible, which is to be understood as the sign of irreversibility by means of the prediction and non-prediction that are in accordance with the realization of irreversibility when questioned by others.

original: yul tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang rnam pa de ltar lan ldon bde dag ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis thabs kyi tshad med pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gang rnam pa de ltar lan ldon bde dag ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyis thabs kyi tshad med pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The skill in means of the immeasurable object is to be understood as the skill in means of the bodhisattva who is irreversible, which is the skill in means of the bodhisattva who is
