original: de de ltar byas na rnam pa dang / bcas pa dang / sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa dang / bar chad dang bcas pa dang / yul dang bcas pa dang / khyad par dang bcas pa dang / byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de de ltar byas na rnam pa dang / bcas pa dang / sbyor ba dang bcas pa dang / phan yon dang bcas pa dang / bar chad dang bcas pa dang / yul dang bcas pa dang / khyad par dang bcas pa dang / byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the clear realization of all aspects is endowed with aspects, endowed with practice, endowed with benefits, endowed with hindrances, endowed with objects, endowed with distinctions, endowed with activities,

original: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rten dang bcas pa dang / yan lag dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa dang / 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rten dang bcas pa dang / yan lag dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: endowed with natures, endowed with engagement, endowed with full maturation, endowed with supports, endowed with branches, endowed with sub-branches, and endowed with complete acceptance.

original: de la yul ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang yin pa de yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yul ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul gang yin pa de yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the object should be understood as the object characterized by cognition.

original: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin te /
translated: Engagement refers to the factors conducive to liberation,

original: de rnams kyis bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bstan pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because through them one engages in the teaching.

original: yongs su smin pa ni nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni nges bar 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Fully matured refers to the fully matured mind of those who are fit for penetration.

original: rten ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rten ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The support is the community of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: yan lag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The branch is the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: nye ba'i yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The subsidiary branch is the purification of the buddhaverse.

original: lhag ma ni go bar sla bas rnam par mi phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar sla bas rnam par mi phye'o //
translated: The rest is not analyzed because it is easily understood.

original: yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la khyad par ci zhig yod cen /
analyzed: yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la khyad par ci zhig yod cen /
translated: Again, what is the difference between the knowledge of all things and the complete clear knowledge of all things?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni rnam pa so sor nges pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni rnam pa so sor nges pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: The three knowledges have a specific object,

original: rnam pa so sor nges par ji skad bshad pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa so sor nges par ji skad bshad pas so //
translated: because they are specifically determined as explained.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa ma lus pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni rnam pa ma lus pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: The complete clear knowledge of all things has an object that is not specifically determined.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference.

original: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum du rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the establishment of the three knowledges is the characteristic.

original: @163a * // rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: @163a * // rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The realization of all aspects is the application.

original: yang na rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen pos rnam par gnas pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen pos rnam par gnas pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: Or else, the realization of all aspects is distinguished by the differentiation of the antidotes and the objects to be abandoned.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is not like that,

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par gzhan yin no //
translated: because it is by nature the aspect of peace. This is another difference.

original: de de ltar byas na /🔽rnam par sbyor ba dang bcas pa //
analyzed: de de ltar byas na / rnam par sbyor ba dang bcas pa //
translated: When it is done in this way,🔽it is the application

original: yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: with the characteristics of the qualities and faults.🔽The factors conducive to liberation and penetration

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: and the assembly of the learner who does not regress.

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang ; / zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang ; / zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
translated: The equality of existence and peace, and the purification of the buddha-fields,

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
translated: is the complete clear realization of all aspects.

original: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
translated: This is together with skill in means.

original: zhes gang brjod pa de ni 'dir bshad zin pa'i 'brel bas yin par blta bar bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
analyzed: zhes gang brjod pa de ni 'dir bshad zin pa'i 'brel bas yin par blta bar bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las /
translated: This should be seen as the connection with what has been explained here.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs de bzhin nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs de bzhin nyid kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: This concludes the chapter on suchness, the fourth chapter of the treatise on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the instruction on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The complete clear realization of all aspects has been explained.

original: // / da ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the clear realization of the peak should be explained.

original: de la re zhig gang gis 'di mtshon par 'gyur ba 'di'i rtags brjod par bya ba yin la de'ang rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang gis 'di mtshon par 'gyur ba 'di'i rtags brjod par bya ba yin la de'ang rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, its signs should be stated, by which it is indicated, and since those are of twelve kinds, therefore:

original: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
translated: Even in dreams, all phenomena

original: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
translated: One should view things as like a dream, and so on.

original: rtse mor phyin pa'i spyor ba'i rtags //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa'i spyor ba'i rtags //
translated: These are the signs of the perfection of the peak practice.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod /🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod / ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are held to be of twelve kinds.

original: de la rtags dang po ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la rtags dang po ni 'di yin no //
translated: The first sign is this:

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i chen po rmi lam gyi nang na 'ang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du lta ba dang / de bzhin du sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa'i chen po rmi lam gyi nang na 'ang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du lta ba dang / de bzhin du sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang /
translated: Subhuti, if a great bodhisattva, even in a dream, views all phenomena as like a dream, and likewise views all phenomena as like an echo, an optical illusion, a mirage,

original: sprul pa dang / skyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba nyid du chos thams cad la lta zhing mngon du mi byed na 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtse mo las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / skyu ma dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba nyid du chos thams cad la lta zhing mngon du mi byed na 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtse mo las phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a magical creation, a reflected image, a city of gandharvas, and does not actualize them, this should be known as the irreversible characteristic of the irreversible peak.

original: don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems @163b dpas rnal 'byor gyi chos sgom pa'i rtse mo thob pa gang yin pa ni rmi lam gyi nang na yang 'di'i rnal 'byor dang lhag mthong yid la byed pas sems can gyi khams la
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems @163b dpas rnal 'byor gyi chos sgom pa'i rtse mo thob pa gang yin pa ni rmi lam gyi nang na yang 'di'i rnal 'byor dang lhag mthong yid la byed pas sems can gyi khams la
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is fully engaged in wisdom and method, who has attained the peak of meditative concentration on the yoga of Dharma, even in dreams, with mental attention to yoga and insight,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: dwells with regard to the realm of sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa ni de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang khams gsum pa dag la 'dod pa dang phan yon gyi sems mi bskyed par gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa dang khams gsum pa dag la 'dod pa dang phan yon gyi sems mi bskyed par gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The second is that very bodhisattva who does not generate desire and benefit for the levels of śrāvakas and so on and the three realms.

original: gsum pa ni de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor chen pos bskor ba mthong zhing /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor chen pos bskor ba mthong zhing /
translated: The third is that very bodhisattva who sees the tathāgatas surrounded by a great retinue,

original: de dam pa'i chos ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thob pa zhes bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dam pa'i chos ston pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thob pa zhes bya bar gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and who attains the Dharma that is concordant with the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: bzhi pa ni yang de nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni yang de nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is what was said by him alone, “I see the miracles of the Buddha’s supernormal knowledge.”

original: lda pa ni yang de nyid 'jig pa'i gnas thams cad la khams gsum pa rmi lam dang 'dra bar chos ston pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lda pa ni yang de nyid 'jig pa'i gnas thams cad la khams gsum pa rmi lam dang 'dra bar chos ston pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The fifth is what was said by him alone, “I have the thought of attainment of the teaching that the three realms are like a dream in all the places of destruction.”🔽The sixth is what was said by him alone, “Having seen the hells and so on, I have attained the recollection of the abandonment of the evil destinies in my Buddha-field.”

original: drug pa ni yang de nyid sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa mthong nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spang ba rjes su dran pa thob pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: drug pa ni yang de nyid sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa mthong nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spang ba rjes su dran pa thob pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la 'khor ba'i rmi lam dang rmi lam gyi mtha' gang yin pa de dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la 'khor ba'i rmi lam dang rmi lam gyi mtha' gang yin pa de dag gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa nyid do //
translated: “The end of the dream of cyclic existence and the end of the dream are not two, they are not divided.”

original: zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what was said.

original: da la gnyis su med pa ni don to //
analyzed: da la gnyis su med pa ni don to //
translated: Here, nonduality is the meaning.

original: gnyis su byar med pa ni ldem por dgongs pas gnyis su byar mi nus pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa ni ldem por dgongs pas gnyis su byar mi nus pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Without a second” means that it cannot be made into a second by the intention of the Buddha.🔽

original: bdun pa ni rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi brlabs grub pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig grub pas ni sems can rnams kyi chos spang bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa nyid dang /🔽bar dang bcas pa dang bar med par grub pas ni sems can rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi brlabs grub pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin pa dang / de'i phyogs gcig grub pas ni sems can rnams kyi chos spang bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa nyid dang / bar dang bcas pa dang bar med par grub pas ni sems can rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The seventh is the non-return of the establishment of the truth-blessing of the pacification of the burning of the city, etc., in the states of dream and waking, and the non-return of the establishment of a part of that, and the accumulation of the karma of sentient beings that will result in the abandonment of the Dharma.

original: brgyad pa ni yang mi ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la phyir mi ldog pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi brlabs grub pas de 'gro ba dang / bdud kyi @164a * //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni yang mi ma yin pas byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la phyir mi ldog pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi brlabs grub pas de 'gro ba dang / bdud kyi @164a * //
translated: The eighth is the non-return of the establishment of the truth-blessing of the non-human beings who are blessed, and the non-return of the establishment of the karma of sentient beings that will result in the ripening of karma in this life.🔽The ninth is the non-return of the establishment of the truth-blessing of the non-human beings who are blessed, and the non-return of the establishment of the karma of sentient beings that will result in the ripening of karma in the next life.🔽The tenth is the non-return of the establishment of the truth-blessing of the non-human beings who are blessed, and the non-return of the establishment of the karma of sentient beings that will result in the ripening of karma in future lives.

original: byin gyi brlabs kyis song ba na rang nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas par byed pa de'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: byin gyi brlabs kyis song ba na rang nyid mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas par byed pa de'i mtshan nyid yin pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / yang bdud kyis de'i ming dang rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa rnam pa mang po bstan pa la slu bar byed pa nyid du ma rtogs pa dang / yang bdud kyis rang gis btags pa'i ming la sogs pas slu ba nye bar bstan pa la bdag gir byed pa dang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma bzung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / yang bdud kyis de'i ming dang rigs la sogs pa 'brel pa rnam pa mang po bstan pa la slu bar byed pa nyid du ma rtogs pa dang / yang bdud kyis rang gis btags pa'i ming la sogs pas slu ba nye bar bstan pa la bdag gir byed pa dang /
translated: Because they are not fully embraced by skill in means, they do not realize that Mara is deceiving them by teaching them many connections with their name, family and so on and they take as their own what Mara teaches as a deception by using the name and so on that he has designated.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi dang mtshams med pa lda pas kyang ming nye bar bstan pas mngon bar rlom pa ches lci ba nyid dang / yang bdud kyis dben pa'i yon tan nye bar ston pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyis dben pa rjes su gnang ba zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi dang mtshams med pa lda pas kyang ming nye bar bstan pas mngon bar rlom pa ches lci ba nyid dang / yang bdud kyis dben pa'i yon tan nye bar ston pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems kyis dben pa rjes su gnang ba zhes bya bas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The four root downfalls and the five heinous actions are also taught by the name, so the pride of the one who is very heavy and the one who is very light is destroyed.

original: gzhung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chags pa med par shes par byed pa'i don dang / go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag dben pa dang stong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid @164b du yod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chags pa med par shes par byed pa'i don dang / go rims bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag dben pa dang stong ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid @164b du yod pa nyid dang /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is to be known as the absence of attachment to the conceptual thoughts of the subject and object, and all phenomena exist as the reality of the perfection of wisdom because the path of no obstacles and the path of liberation are respectively the characteristics of voidness and emptiness.

original: de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de lta na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: If that were so, then the consequence would be that there would be no affliction and purification, and Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sems can rnams yun ring nas bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba de grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring nas bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la spyod dam zhes bya ba de grub pa yin no //
translated: Do sentient beings engage for a long time with “I” and “mine”?

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is established.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni de ltar spyod pa ni zil gyis mi nod par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni de ltar spyod pa ni zil gyis mi nod par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The twelfth is the statement that the practice in that way is the approach to the knowledge of all aspects without being overcome by it.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gang gis mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags bshad zin to /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gang gis mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags bshad zin to /
translated: The clear realization of the peak has already been explained as the sign by which it is indicated.

original: // / da ni de'i rnam par 'phel ba gang zhig yin zhe na /🔽'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed //🔽sang rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //🔽rnam mang du ni dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: // / da ni de'i rnam par 'phel ba gang zhig yin zhe na / 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed // sang rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs // rnam mang du ni dper mdzad nas //
translated: Now, what is its increase?

original: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the sixteen increases🔽of the merit of offering to the buddhas

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so /
translated: and so on, which are exemplified🔽in many ways by the beings of Jambudvīpa.

original: de la rnam par 'phel ba dang po ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: de la rnam par 'phel ba dang po ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The first increase is as follows.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can gyi grangs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la rim grong bya ba la sogs pa mchod pa byas te dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sdo bar byed pa bas shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can gyi grangs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la rim grong bya ba la sogs pa mchod pa byas te dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sdo bar byed pa bas shes rab kyi pha
translated: Compared to someone who serves the Tathāgatas and makes offerings to them, such as by providing them with the requisites, and then dedicates the root of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, someone who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others and is not separated from attention endowed with the perfection of wisdom increases merit much more than that.

original: rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan dag la ston pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod pa nas ;
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan dag la ston pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba de bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod pa nas ;
translated: Similarly, compared to someone who establishes all the sentient beings in a great billionfold world system in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, someone who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others and is not separated from attention endowed with the perfection of wisdom increases merit much more than that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i ba'i bar bas cig shos kyi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sdo bar byed pa'i ba'i bar bas cig shos kyi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'og tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dka' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa nyid yin pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i 'og tu byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dka' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa nyid yin pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because, after that Tathagata, he abides in love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is

original: skyes bu zhig gi sa nor bu rin po che chen po rnyed ma myong ba zhig rnyed pa las yang stor bar gyur pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu @165a * //
analyzed: skyes bu zhig gi sa nor bu rin po che chen po rnyed ma myong ba zhig rnyed pa las yang stor bar gyur pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gcig tu @165a * //
translated: like the example of a man who never found a great precious jewel, but then found it, and then lost it.

original: gtod pa'i yid la byed pa nyid dang / yid la byed pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir de dag dang ma bral ba nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gal to chos thams cad de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dang ma bral ba yin te zhes bya ba na brtsams te ;🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas mi 'bral ba nyid du bsgrubs pas gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽gsum pa ni /🔽rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med da zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gtod pa'i yid la byed pa nyid dang / yid la byed pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa'i phyir de dag dang ma bral ba nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gal to chos thams cad de lta bu'i rang bzhin can dang ma bral ba yin te zhes bya ba na brtsams te ; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa bkag pas mi 'bral ba nyid du bsgrubs pas gang gsungs pa yin no // gsum pa ni / rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med da zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and the attention of entrusting, because all attention is empty of intrinsic reality, it would follow that they are not without that.🔽And if all phenomena are not without that nature, then it would be as if one were to begin with the statement, “All phenomena are not without that nature,” and then prove that they are not without it by refuting the increase and decrease of the perfection of wisdom.🔽🔽The third is from the passage beginning:🔽Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, there is no increase or decrease.🔽🔽

original: rab 'byor bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ye shes chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ye shes chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas med do //
translated: Subhūti, it is impossible that a great bodhisattva being who has such patience as that would not attain the knowledge of a One-Gone-Thus, the great knowledge, the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du de la gzhol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du de la gzhol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is because from the time of setting out for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment until the time of manifestly and completely awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he is directed toward that.

original: bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourth is:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mi skyes ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bla na med pa yang dad par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad mi skyes ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bla na med pa yang dad par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram ci lags /
translated: “Bhagavan, is it the case that a bodhisattva great being is predicted to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment because all phenomena are non-arisen?”

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Subhūti, it is not so.

original: rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par rtogs pa de lta bu thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par rtogs pa de lta bu thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva who practices this has no such conceptualization at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the realization of the peak is in the perfection of wisdom, because there is no conceptualization there.

original: lda pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa bkag pas de la slob pa'i bsod nams mang po nye bar @165b dgod pa'i don dang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge
analyzed: lda pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par brtson pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan ngon dang ldan pa bkag pas de la slob pa'i bsod nams mang po nye bar @165b dgod pa'i don dang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge
translated: The second shows the great merit of training in that, by way of refuting that those who strive in the perfection of wisdom possess only a little root of virtue.

original: ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa bas chos 'di la mngon par brtson pa dang ldan pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa bas chos 'di la mngon par brtson pa dang ldan pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba nyid dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de 'jig rten thams cad na nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa thams cad zil gyis man nan te nges par 'byung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'jig rten thams cad na nyan thos la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa thams cad zil gyis man nan te nges par 'byung ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is said that he surpasses all the world, the Sravakas, etc., and all the Bodhisattvas who are not skilled in means, and that he is destined for the supreme enlightenment.

original: drug pa ni de ltar spyod pa la lha'i tshogs thams cad nye bar 'dod par sems par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa rnams dang khams mi mnyam pas kun nas bslang ba'i nad la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni de ltar spyod pa la lha'i tshogs thams cad nye bar 'dod par sems par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa rnams dang khams mi mnyam pas kun nas bslang ba'i nad la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sixth is that the hosts of gods think of him as worthy of worship, and it is said that he is protected from harm by others and from sickness, etc., which arise from an imbalance of the elements.

original: bdun pa ni slob pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las gang yang rung ba zhig thob par 'gyur ba la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud rnams the tshom du 'gyur ba dang /🔽yang de rnams mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ba dang / yang de rnams skar mda' ltung ba gtong ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa ni slob pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos la sogs pa'i sar ltung ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba las gang yang rung ba zhig thob par 'gyur ba la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdud rnams the tshom du 'gyur ba dang / yang de rnams mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ba dang / yang de rnams skar mda' ltung ba gtong ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig can tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin te /
translated: The seventh is that when training, the bodhisattva falls to the śrāvaka level and so on, and when attaining any of the three types of enlightenment, the māras of the trichiliocosm have doubts,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: they are tormented by the pain of sorrow, they display shooting stars and so on, and it is said, “Ānanda, the evil māras do not come before all bodhisattvas with the intention of harming them.”

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs su chos 'di la lhag par ma mos pa dang / de la the tshom zha bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la sogs pa dam pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dzin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs su chos 'di la lhag par ma mos pa dang / de la the tshom zha bar gyur pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la sogs pa dam pa'i chos ma yin pa 'dzin par byed pa dang /
translated: In former lives, they had no special interest in this teaching, they had doubts about it, they were separated from spiritual guides, they held to what is not the holy Dharma, such as the Lokayata philosophy,

original: de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pas ci zhig bya zhes zer zhing rnam par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pa dang / nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zhag gzhan rnams dang lhan cig 'thab cing mtshan 'bru ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa 'di thos pas ci zhig bya zhes zer zhing rnam par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pa dang / nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zhag gzhan rnams dang lhan cig 'thab cing mtshan 'bru ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: they spoke in dispraise of it, they said, “What is the use of your hearing this perfection of wisdom?” and they were contemptuous of other bodhisattvas, and they quarreled with and criticized other followers of the Disciple and Bodhisattva Vehicles.

original: lung ma bstan pa lung bstan pa la gnod par sems pa dang ldan pa la @166a * //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa lung bstan pa la gnod par sems pa dang ldan pa la @166a * //
translated: They were full of malice toward those who had received predictions and those who had not.

original: ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi gtong na de snyed kyi bskal par dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgo bar khas blang ba nyid dang / sngar bstan pa'i ltung ba sdom pa dang ldan pa ni lus kyi sgrib pa de las ldang ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ni bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur bas des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi gtong na de snyed kyi bskal par dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgo bar khas blang ba nyid dang / sngar bstan pa'i ltung ba sdom pa dang ldan pa ni lus kyi sgrib pa de las ldang ba nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And the one who possesses the vow of the downfalls taught above is said to rise from that physical obscuration.🔽The eighth is the equality of training, because one remains in the same vehicle as the teacher, and the equality of the object of training, which is taught by the statement:🔽“Form is empty of form, and so on up to:🔽Enlightenment is empty of enlightenment.”🔽The ninth is the equality of the three times, because the past and future are not different from the present.

original: brgyad pa ni ston pa la ji ltar ba bzhin du theg pa mtshungs pa rnams la gnas par byed pa'i phyir bslab pa mnyam pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni ston pa la ji ltar ba bzhin du theg pa mtshungs pa rnams la gnas par byed pa'i phyir bslab pa mnyam pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The tenth is the equality of the three vehicles, because the three vehicles are not different.🔽The eleventh is the equality of the two truths, because the ultimate is not different from the relative.🔽The twelfth is the equality of the two obscurations, because the afflictive obscuration is not different from the knowledge obscuration.🔽The thirteenth is the equality of the two benefits, because the benefit for oneself is not different from the benefit for others.🔽The fourteenth is the equality of the two accumulations, because the accumulation of wisdom is not different from the accumulation of merit.🔽The fifteenth is the equality of the two purities, because the purity of the object is not different from the purity of the subject.

original: bya ba chub ni byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bslab ba mnyam pa nyid kyi yul nye bar dgod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba chub ni byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bslab ba mnyam pa nyid kyi yul nye bar dgod pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sixteenth is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The seventeenth is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The eighteenth is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The nineteenth is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The twentieth is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The twenty-first is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The twenty-second is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.🔽The twenty-third is the equality of the two aspects, because the aspect of the object is not different from the aspect of the subject.

original: dgu pa ni /
analyzed: dgu pa ni /
translated: The twenty-fourth is the

original: bcom ldan 'das ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs bas par bgyi ba'i slad du slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs bas par bgyi ba'i slad du slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhuti: If a Bodhisattva, a great being, trains in the level of a Bodhisattva, does he train in the knowledge of all modes?

original: gang gi bsam gtan la sogs pa la yang snyoms par 'jug la de dag gi dbang gis skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi bsam gtan la sogs pa la yang snyoms par 'jug la de dag gi dbang gis skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti: If a Bodhisattva, a great being, trains in the level of a Bod

original: zhes bya bas yongs su dag pa'i bslab pa brjod pas bslab pa rnam par 'phel ba'i khyad par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyis de ltar ma shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa gang yin pa 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽bcu pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas yongs su dag pa'i bslab pa brjod pas bslab pa rnam par 'phel ba'i khyad par shes par byed pa'i don dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir de mi 'thad pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyis de ltar ma shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa gang yin pa 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no // bcu pa ni /
translated: It is also stated because it is not tenable that the nature of all phenomena is pure, and because it is tenable that bodhisattvas train in omniscience because ordinary beings do not understand it in that way.🔽The tenth is stated in order to indicate the meaning of the rarity of attaining the increase of the realization of the peak of the buddha lineage through the example of the rarity of the occurrence of fine gold.

original: gser sa le sbram 'byung ba'i gnas nyung ba'i dpes sangs rgyas kyi rigs rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa mngon par 'phel ba thob par nyung ba nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽bcu gcig pa ni /
analyzed: gser sa le sbram 'byung ba'i gnas nyung ba'i dpes sangs rgyas kyi rigs rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa mngon par 'phel ba thob par nyung ba nyid yin par shes par byed pa'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽bcu gcig pa ni /
translated: The eleventh is stated in order to indicate the meaning of the rarity of attaining the increase of the realization of the peak of the buddha lineage through the example of the rarity of the occurrence of fine gold.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i las yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'i sems can nyung ba'i dpes rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa rnyed pa ni ches nyung ba nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis @166b gang gsungs
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i las yang dag par blangs te gnas pa'i sems can nyung ba'i dpes rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa rnyed pa ni ches nyung ba nyid du shes par byed pa'i don gyis @166b gang gsungs
translated: The example of the few beings who take up and abide in the karma of becoming a universal monarch illustrates that the attainment of buddhahood, the result of the realization of the peak, is very rare.🔽

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of what was said is that the result of the peak realization is the attainment of buddhahood, which is to be understood as being very rare, as illustrated by the rarity of beings who take up and abide in the karma of becoming a universal monarch.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni /
translated: The twelfth is

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: what was said by the non-arising of the mind that is the opposite of the six perfections.

original: bcu gsum pa ni /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni /
translated: The thirteenth is

original: yang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the non-arising of the mind that is endowed with form and so on, and the reason for that is

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la dmigs su med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la dmigs su med pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: what was said by the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices this perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the peak realization, that all phenomena are unobservable.

original: bcu bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourteenth is

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpes /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpes /
translated: that, by the example of the afflicted view of the self,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus pa nyid du gnag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus pa nyid du gnag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said that all perfections are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bco lnga pa ni /
analyzed: bco lnga pa ni /
translated: The fifteenth is

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'i rgyu nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa'i rgyu nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that it is said that training in the perfection of wisdom is the cause for attaining all perfections.

original: gal te de lta yin na de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be a śrāvaka or a pratyekabuddha.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa dang / mthong bas rnam par bltas nas 'da' bar bya ste zhes gsungs te /🔽rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du mthong ba zhes smos pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa dang / mthong bas rnam par bltas nas 'da' bar bya ste zhes gsungs te / rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du mthong ba zhes smos pa yin la /
translated: Therefore it is said, “One should transcend the perfections of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas by looking at them with knowledge and seeing.”🔽The word “seeing” is stated in order to eliminate inferential cognition.

original: 'khrul pa'i mthong ba bsal ba'i don du shes pa zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mthong ba bsal ba'i don du shes pa zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: The word “knowledge” is stated in order to eliminate deluded seeing.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba'i tshig gis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag la ni byang chub sems dpa' sgom pa'i lam yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba'i tshig gis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag la ni byang chub sems dpa' sgom pa'i lam yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The words knowledge and seeing are for the purpose of understanding that the path of cultivation does not exist for the bodhisattva on the levels of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: yang rgyu ci zhig gi phyir de la 'di'i sgom pa'i lam bkag ce na /🔽rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: yang rgyu ci zhig gi phyir de la 'di'i sgom pa'i lam bkag ce na / rgyun tu zhugs pa nas /
translated: Again, what is the reason that the path of cultivation is blocked for him?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spang ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spang ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said that the knowledge and abandonment of the stream-enterer up to the pratyekabuddha are the acceptance of the bodhisattva.

original: gzhan gtsor byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gtsor byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he makes others primary, that is the meaning.

original: 'da' bar bya ba yang rnam pa thams cad mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar bya ba yang rnam pa thams cad mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: And the transcendence is the entry into the realization of all aspects.

original: rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba bcu drug pa ni /
translated: The sixteenth increase:

original: gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: If he thinks, This is the perfection of wisdom, up to...

original: de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa la slob pa rjes su gnang bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang @167a * //🔽nye bar gyur pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bkag pa la slob pa rjes su gnang bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang @167a * // nye bar gyur pa nyid du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The permission to train in the cessation of conceptualization of its object is the statement that one has become close to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: gang gis de rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'phel ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: gang gis de rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par 'phel ba bshad zin to /
translated: The increase of the peak realization that causes that increase has already been explained.

original: // / da ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'di'i nges par bstan par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa brjod par bya ba yin te /🔽des na / kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: // / da ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'di'i nges par bstan par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa brjod par bya ba yin te / des na / kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
translated: Now, since it has become one's nature, the aspect of its demonstration should be stated.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
translated: The complete, unsurpassed knowledge of all phenomena🔽is the teaching that is expressed

original: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
analyzed: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
translated: as not abandoning the welfare of sentient beings.🔽The three omnisciences

original: bstan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are the complete, unsurpassed knowledge of all phenomena.

original: 'di la re zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pas kyang sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na /
analyzed: 'di la re zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pas kyang sems can thams cad zil gyis gnon na /
translated: Here, first, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of generosity up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas surpasses all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas lta ci smos zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas lta ci smos zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What need is there to mention that having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment,🔽up to those are to be desired?

original: de dag ni 'dod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i nges par bstan pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ni rnyed dka' bar shes par byed pa'i don gyis bstan pa dang / me tog man dar ba nye bar gtor ba dang /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i nges par bstan pa'i gnas skabs thob pa ni rnyed dka' bar shes par byed pa'i don gyis bstan pa dang / me tog man dar ba nye bar gtor ba dang /
translated: This teaches the stage of the teaching of ascertainment of the peak realization, with the meaning of making known that it is difficult to obtain, and the scattering of coral tree flowers,

original: mngon du phyogs te gtor ba dang ; rab tu khyab par gtor ba las mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa'i tshig dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs te gtor ba dang ; rab tu khyab par gtor ba las mchod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa'i tshig dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rnams dang /
translated: The virtue of offering is dedicated to the perfection of the qualities of the buddhas by the bodhisattvas, as taught in the lines:🔽By scattering offerings, scattering them in all directions, and scattering them everywhere, the roots of virtue of offering are dedicated to the perfection of the qualities of omniscience,

original: rang byung gi chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su rdzogs par bsngo ba de bshad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang byung gi chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su rdzogs par bsngo ba de bshad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the qualities of self-arising, and the uncontaminated qualities, which is to say, the perfection of the three omnisciences.

original: ji ltar na sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they never abandon the welfare of sentient beings?

original: de lta bu'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ltung ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ltung ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon falling into nirvana at the time of possessing such realization,

original: snying rje chen po la mngon du phyogs pa'i bsam pas sems can ma brgal ba bsgral ba la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / ji ltar srid par rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por mthong ba dang sgom @167b pa'i lam dag gi rtogs pa po rnam pa bzhi bsnyad pa'i phyir na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la mngon du phyogs pa'i bsam pas sems can ma brgal ba bsgral ba la sogs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / ji ltar srid par rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por mthong ba dang sgom @167b pa'i lam dag gi rtogs pa po rnam pa bzhi bsnyad pa'i phyir na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa dang /
translated: The generation of the enlightenment mind of liberating those not liberated and so on through the intention of directly facing great compassion, and the four realizations of the paths of seeing and meditation that are the antidotes to the four types of conceptions of existence are explained in order to explain the four types of newly entered,

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po de bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi po de bstan pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: engaged in conduct, irreversible and obstructed by a single birth.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin rnams bshad par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin rnams bshad par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, since the concentrations are to be explained,🔽the four continents, the one thousand,

original: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
translated: the two and three thousand worlds are taken as examples

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: and through the many merits

original: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
translated: the concentrations are proclaimed.
